loans.name: Rose Mae Ann

texts.en:
Rose Mae Ann works hard to support her family. Rose Mae Ann is married and has a shell-crafts business in the Philippines.

Rose Mae Ann requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like nylon, shells, etc. for her shell-crafts business.

Rose Mae Ann has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.

In the future, Rose Mae Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like nylon, shells, etc. for her shell-crafts business.

loans.name: Missimide 3 Group

texts.fr: MISSIMIDE 3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier et mènent certaines activités ensemble. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien nommé Calixte. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Antoinette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Antoinette n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs quinze ans, Antoinette prépare de la bouillie de maïs accompagné de gâteaux (faits à base de farine de blé) dans une ville du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Antoinette  vend divers autres articles. Antoinette achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la cinquième fois que Antoinette et les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE 3 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
MISSIMIDE 3 is a group of three persons who all reside in the same district and have certain common activities. The representative of the group,  Antoinette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 46 and is married to a mechanic named Calixte. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school and in their care. Antoinette lives together with her husband and her children. The couple share in supporting their family. 

Antoinette did not attend school. For about 15 years, Antoinette has been preparing maize porridge with cookies (made of wheat flour) in a town in  Bénin. Secondarily, she sells various other articles. She buys her supplies in Bénin. It's the fifth time that Antoinette and the other members of the group called MISSIMIDE 3 are requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to add to their working capital and grow their businesses so as to better serve their clientele.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Kitabani A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kitabani A Group in Western Kenya! Everline is the facilitator of the Kitabani A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Everline takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Everline had a very good maize yield harvesting seven bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everline was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Everline will educate her children and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Kitabani A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 26 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Koffi travaille comme revendeur de produits alimentaires depuis 2009. Il vend à la maison après achat au Grand Marché de Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Koffi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de farine de blé, des bidons d’huile des sacs de riz. 
Dans les prochaines années, Koffi voudrait agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Koffi is a 26-year-old man. He is unmarried and has no children.
Koffi has worked as a retailer selling food products since 2009. He sells his goods at home after buying them at the Grand Market in Lomé. His main challenge is fighting a slump in sales.
Koffi has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of wheat flour, cans of oil, and bags of rice.
In the coming years, Koffi would like to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To buy general food products.

loans.name: Marta Luz

texts.es: Marta Luz  de 63 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su querido hijo el cual es todo para ella. Marta es muy trabajadora, dedicada y luchadora. Hace ya varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia en la cual vende variedad de productos como: lácteos, verduras, cereales, detergente, entre otros. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha mantenido su tiendita y gracias a Dios y al árduo trabajo que día a día realiza los resultados obtenidos han sido favorables. Además su carisma es incomparable para ella lo más importante es que sus clientes siempre estén satisfechos con el servicio que reciben. El negocio está ubicado en una zona muy concurrida y visitada por muchas personas en especial el negocio de Marta que cada día son más las personas que se acercan en busca de los productos que ella ofrece. Su sueño es seguir manteniendo activo su negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos y de esta forma ha llevado el pan de cada día a su casa. Por todo lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para invertir en su negocio en la compra de productos de tienda  teles como: Lácteos, verduras, arroz, frijoles, sal, azúcar, leche, detergente y de mas productos que permitan a traer a mas clientes de tal forma que pueda lograr su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Marta guarda un profundo agradecimiento con INTEGRAL ya que gracias a la confianza que le prestaron en el pasado, logró establecer su negocio y seguir operando. Espera que esta vez la institución deposite de nuevo la confianza en ella.
texts.en:
Marta Luz is 63 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her much-loved son, who is her world.  Marta is very hard-working, dedicated, and committed.  

Several years ago, she was able to establish a small store in her home, from where she sells a variety of products such as dairy products, vegetables, cereals, and detergent among other things.  With great effort and dedication she has been able to keep up her little store, and thanks to God and to her hard work, she has been able to get favorable results on a daily basis.  In addition, she has incomparable charisma and the most important thing to her is that her customers are always satisfied with the service they receive.

The business is located in a very busy area, which is visited by many people. Marta's store in particular has increasing numbers of people who come there looking for the products that she offers for sale.

Her dream is to continue keeping her business active as it is her main source of income, and in this way she can earn her daily bread.  For all the preceding reasons, she has taken the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business.  She will purchase products for her store such as dairy products, vegetables, rice, beans, salt, sugar, milk, detergent and other products that will allow her to bring in more customers in such a way that she will be able to achieve her objective of improving her quality of life and that of her family.

Marta has a profound gratitude towards INTEGRAL, as thanks to the trust that they have placed in her in the past, she has been able to establish her business and keep it going.  She hopes that on this occasion the institution will once again show confidence in her.

loans.use: to buy products for her store, such as dairy products, vegetables, rice, beans, salt, sugar, milk and detergent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jewelry and bazin [ornamental fabric].

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод уже пять лет как занимается торговлей. Он продает хозяйственные товары и телевизоры. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Дилшод имеет высшее образование. По профессии он экономист. Он живет вместе с родителями. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Dilshod has been working in retail for five years and sells household supplies and televisions. He is 26 years old, married and has a young child. Dilshod has a college degree in economics but his family still lives with his parents. Dilshod is applying for this loan so that he can expand his inventory.

loans.use: to purchase DVDs and parabolic antennas

loans.name: Karla Martina

texts.es:
Karla, habitante de uno de los barrios más populares y pintorescos de la ciudad de León, tiene 42 años de edad , es comerciante , se dedica a la venta de ropa usada , es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad respectivamente . Su negocio lo tiene por herencia de su madre quien era la que vendía pero por su edad avanzada se retiró pero durante ese tiempo Karla aprendió  del negocio ya lleva 10 años que ella misma administra y vende su esposo la apoya en el hogar con lo que gana como mecánico industrial. 
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de una paca de ropa usada. Pues este tipo de  mercadería genera buenas ganancias se vende a muy buen precio la posibilidad de comprar este tipo de mercadería es muy accesible para los clientes. Uno de sus planes es mejorar infraestructura de su negocio y comprar pacas de ropa de niño y adultos.
texts.en:
Karla, a resident of one of the most popular and picturesque neighborhoods of the city of Leon, is 42 years old, is a merchant, sells used clothing, is married, and has 2 children of 17 and 14 years old respectively.  She acquired her business by inheritance.  Her mother used to sell but since she in now in advanced years she has retired, but during that time Karla learned about the business and it has now been 10 years since she herself has administered and sold.  Her husband supports her at home with what he makes as an industrial engineer.
She asked for the loan to buy a bale of used clothing for this type of merchandise generates good profits. It is sold at a good price and the possibility of buying this type of merchandise is very accessible to the customer.  One of her plans is to improve the infrastructure of her business and to buy bales of children and adult clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 32 years old, married and has three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling fish and earns a monthly income of Kes 12,000. She is applying for her second loan from KADET Ltd., for Kes 45,000, to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income earned as a result of this loan to expand her business and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy is 42 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and three children in Battambang Province, Cambodia.  She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over 10 years and enjoy successful careers growing rice and fishing.  Additionally, her husband is a motor taxi driver and one of her children is a dealer in the casino. 

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Savy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi.  The purchase of a new motorbike would allow her husband to attract more customers and earn more money to support the family.  

In the future, she would like to purchase piglets to breed and sell for a profitable price once they gain weight.  In addition, she plans to build a new house and support her children while they study to earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as motor taxi.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a woman who attended school up to middle school, Rebecca sells items like soaps, washing detergents, Dettol (a specific brand of soap) in Elmina, near Cape Coast. She is married to a waiter and has no children. 

Rebecca has been in her business for years now. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay for the family's utility bills.

Rebecca's loan will be used to purchase an increased amount of her soaps to sell.  

Rebecca hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up her own shop and to increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages. Rebecca plans on having children in future, so she is saving towards future school fees and living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of her soaps, Dettol, washing detergents, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of retail Shop.

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en: Aybeniz is a resident of Beylagan town. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed her first loan of $400 and started the business of sheep breeding. The business went quite well and she took  out subsequent loans of $600 and $800. Now she wants to add more sheep to the herd and increase the income from the business.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Soonalofa

texts.en:
Most of the school children at Maagiagi village cannot afford to buy breakfast or lunch from their school canteen as it is more expensive for poor kids. Soonalofa is just the solution for them.

She sells popcorn and Samoan cookies five days a week. This is a good alternative and the cheapest one for the poorer students at school. Soonaalofa has also been able to continue to collect good income from selling cookies and popcorn at school. She uses the profit from her business to support her three children's education and to support her family financially.

"At least I can earn something to help out with my children, but I have a personal goal to turn out this small business into a successful big one," said Soonaalofa.

loans.use: Buy more supplies for her foodstall at school

loans.name: Nureddin

texts.en: O. Nureddin is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. He started his business in 1995 after borrowing a loan from Aqroinvest CU. With the loan, O. purchased calves for meat purposes. He would like another source of income. He borrowed 1200 USD to purchase one milk cow and a calf for animal husbandry.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Gubad

texts.en:
Gubad is an Internally Displaced Person from the Agdam region in Azerbaijan. He is married and has 2 children. He has a shop where he sells different types of clothing and has been running this business for 5 years.

He has little of his own funds to develop his clothing business or increase the variety of his inventory, so he has applied to Normicro Baku branch for a $500 loan.

loans.use: To increase his clothing inventory

loans.name: Toukourou

texts.en: Toukourou S. is a 26-year-old young lady. She has a cosmetic products store in Adjamé-Forum in Abidjan where she sells various fashion products. Toukourou left primary school because her parents were not able to pay her school expenses. She then started her business when she was 16 after many years as a trainee with her aunt. She is ambitious and well organized. She received her first loan from AE&I in September 2004 when she heard about us from her aunt. She has been performing very well since then. She would like to expand her business and replenish her store with black ladies' cosmetics products imported from the USA.

loans.use: Toukourou Sauboulade will use the loan purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Born in Tannou in 1970, Marie A. is married and the mother of six. Producing gari (granulated cassava root) is her primary work each day. It is her source of income. She buys fields of cassava, digs up the roots, and transforms them into gari, which she sells. Known by consumers for the quality of her product, she has now gotten a lot of orders to fill. And so she is requesting a loan of $350 to buy cassava in order to make gari. The income will enable her to meet her children's needs in terms of health and education.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Tannou en 1970, Madame A. Marie est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. La production du gari est son activité quotidienne. C’est de cette activité qu’elle tire ses revenus. Elle achète les champs de manioc, les déterre, transforme le levain en gari qu’elle vend. Reconnue par les consommateurs par la qualité de son gari, aujourd’hui elle a reçu beaucoup de demande qu’elle doit satisfaire. Pour cela, elle sollicite ce crédit de $350 pour acheter du manioc afin de produire du gari. Les revenus lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants en matière de santé et d’éducation.

loans.use: To buy cassava for making gari

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: I am Tahira Z. from a big city Lahore, Pakistan. I live here with my husband and four kids in a brick house. My husband gives pick and drop services to the students at a local school in the morning and afternoon, and in the evening operates a mobile phones shop. He also offers repairing services at his store. Now he needs to buy a few  mobile phone accessories for his store for which he needs a loan of $175.

loans.use: Buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Romualda's Group

texts.en:
Fernandina, Romualda and Esperanza have been members of the community bank “Retoño” for 2, 7, and 4 years respectively.  
Fernandina is 41 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Fernandina is a textile artisan; she learned this skill from her family.  She makes beautiful blankets and tapestries, which she sells from a stand in the artisan gallery of Ayacucho.
Romualda is forty-eight.  She is married and has six children.  Romualda is also a textile artisan.  Together with her family, Romualda makes blankets and table clothes that she sells to an intermediary.  In addition, Romualda sells fruits from a cart on the streets of Ayacucho. 
On the other hand, Esperanza is 38 years old.  She is a single mother and has one son.  Esperanza travels to different markets in the region where she buys whole grains, cheeses, animals, and other products that she sells in the markets of Ayacucho.  She has been doing this for many years.  Fernandina, Romualda, and Esperanza need loans of 800, 1400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying primary materials such as threads, dies, corn, barley, wheat, cheese, and animals.
In their community bank they have learned how to invest their money, to be punctual, and responsible.  They also mentioned that they feel like all of the other women in the bank are their friends.  
The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Fernandina, Romualda and Esperanza hope to use their savings to increase the capital of their businesses, build a home, and pay their children’s school fees.  Their dreams are to eventually have more capital for their businesses, have more comforts and conveniences in their homes, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Romualda, and Esperanza need loans of 600, 1400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying primary materials such as threads, dies, corn, barley, wheat, cheese, and animals.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
K. Abdurahmon is 49 years old. He and his wife have raised two children.

For more than 10 years, Abdurahmon has been running his business. He is purchasing, raising and selling the cattle. The business is the family one, as his wife helps him. Thanks to the income generated by the business, Abdurahmon was able to arrange the wedding parties for his two sons. Now Abdurahmon is planning to expand his business and purchase another 2 cows. For this purpose he requests 950.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. Abdurahmon thanks all supporting him and promises to be accurate in the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing 2 cows

loans.name: Mateus Manuel

texts.pt:
Mateus Manuel G. Nasceu was born on 02/03/1965 in the district of Murrombene, province of Inhambe. He studied until the 7th grade when he had to leave school and join the army. He has 4 brothers, he is married and father of 4 sons. His oldest son is 20 years old. In 1980 he left Murrombene to the district of Chinduachine to join the compulsory army services where he stayed for 6 months. In 1980 he left Chinduachine to Boane. He then joined the police department. Starting in 1984 Mateus worked for 9 years at the warehouse at the military camp.

He now works as a driver for the bus system in Boane. He started his business in 2000 with his wife. Mateus joined another credit institution called TCHUMA first, but switched to HLUVUKU ADSEMA due to recommendation from friends and clients. With the loan of 20.000mt he wants to increase his inventory. With the income from the business Mateus supports his family and pays for the schooling of his children. In the future he plans on improving his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 7 - Boane Cliente: Mateus Manuel G. Actividade: Comercio Valor de Credito: 20.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade Inicio: 25/02/2008 Fim: 31/05/2009

Mateus Manuel G. Nasceu aos 02/03/1965 no Distrito de Murrombene, Província de Inhambane. Estudou ate a 7ª classe, parou cedo porque teve que cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório. Tem 4 irmãos, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos sendo o mais velho de 20 anos de idade. Em 1980 saiu de Murrombene a Chinduachine Distrito de Chibuto para cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório, onde permaneceu durante 6 messes no campo de batalha. Nos meados de 1980 saiu de Chinduachine ao quartel de Boane para concluir com o serviço militar. Findo o trabalho manteve se a trabalhar como policia militar. Em 1984 mudou de sector e trabalhou como armazenista do quartel onde durou 9 anos. De 1991 a 2003 trabalhou na Equimep – Empresa de reparacao de estradas como motorista. De 2004 ate então trabalha como motorista dos transportes semi colectivos de Boane. Começou a praticar o negocio no ano 2000 e na sua ausência a mulher é que assume a responsabilidade de tudo. Já trabalhou com uma instituição de credito de nome TCHUMA mas já não esta a aderir porque os serviços não o satisfizeram.

Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA graças as conversas que tem tido com os amigos e clientes. Com o emprestimo de 20.000,00MT pretende reforçar o stock dos produtos de modo a satisfazer cada as necessidades dos seus clientes. Com os lucros suporta as despesas de educação dos filhos e poupa algum para os momentos difíceis da vida. A Perspectiva futura e ter um credito para aplicar no melhoramento das condiçoes habitacionais da familia.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his business

loans.name: Stanislas

texts.fr:
Born around 1952 in PORTO NOVO in the political capital of Benin, Mr. Stanislas C. is married and the father of five children. Schooling and other expenses for his children are his responsibility to meet. Having good morals, he is on his fifth loan with our institution for which he is requesting 500,000 francs CFA to buy red oil and various chemical products for making soap. Each day he produces an average of 120 bars of laundry soap, which he sells at 100 francs each. His soap lathers up very nicely and is in high demand by his customers. This loan will enable him to increase his production capacity and to meet the expectations of his customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né vers les années 1952 à PORTO NOVO dans la capitale politique du BENIN, monsieur C. Stanislas est marié et père de 5 enfants. La scolarité et autres charges de ses enfants sont à sa charge. De bonne moralité, monsieur C. Stanislas est à son cinquième prêt au niveau de notre institution pour lequel il demande 500 000 en vue de l’achat d’huile rouge et de divers produits chimiques servant à la fabrication de savons. Il produit par jour en moyenne 120 pains de savon de lessive qu'il vend à 100 FCFA l'unité. Ses savons moussent très bien et font l'objet d'une grande demande de la part de ses clients. Ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter ses capacités de production et de satisfaire au mieux ses clients.

loans.use: To buy 250 liters of palm oil (red oil) and different chemical products

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en: M. Sobirjon is 50 years old. He’s married. Sobirjon and his wife have 3 children. Sobirjon is a farmer. His wife and elder son help him with the business. He is growing such crops as wheat, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers and others. Having worked the land for ten years, Sobirjon has gained rich experience. Each year he is growing a yield sufficient for the family consumption and for selling. The business is the main source of income and is generating a stable income. At the same time, it requires considerable funding. Now Sobirjon needs to purchase mineral fertilizer and the seeds for planting. He’s asking for a loan on the size of $600. The loan will be repaid in 9 months. Sobirjon and his family are counting on your help. Sobirjon thanks all supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Matowéna

texts.fr:
Born February 11th, 1973 in Assoamakokji in the Sotouboua prefecture, Ms. Matowéna W. is single and has one child. She is a retailer and has established a restaurant called “La Savoureuse” where she serves meals of grilled fish in Lomé’s Avédzi neighborhood. She began this business in 2001 and hasn’t yet borrowed money from WAGES. Her restaurant receives many customers and she would like to provide them with quality service. To this end she is seeking a loan of 300,000 Francs CFA to buy 12 cases of fresh fish.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 11 février 1973 à Assoamakodji dans la préfecture de Sotouboua, Mademoiselle W. Matowéna est célibataire avec un enfant. Elle est revendeuse et a crée le restaurant la SAVOUREUSE où elle fait la restauration de poissons braisés dans le quartier Avédzi à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2001 et n’a pas encore bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES. Son restaurant accueille beaucoup de client et elle désire leur rendre un service de qualité. A cet effet elle sollicite un crédit de 300.000FCFA pour acheter 12 cartons de poissons frais

loans.use: Purchase 12 cases of fresh fish

loans.name: Suubilyamukama Lending Group

texts.en:
Josephine N. is the group leader of Suubilyamukama Lending Group in Lugazi. For eight years she has been selling new clothes that include traditional bitenge, casual wear and suits mostly for ladies as well as children's wear. She is a married woman with five school-going children.

Josephine buys her clothes from Kampala, making the trip twice a week, and so far business is good. Her dream is to be able to buy a sewing machine so that she can make most of the clothes herself, as this will help her save more.

Josephine is asking for a loan to help her buy more clothes for her shop. She will share this loan with the members of her group.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel is 47 years old, and remained in education until the fourth year of primary school. She is married, a mother of eight children, and was born and lives in the Town Centre of Ccotos, sector No. 1. She is a member of the Banco Comunal Juchuy Niño, Capachica, in the Puno Region. She has spent 20 years working, making plaster and delivery orders every two to three months , totalling 450 to 500 bags of plaster in the city of Puno. She currently has two ovens. With this loan of S /. 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, which she will pay in 4 installments, she will be able to excavate the land to retrieve the raw material needed to process plaster, using heavy machinery, which takes 8 hours. This will cost S /. 1200.00 Nuevos Soles. She will work the ground to obtain her product with greater ease, which will cost S /. 1000.00 Nuevos Soles. This is land which has enough raw material to process plaster, enabling her to then sell it in the city of Puno. Ysabel is delighted to work with the Banco Comunal because it is contributing to her capital. His vision is to expand the plaster factory together with her husband, and support their children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Isabel tiene 47 años de edad, estudió cuarto año de primaria, casada, madre de ocho hijos, nació y vive en el Centro Poblado de Ccotos, sector Nº 1. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal Juchuy Niño, Distrito de Capachica, Región Puno, hace 20 años se dedica a la fábrica de yeso y entrega pedidos cada dos a tres meses la cantidad de 450 a 500 bolsas de yeso en la ciudad de Puno, actualmente cuenta con dos hornos. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, hará excavar la tierra para sacar la materia prima para el procesado de yeso con maquinaria pesada en un tiempo de 08 horas, que pagará un monto de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, hará trabajar el camino para sacar su producto con mayor facilidad, el cual pagará S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, el lugar del denuncio tiene bastante materia prima para el procesado del yeso y su posterior venta en la ciudad de Puno. Doña Ysabel se siente muy contenta de trabajar con el Banco Comunal porque aumentó su capital. Su visión es ampliar la fábrica de yeso, conjuntamente con su esposo y apoyar en la educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To invest in land excavation

loans.name: Mohammad Shakar

texts.en:
Mohammad Shakar is 23 years old and married with one son. He was for a long time in Iran. Two years ago he left Iran and came back to Afghanistan. He has a cosmetics shop. He was involved in this business in Iran and then started one up in Kabul; he has some good numbers of customers but he needs to buy more cosmetics for re-sale.

Mohammad Shakar has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani with a term of 18 months to complete his stock and also buy new designs of clothes for males and females to attract more customers and make a good monthly income for his family to help his family and make a better future for himself.

He would like to thank Kiva lenders around the world. He wants to become strong and popular to have anther shop in the future. He would love to continue his business with AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To complete his stock and buy new designs of clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Vun Morn Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Vun M. is a group leader of five, all of whom live in Tbeng Khpuos Village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and owns two hectares of rice fields. On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her soil is not fertile. To solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Kong Vong, helps her on the plantation. Mrs.Vun M. is 28-years-old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers to support the soil and  make the rice fields more productive.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "SAN ANTONIO" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MIRTHA QUIEN TIENE NEXO CONSAGUINEO CON LA SEÑORA MARIA ESTER Y LA SEÑORA VIVIANA COM PAMELA, PERO CADA UNA D. ELLAS TIENE INGRESOS INDEPENDIENTES PARA ASUMIR SUS RESPONSABILIDADES. LAS SOCIAS DESARROLLAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMERCIALES Y D. SERVICIO COMO SER PROMOTORAS D. COSMETICOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES, D. MASITAS Y VENTA D. COMIDA, ALGUNA D. ELLAS SE DEDICAN A LA PELUQUERIA Y AL TRANSPORTE PUBLICO EN LO QUE RESPECTA A LOS SOCIOS PARTICIPANTES.COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA. EL CREDITO ESTA DESTINADO, SEGÚN EXPRESIONES D. LAS SOCIAS, AL INCREMETO D. SU MERCADERIA Y COMPRAR HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO.EFECTIVAMENTE LAS SOCIAS COMENTAN QUE TIENEN EXPERIENCIA CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS YA QUE ALGUNAS TRABAJAROSN CON LA FUNDACION AGROCAPITAL EN ANTERIORES GRUPOS, Y SE SABE QUE SON GENTE RESPONSABLE Y CAPAZA D. MEJORAR AUN MAS SU FUENTE D. TRABAJO.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "San Antonio" are represented by Mrs. Mirtha, who is a blood relative of Mrs. Maria Ester, and by Mrs. Viviana, who is related to Pamela, but each has her own independent income in order to fulfill her responsibilities. The members each manage a variety of businesses and services such as selling cosmetics, selling groceries, selling pastries and food, and some of them work in hairdressing and in public transport. As in every business there exists competition in regards to supply and demand. The loan will be used, according to the members, to augment their merchandise and to buy work tools. The members have asserted they are experienced with solidarity groups since some of them have worked with Fundación Agrocapital in previous groups, and they are known to be responsible and able to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is 47 years old and married to Germinihildo. They work together in their farm. They have three children: Joe - 28 years old, elementary graduate; Janicell - 25 years old, college graduate and currently working as a teacher; and Jimson - 22 years old, also an elementary graduate. Elizabeth is thankful to God for giving her a wonderful family. Alhough her two sons are not interested in studying, they are very responsible and are helping them in the farm.

Elizabeth aims to develop their farmland so that they will be able to increase their income. However, they do not have the needed capital for this so she requests a loan of PHP15,000 (USD$325). The money will be used to sustain the needed farm inputs such as fertilizers.

One of their main goals in life is to really improve their farmland. That is why they never get tired of cultivating it, because they know that this will really give them a better future.

loans.use: For purchasing fertilizer and other farming needs.

loans.name: Josefa Vicenta

texts.es: Josefa Vicenta  labora como Asesora de crédito en la financiera FAMA, vive  en la zona # 3  de Nueva Guinea, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda construyendo una habitacion con baño interno  y poder tener mejores condiciones en el hogar; Josefa se caracteriza por ser profesional, emprededora, optimista, ha luchado desde muy joven para desempeñarse en el campo laboral, es reconocida por ser una mujer responsable, honesta,  trabajadora, con principios cristianos, su mayor sueño es tener un hogar digno con condiciones humanas y social para su hijo.
texts.en:
Josefa Vicenta works as a credit assessor at the FAMA financing company. She lives in zone 3 of Nueva Guinea and has a son who is 3 years old. She is requesting refinancing of her second loan so she can improve her home. She would like to build a bedroom with its own bathroom, to have better living conditions. Josefa is a professional, enterprising and optimistic woman who has struggled since she was young to perform in the labor market. She is known as a responsible, honest, and hard-working woman with Christian principles. Her greatest dream is to have a dignified home with humane and social conditions for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bedroom and bathroom

loans.name: Ida Melina

texts.es:
Desde hace más de veinte años Ida T. de cincuenta y seis años trabaja vendiendo comida. Siempre con la idea de ayudar a su esposo a generar ingresos para la crianza de sus ocho hijos y el mantenimiento de su hogar, ha buscado el modo de trabajar por su cuenta. 

Ahora la mayoría de sus hijos ya son independientes, solo esta cargo de su hija menor. Su esposo trabaja como vigilante en un hospital y ella prepara comida y la vende en su casa. La construcción de su casa es muy precaria pero aún así siempre está dispuesta a recibir a sus clientes con el fin de seguir trabajando.

Hace poco se animó a alquilar un local donde implementó un pequeño restaurante, pero debido al alto costo de la renta del local no pudo continuar y decidió regresar  nuevamente a su casa. A veces  su hija la ayuda a repartir la comida a domicilio según los pedidos que recibe.
texts.en:
For more than 20 years, 56-year-old Ida T. has been working selling food. She has always helped her husband make money to raise their eight children and pay the household expenses. Most of her children, with the exception of her youngest daughter, are now independent. Her husband works as a security guard in a hospital and she prepares food and sells it from her home. Her house is in very bad shape but she is always ready to welcome customers in order to keep working. She recently worked up the nerve to rent a small store and opened a little restaurant, but the rent was too high and she could not continue, deciding instead to return to her home. Sometimes her daughter helps her by delivering food customers have ordered.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for her home-based restaurant.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se unierón con el proposito D. mejorar su calidad D. vida atravez D. un grupo solidarios dispuestas a ayudarse, cada una tiene una responsabilidad que asumen D. manera conjunta, son personas humildes y muy trabajadoras, poseen el espiritu emprendedor y las ganas D. progresar conjuntamente.-

Nº	Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
1	Catalina Rodríguez	Almacen
2	Claudelina Soledad González	Copetín
3	Silvina R.         Macatera
4	Elva Suni O.	Macatera
5 	Adela V.      	Macatera
6	Graciela Rodríguez	Vendedora Ambulante
7	Angela C.	Macatera
8	María Clara Colmán	Modista
9	Fabi Raquel González	Macatera
10	Valentina M. D. B.	Almacen
11	Dora Dionicia E.	Vendedora Ambulante
12	Gladys Stella E.	Vendedora Ambulante 
13	Wilma G.	Cantina- Copetín
14	Adela C. D. E.	Vendedora Ambulante
15	María Liz González	Macatera
16	Sulma Rodríguez	Macatera
17	Claudelina P.	Copetín
texts.en:
This group united with the goal of improving their quality of life through a united group available to help each other. Each member has a responsibility that is undertaken together. They are humble and hardworking people, and they possess an entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to progress together. Nº Name, Activity 1 Catalina Rodríguez, Store 2 Claudelina Soledad González, Snack bar 3 Silvina R., Vegetable and clothing vendor 4 Elva Suni O., Vegetable and clothing vendor 5 Adela V., , Vegetable and clothing vendor 6 Graciela Rodríguez, Street vendor 7 Angela C., Vegetable and clothing vendor 8 María Clara Colmán, Seamstress 9 Fabi Raquel González , Vegetable and clothing vendor 10 Valentina M. D. B., Store 11 Dora Dionicia E., Street vendor 12 Gladys Stella E., Street vendor 13 Wilma G. Cantina-,Snack bar 14 Adela C. D. E., Street vendor 15 María Liz González, Vegetable and clothing vendor 16 Sulma Rodríguez, Vegetable and clothing vendor 17 Claudelina P., Snack bar

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for each of their respective businesses

loans.name: Coletha

texts.en:
Coletha E. is a 20-year-old, single woman. Coletha owns and operates a small grocery store in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She is a member of the Kiguo loan group (Group code 2013). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125, and she works at her business for 9 hours every day.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items in order to expand and improve her business. More specifically, she is hoping that this loan will enable her to: generate an increase in her profits; expand her business; provide more food for her family; and save money for future use.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional grocery items.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George A. is 38 years old. He is married with six children, who are are all currently in school. He is a commercial truck driver and his wife is a baker who sells her product through hawking. George is very popular in his area because of his hard work and his dedication to work. He has been driving a big truck for a very long time now and taking care of the family. He is hired by customers who need to get their goods to various destinations and he charges them a reasonable rate.

His vehicle has developed a fault that makes it very difficult to earn a living. He requests a loan to buy car parts to maintain his car. Notwithstanding that, he also wants to get a bigger truck. He believes this would help him achieve his dream. With the loan he wants to change the engine, his diesel tank, and weld other parts that are wearing out. He will be grateful for your assistance, he said.

George belongs to a group called Awake. He hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make progress in his business by restocking his inventory. This would enable him to save more to support his wife in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To maintain his truck van and purchase a new car.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda owns a small piggery business. She started her business in 2004 and still raises pigs to support the needs of her five children. Aside from pigs, she also owns a rice field. Her husband, Rodrigo, is sick. She alone is managing their business to earn a living.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy pig feed to grow her pigs. Currently she has five piglets and one sow. She wants to make the business grow to send all her children to school and to buy medicines for her husband.

CEVI is a non-stock, non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, start and have their own livelihoods. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.en:
Santiaga A. is a resident of Santo Rosario, Pandan, Antique. She is 55 years old, married and mother to an 11-year-old daughter named RJ. Her husband, Ceazar, is a hired laborer. Locals consider Santo Rosario the ‘bag capital’ of Pandan because almost all of the residents’ sources of income is from making native bags. Santiaga is also engaged in the native bag making business. The bags are in demand in other towns and cities. Local tourists even visit the place just to buy native bags and other native products. But, as the materials used in making these bags are so expensive, Santiaga needed capital to purchase these supplies. With her loan, she proposes to buy, in bulk, the bariw (plant that leaves are used in making bags) that she requires to be able to produce more products.

Stantiaga is hopeful that someday her business will grow to the point that she could earn enough sustain the needs of her family. Sending her child to college and to build a house of her own are her greatest dreams.

loans.use: To purchase bulk materials for native bag making.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana Q. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 32 years old. Luciana is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Luciana sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Luciana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Luciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to enable her to engage in business activities. Luciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating a pump boat for fishing. Luciana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase an additional fishing boat. This will be Luciana's fourth loan from GDMPC.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional fishing boat

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is already 33 years old. She is married to Ronald D., a farmer. They have two children who are: Kenneth, 9 years old, and Kimberly, 6 years old. They are both in their primary level of education at Barangay Tandul Elementary School. She has managed a typical village store business for almost 9 years now and also sells vegetable in her store. Prior to her current business, Maribel first became a market vendor in their public market of Cabatuan. But due to financial difficulties, Maribel was not able to continue her market vending. Instead, she shifted opening a general store business to still earn a daily income. Now, she is requesting to borrow loan amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional working capital to develop her business towards the education of her children. She hopes to sell more items in her store and be able to develop her business to progress.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Carmen Briginia

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal El Grupo Real 
Carmen es  casada tiene 48 años,  tiene 3 hijos mayores.  De 25, 22, y 17 años que trabajan y estudian.
 Carmen hacia buffet con sus hijas en su casa para los colegios, pero no le fue bien y decidió cambiar de negocio, se puso a vender desayunos por las calles como ambulante por varios meses, hasta que decidió  dar desayunos  en la puerta de su casa, compro tres mesitas, ahora da desayunos y lonches todos los días. 
Desde que Carmen esta en Finca, aprendió a valorar más el dinero, ha ahorrar, a ser cumplida con los pagos. 
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de embutidos y café. 
El sueño de Carmen es tener un restaurante y vender comida criolla.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Community Bank "El Grupo Real".

Carmen is married, she is 48 years old and has 3 grown children, aged 25, 22, and 17. They are all working and going to school.

Carmen used to run a Buffet restaurant from her home with the help of her daughters for the local schools, but it didn't go very well so she decided to change her business. She started selling breakfast foods in the streets for many months until she decided to sell the same foods from her home. She bought three small tables and now she sells breakfast and lunch foods every day.

Since Carmen has started with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) she has learned the value of money, she learned to save, and she is always on time with her payments.

Carmen requires a loan of 800 soles to purchase cold cuts and coffee.

Carmen's dream is to own a restaurant selling traditional criolla foods.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cold cuts and coffee.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Elise G. est revendeuse de pagnes et de tissus à Assahaoun. Agée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elise exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle compte sur cette aubaine pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Elise G. is a re-seller of panges (colorful wax cloths) and fabric in Assahaoun. Aged 39 years, she is married and the mother of one child. Elise has been in this business for five years and she hopes that with this loan she will be able to buy merchandise so that she can better satisfy the needs of her clients. She is counting on this good fortune to help improve the conditions of her family's life.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) for re-sale

loans.name: Reidelinda

texts.es:
La señora Reidelinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años, 04 hijos, el mayor ya independiente y los tres menores aun son estudiantes. 

Reidelinda, es una mujer muy alegre y optimista, que se inicio vendiendo sus frutas en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida, por sus clientes y amistades, que día a día acuden a su negocio a comprar sus frutas.

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden al Mercado a comprar frutas de la Región muy variados  y de muy buena calidad para preparar jugos o para comerlos como postre, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas, piñas  y plátanos verdes y guineos en racimos para así mantener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Reidelinda, sueña con mantener su negocio, hasta que Dios le de fuerzas para seguir trabajando. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Reidelinda belongs to the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima” (Holy Rose of Lima), in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín state. She is married, 48 years old, and has 4 children, the oldest is grown and the three youngest are students. Reidelinda is a very optimistic, happy woman who daily goes to the market to buy a variety of good quality regional fruits in order to prepare juices or to eat as a desert. It is she who personally serves her customers with a smile. With the loan for S/2,000.00, she will buy sacks of oranges, mandarin oranges, lemons, limes, taperibas (a fruit native to the Peruvian jungle), pineapple, plantains and bunches of baby bananas in order to maintain a stock for her business and provide good customer service so her customers find what they need. Reidelinda dreams of keeping her business; God is the one who provides her the energy to continue working. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping other women who want to learn both professionally and personally.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of oranges, mandarin oranges, lemons, limes and other fruit

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en: N. M. is the leader of this group in Kayunga. He is a responsible man and married with seven children and he takes care of 4 orphans, all in school. He is a farmer involved in the growing of maize, beans, coffee, and bananas, and he has been our client for four years. The loans have really helped him in his crop-growing, especially with manpower, enabling him to get enough profits that he uses partly to pay the children’s school expenses and invest more in his farm. His fellow group members agree that the loans have been instrumental in their families’ development and business transformation. M. needs a loan to be able buy higher quality seeds for planting during this rainy season so as to get better yields.

loans.use: Buying quality seeds and employing manpower on his farm

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie V. D. C. is a 50-year-old widow and the mother of eight children who range in age from six to 27 years old. Her eldest daughter, who has been working abroad, supports her financially and enables her to support the rest of her children, who are dependent on her for their everyday lives. 

To augment her daughter’s income abroad, early in 2009, Elsie joined ASHI to have access to credit for business capital. Then she opened a variety store. With the profits from her store, she was able to repay her loan on time. 

Now Elsie is requesting another loan from ASHI, which she will use to expand her store and start a new hog-raising business. In the hog business, the profit is as much as double the amount of the initial capital investment when the hogs are sold after months of fattening. So, the more pigs that Elsie can raise and sell, the more profits she will earn. Someday, through the loans she can access from ASHI, Elsie hopes that her business will grow and become profitable enought for her to be able to support all of her children. 

For now, she has to support the education of her three younger children in high school and elementary school. She hopes that all three will be able to graduate from college.

loans.use: To finance her variety store and start a new hog-raising business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 47 years old. Virginia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair the engine of borrower's fishing boat. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair the engine of borrower's fishing boat

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La señora María Magdalena es pensionada de una clínica médica y es viuda, ella vive solita ya que sus hijos todos están casados. Ella esta tramitando este crédito ya que desea impermeabilizar el techo de su vivienda, porque se acerca la temporada de lluvias y su techo esta dañado.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is a widow who lives alone since her children are all married. She is retired from her job in a medical clinic. She is seeking a loan to fix the roof of her house, as the rainy season is approaching and the roof is damaged.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproofing the roof of her home

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Arwa is married and she has three sons aged 33, 30, and 24 . The younger two work as daily-paid workers in Israel; the eldest is responsible for helping his mother in managing the farm and their new shop. The fourth is a girl aged 19, studying at the university. Her husband is working in the USA.

For 5 years, Arwa and her eldest boy, Hamza, have had a chicken farm where they raise chickens to sell wholesale. Now they want to take out a loan from FATEN amounting to 2000 USD to rent and decorate a new shop, in addition to buying some equipment so they can sell their chickens directly to customers with more profit.

Arwa appears in the picture at the FATEN office in Ramallah.

loans.use: Rent and decorate a shop to sell the chickens they raise

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
F. Mavluda is married with three children. She and her husband have a business selling children's clothing items in the central market of Dushanbe. Mavluda offers a big assortment of inventory and has a flexible discount system for her loyal customers. Mavluda’s business is going well, as demand has been very stable over the last 11 years.

Mavluda is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is hardworking and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar products or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she has a natural skill for making people feel feel valued, respected, and heard.

Mavluda is requesting a loan of $1,700 in order to purchase seasonal clothing, which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so that she can help to support herself and her family. Please help this woman of so much strength and courage to keep working.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing, which will help her to continue stabilizing her business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia M., a 58-year-old transport operator from Pasay City. She is married to Orlando, a 61-year-old jeepney driver. Leticia is a multi-tasking entrepreneur. She is into rag making, which she started five years ago. Along with production of rags, she maintains a coin-operated video karaoke machine. With still a little time left, she manages the operation of their passenger jeepney, which her husband drives daily. It plies the routes covering the city. They bought the jeepney and acquired a permit for public conveyance three years ago. Leticia earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from her businesses. Most of the profits go to her grandchildren's education.

Leticia considers her membership with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative a heaven-sent blessing. She wants to share with friends the many blessings she has received since joining the CCT. She is currently in need of a loan amounting to 22,000 PHP in order to purchase much needed spare parts for the repair and improvement of their passenger jeepney. She believes that their jeepney is God's gift to them.

About CCT:
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase jeepney spare parts for preventive maintenance

loans.name: Jorge Felix

texts.es: Jorge cuenta con 59 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, tiene 4 hijos los mimos que ya son independientes y viven junto a su ex conyugue, actualmente vive en una casa en alquiler la misma que es de unos compadres. Jorge se dedica al transporte urbano de pasajeros, para el efecto cuenta con un taxi propio, en el rubro cuenta con 12 años de experiencia. En el transporte existe bastante competencia sin embargo Jorge por la antigüedad y la experiencia sabe de lugares y horarios estratégicos para poder obtener buenos ingresos. El destino del crédito es para la compra del parabrisas de su automóvil, el mismo que fue dañado en la calle mientras el descansaba dentro su hogar. Jorge cuenta con algunos retrasos en algunas cuotas en Agrocapital lo cual hizo que su promedio se elevara sin embargo no es por mala fe ya que el mismo cuenta con una buena voluntad de pago. No cuenta con creditos en otras instituciones es cliente fiel con nuestra institución por el servicio que recibe de la misma.
texts.en:
Jorge is 59 years old, single and has four children, all of whom are grown up and live with his ex-wife. He currently lives in a house he rents with some friends. Jorge makes a living in public transportation and has his own taxi. He has 12 years of experience in the business. There is quite a lot of competition, but Jorge, with his age and experience, knows the strategic places and schedules to go to earn a good income. The loan will be used to purchase a windshield for his vehicle, which was damaged on the street while he was asleep in his home. He has had some delays with past repayments to Kiva partner AgroCapial, which raised his rates, however, it was not in bad faith and he has maintained his will for repayment. He has had no loans with other institutions and he is a faithful client to AgroCapital for the services he receives.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a windshield for his taxi

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
Ana Belki U. C., Karla Patricia A. y Martha Lorena M. integran al grupo Santa Ana. La especialidad de estas tres mujeres trabajadoras es la cosa de horno, postre nicaragüense a base de maíz, dulce, queso y cuajada.

Karla Patricia A. aprendió este oficio a la  edad de 5 años ya que ella iba con su madre a distribuir el producto y con el pasar de los años empezó a tener mayores responsabilidades en el negocio desde la producción hasta su venta.  A. asegura que a la edad de quince años se independizó y empezó a comercializar cosa de horno, atolillo, arroz de leche, pilloquinto y repostería.

Mientras Ana Belki U. C. de 43 años desde hace cinco años empezó a vender cosa de horno en su hogar y Martha Lorena M. desde hace cuatro años compra y vende cosa de horno.
texts.en:
Ana Belki U. C., Karla Patricia A., and Martha Lorena M. make up the group, Santa Ana. The speciality of these three working women is making baked goods, Nicaraguan desserts with a corn base, sweets, cheese, and custard. Karla Patricia A. learned this skill when she was five years old when she would go with her mother to distribute the goods. Over time, she began to have greater responsibilities in the business, from production to sales. A. says that at the age of 15 she became independent and began to sell baked goods, atolillo [a Nicaraguan dish], arroz con leche [a Nicaraguan dish], pillo quinto [a Nicaraguan dish], and pastries. Meanwhile Ana Belki U. C. is 43 years old and five years ago began to sell baked goods in her home. Martha Lorena M. has bought and sold baked goods for four years.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, milk, cheese, sugar, and other ingredients to make baked goods

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang C., 28, is married and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who typically makes about $1 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes $3 of profit a day. Hang C. is asking for a loan of $500, which her husband needs to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 61 años, es madre soltera y pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa. Maria apoya a su hija Alicia que estudia Administración de Empresas. Maria trabajaba como asistenta social pues ayudaba a la gente en el aspecto de la vida social. Maria se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su hija y por horas se dedica atender su librería. La socia nos cuenta que se esta acercando la campaña escolar y requiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old, a single mom and belongs to the community bank "Las hijas de Maria" (Maria's daughters) from the Arariwa Association. Maria supports her daughter Alicia that studies Business Administration. Maria used to work as a social assistant and helped people from a social life aspect. Maria gets up very early to do housework chores such as prepare breakfast for her daughter and then for hours she works at her bookstore. This member says that the school season is approaching and requests a loan to purchase notebooks. The member is grateful for this opportunity and commits to meet the corresponding scheduled repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, es una mujer alegre, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 28 años, es madre de un menor de edad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos regionales, esta actividad la realiza en el puerto de Pucallpa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, que se desempeña como cocinero en una Empresa.  Maribel forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dalinas II”, desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de productos de la región.
Con este crédito de 2500 soles, comprará más productos regionales y madera para aserrar. La meta de Maribel es poner un negocio en su casa y ser una distribuidora de granos y plátanos de la región.
texts.en:
Maribel is a cheerful woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali region. She is 28 years old and the mother of a young son. She buys and sells regional products in the Port of Pucallpa. She has the full support of her husband, who works as a cook for a company. Maribel has been a member of the “Las Dalinas II” communal bank for the past five years. She used her first 300 PEN loan to invest in regional products. She will use the money from this loan of 2,500 PEN ($900) to buy more regional products and lumber. Her goal is to run the business from her home and become a distributor of grains and bananas from the region.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Regional products

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro B. P. is from the village of San Miquel Liloy. He is 55 years old. Alejandro is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Alejandro owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Alejandro has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alejandro joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alejandro B. P. is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the  2nd loan taken out by Alejandro B P. from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 22 year old single man living with his parents and 7 brothers and sisters. Starting 7 years ago, when he was young, he started going with his father and learning the fishing business. He became a talented fisherman and in 2004 he started working on his own. He sells the fish in a large fish market very well known in the whole region. Mohamad is thankful for his work as it allows him to assist with his family's income. 

Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase fishing supplies such as fishing nets and other items before the summer season, which is  considered the high season for the fishers where he could make a good income for the whole year.

loans.use: Fishing supplies

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio tiene 39 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y amoroso. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa Leonor de 25 años y su querida hija del mismo nombre, a quienes desea brindar una mejor vida.

Trabajando arduamente ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. Se dedica al cultivo del café, pero al no tener tierras propias tiene que alquilarlas. Junto a su esposa se levantan muy témpano para cuidar sus plantaciones de café, ya que saben que de la buena producción que obtengan, dependerán sus ingresos económicos.
A Lucio le gusta mucho su trabajo, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus plantaciones, ya que los químicos muchas veces han afectado su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprar sus propias tierras y así ahorrar el dinero del alquiler para invertirlo en abono y fertilizantes.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Lucio con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará abono y fertilizantes para sus plantaciones, también contratará operarios para que trabajen el café.
texts.en:
Lucio is 39 years old and a very hardworking and loving father. He lives in a rented house with his wife Leonor, who is 25 years old, and their beloved daughter with the same name, for whom he wants to provide a better life. By working hard, he has been able to make progress for his family. He works at coffee cultivation, but because he does not have his own land, he has to rent it. Together with his wife, they rise very early in order to take care of the coffee plantations, since they know that their income will depend on the good harvest they obtain. Lucio likes his work a lot. He has spent 3 years working in this business and thinks the hardest part is fumigating his plantations, because the chemicals have often affected his health. In time, he hopes to buy his own land and thus save money from renting in order to invest it in fertilizers. This is Lucio's seventh loan with MFP. He has been very timely with his prior loans and expects to do the same with this one. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank and is always up-to-date with the agreements arrived at by the group. With the two thousand nuevos soles requested, he will buy fertilizers for his plantations. He will also hire workers to harvest the coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Pascals

texts.en:
Pascal O. M. runs a masonry business that he started in 1998. Before this, he was a farmer. He runs 3 building contracts every 2 months in Nambale, Busia district. Pascal is a father of 4 children, married and he is 38 years old. His future plans is to stabilize his family’s economic status.

Pascal would lika a loan of KES 20,000 to expand his business and also to invest in a dairy farming project that he has ventured into recently.

loans.use: Expand his Construction Business.

loans.name: Valor Y Sacrificio Community Lending Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL VALOR Y SACRIFICIO

Hilaria es una D. las doce socias D. L. alcancia comunal VALOR Y SACRIFICIO, que ya tiene trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por casi 3 años, tiempo en el cual las socias han completado algunos D. sus planes y proyectos.
HIlaria tiene 42 años D. edad y es madre D. 2 hijos que ya son independientes, elL. trabaja en L. venta D. artesanias, las cuales distribuye desD. su casa, tambien esta aprendiendo sobre L. elaboración D. estas en todas su variedades posibles, para que elL. misma las elabore, y así tenga más ingresos.
ElL. comenzó haciendo tejidos D. lana, como chompas, gorros, guantes, etc.
ElL. plantea aprender mas sobre artesanias, tambien espera algun día tener una tienda.
El prestamo actual lo usara para comprar mas artesanias para venderlos.
Su más granD. sueño es tener una tienda propia y un mototaxi para alquilarlas.
texts.en:
Valor y Sacrificio Communal Bank Hilaria is one of the 12 members of the Valor y Sacrificio (“Courage and Sacrifice”) Communal Bank, which has already been working with EDAPROSPRO-PROSPERIDAD for almost 3 years. In this time, the members have completed several of their plans and projects. At 42 years old, Hilaria is the mother of two children who are already independent. She works selling artisanal products, which she distributes from her home. She is also learning about the production of these crafts in all their possible varieties so that she herself can create them and increase her profit margins. She began making woven wool products such as sweaters, hats, gloves, etc. Hoping one day to have a store, she plans to learn more about artisanal work and use the current loan to buy artisanal crafts to sell. Her biggest dream is to have and rent out her own store and a mototaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment of capital in work

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria Q. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 60 years old. Gloria is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Veronica Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Verónica Del Socorro tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene una hija menor de edad. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada, este negocio está ubicado en el costado oeste del mercado. Ella ya tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, cabe señalarse antes lo tenía en su casa pero lo llevo al mercado para vender más. La señora está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertirle a su negocio y comprar ropa usada. En los últimos días, la señora ha estado un poco afectada por los recientes cambios en todos los artículos, sin embargo dice que a pesar de todo ha logrado incrementar sus ventas en el mercado. Su sueño en el futuro es brindar la educación universitaria que ella no tuvo a su hija a través de las ganancias obtenidas en el negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica Del Socorro, 27, is married and has a minor daughter. She sells used clothing from a stand located on the western side of the market. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. It’s worth noting that she used to sell from home but took her business to the market in order to increase sales. She is asking for funds to invest in her business and buy used clothing. The last few days she has been somewhat affected by all the changes in the articles but she says that, despite everything, she has managed to increase sales in the market. Her future dream is to use profits form the business to provide her daughter with a university education, something she herself never had.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Poncla Juvet

texts.fr:
