Jeune commercant,celibataire sans enfant,age de 32 ans est dans l'exercice de cette activite depuis 1998,il tient un etalage des produits alimentaire dans le marche de plateau ,ou il vend des boites de conserves de differents qualites,lait, petit pois, mayonnaise, haricot vert,macedoine, beurre , margarine, sucre...
Avec ce pret il veut elargir son activite en achetant des produits beaucoup sollicites comme , les cartons de tomates,margarine le lait ecreme; le lait en poudre comme Nido, belle Hollandaise et tous ce qui attirent les clients 
Il vend en moyenne 18000 a 25000f par jour,pour accroitre son activite ,il cherche les meilleurs debouches pour s'approvisionner, et fait des prix abordables pour ecouler ses produits
Pour le futur il pense aller plus loin en construisant une boutique d'alimentation dans la parcelle familiale et employer des jeunes gens pour l'aider dans la vente.Dans son entourage on dit beaucoup de bien de lui, il est tres serviable.
texts.en:
This is a young merchant who is unmarried and without children. He is 32 years old and has been in this business since 1998. He has a display of grocery items at the Plateau market, where he sells different qualities of canned foods, milk, peas, mayonnaise, green beans, mixed fruit and vegetables, butter, margarine, sugar… With this loan, he wants to expand his business by buying high-demand products, such as boxes of tomatoes, margarine, milk, cream, and powdered milk, such as Nido, Belle Hollandaise, and anything that attracts customers. His sales average from 18,000 to 25,000 francs per day. To grow his business, he finds the best outlets for supplying himself. And he offers affordable prices to move his goods. For the future, he is thinking of doing more by building a grocery store on the family plot and employing young people to help with selling. Among those around him, a lot of good things are said about him. He is very helpful.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of tomatoes, milk, butter, canned foods, margarine

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo P. is from the village of Tablon, Digkilaan, Iligan City. He is 30 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Reynaldo owns and operates a fish-selling business, selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Reynaldo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

location.town: Tablon, Digkilaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena F. is from the town of Surallah. She is 49 years old. Elena is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She says she works hard because she wants to increase her harvest.

Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Elena from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame N. is married and has three children. She sells cloth, ladies' shoes and slippers by moving from one area to another at Takoradi. Maame has no educational background. Her husband is a farmer.  Maame uses her income to help her husband in educating her children.  Maame will use the loan to purchase more goods to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to buy a shop.

loans.use: purchase more goods to expand her business

loans.name: Warly

texts.en:
Warly D. P. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 38 years old. Warly is married and has 2 school-aged children. He is a farmer and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for quite a while now. He works hard to keep his farm free of weeds and pests. He says he is hoping to increase his harvest.

Warly is thankful he joined CEVI because he was able to avoid the individual lenders who charge high interest to their loans. He successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting a new loan of Php10, 000. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers like manure. Warly is hopeful to earn a better income so he could pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert P. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in his community. He is a 30-year-old married man from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. Albert has been in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Albert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Albert is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Masaka Group

texts.en:
Salama R. is in her late forties and is married with two children. Salama has been running a charcoal business since 2007 and her business is open daily between 8 a.m. and 6 p.m. Salama's charcoal business earns her a good monthly profit. 

This will be Salama's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Her two previous loans were used to increase her stock of charcoal in order to meet delivery orders. She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. Salama aims to use her third loan to once again increase her stock of charcoal in order to meet demand. 

Salama will share this loan with her loan group Masaka, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Salama is seen in the front row, second from left, wearing a dress with blue and green on it.

loans.use: Increase stock of charcoal

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam R. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 25 years old. Meriam is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Meriam owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling rice in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Meriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Meriam is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households in Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Twisuganerubyiruko Group

texts.fr: Samuel, il est  membres du groupe appelé TWISUGANERUBYIRUKO de ruhuha dont les membres sont tous agriculteurs de riz, il est marié et a 28 ans. Son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il a 3 enfants, le premier a 5 ans et le cadet a 3 ans.  Il  habite avec sa famille en district de Bugesera précisément à ruhuha, en province de l’est. Il est agriculteur de riz,  il a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano pour augmenter l’argent de ses épargnes pour acheter les félitilisants de leurs champs. C’est son deuxième prêt, ses  épargnes lui ont permis de pouvoir se marier et de faire vivre sa famille. Dans l’avenir, il veut continuer à acheter et/ou construire une maison d’habitation pour la sécurité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Samuel is a member of the group called Twisuganerubyiruko of Ruhuha in which the members are all rice farmers.  He is married, 28 years old, and has a primary school education.  He has three children.  The first child is 5 years old, and the youngest is 3.  Samuel lives with his family in the Bugesera district, in Ruhuha to be exact (East Province).  He is a rice farmer.

Samuel has signed a loan with the micro-finance institution Amasezerano to increase his savings for buying fertilizers for their fields.  This loan is his second one.  

His savings have enabled him to get married and to support his family.  In the future, he wants to continue with buying and/or building a house for the safety of his family.

loans.use: Buying fertilizers

loans.name: Kisangau

texts.en: Kisangau is a single man who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his young siblings. He operates a business peddling different household items such as oil lamps, cups and spoons. Kisangau faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation while moving from door to door. He hopes to establish a wholesale shop to sell his products in the future. With this KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase more household equipment. He decided to join Yehu to get financial support to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase household equipment such as oil lamps, cups and spoons

loans.name: Ermanie

texts.en:
Ermanie E. is from the village of Punta, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Ermanie is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Ermanie owns & operates transportation services. Ermanie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ermanie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ermanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ermanie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the third loan taken out by Ermanie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy phone cards and add cash to business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn C. and her husband, Mr. Cheung Prach, live in a village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1988 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. 

Sarorn is a weaver. Her husband is a carpenter and a wooden house constructor. 

She asks for a loan of $800 to purchase a cow to raise. When the cows give birth, she will be able to get income from selling the calves or when the cows grow to full size, she will be able to sell the cows for beef. 

In the photo are Mrs. Sarorn C. and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Sabino; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura y también se dedica a conducir una combi en servicio urbano en la ciudad de Cusco, el socio tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa, maíz y habas y luego lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe, el socio quiere mejorar las tierras de cultivo. El  socio solicita el préstamo comprar semillas y fertilizantes para la tierras de cultivo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabino is a member of the community bank "Mujeres en Accion" [Women in Action], which is located in the Anta district in the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

Sabino is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  He balances his daily activities with an agriculture business.  He also drives a van around the city of Cusco.  Sabino has fields where he grows potatoes, corn, and beans and then sells them at different markets.  He would like to improve his fields. 

He is asking for this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his fields.  He is happy with this loan and he promises to make all of his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Las Fantasticas 1 Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Ana Maria, una integrante del grupo fantasticas 1, que esta ubicado en VeraC., México. En la fotografía se observa a todas las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos que inicio hace 4 años, solicita el prestamo para ampliar su local, sus vecinos la catalogan como una persona responsable, al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente muy contenta ya que así tendra más clientes, ella tiene 42 años, estudió la preparatoria, es casada y tiene 3 hijos; 1 mujer y 2 varones. La señora María también espera poder mejorar su economía. Nohemi G. es la presidenta del grupo,tiene 42 años, estudió hasta el bachillerato, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, un varon y una mujer, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosmeticos que inicio hace 3 años, solicita el prestamo para adquirir mercancía de temporada.
texts.en:
This photograph was taken in the house of Ana Maria, a member of Las Fantasticas (The Fantastics) 1 Group, in VeraC., Mexico.  All members of the group are included in the picture.  Ana Maria has been selling Mexican snacks for 4 years.  She is requesting a loan to expand her stall.

Her neighbors categorize her as a responsible person.  As she was requesting this loan, she felt very content, since she would have more customers.  Ana Maria is 42 years old, studied at preparatory school, is married, and has 3 children -- a girl and 2 boys.  She hopes to be able to better her economic condition.

Nohemi is president of the group.  She is also 42, studied up to her high school diploma, is married and has 2 children -- a boy and a girl.  Nohemi has been selling clothing and cosmetics for the last 3 years.  She requests a loan to acquire seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: TO EXPAND A BUSINESS THAT SELLS MEXICAN SNACKS, AND RESUPPLY ANOTHER THAT SELLS CLOTHING AND COSMETICS

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 59 años y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en su casa propia en la parte rural del caserío La Pala ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola conocida como la capital del limón, que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a más una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace varios años, Santiago brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporte la gente en la ruta entre Olmos y sus caseríos. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra maíz. Santiago desea realizar algunas mejoras a su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo. También querría comprar algunos accesorios que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y hacer algunos arreglos en su domicilio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santiago is 59 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own home in the rural section of the town of La Pala, which is located in the District of Olmos. This farming district is known as “the lemon capital”, part of Lambayeque Province, and located more an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past several years Santiago has provided passenger transport services with his motorcycle taxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used for carrying people. He transports people along a route between Olmos and the neighboring villages. Santiago also works as a farmer, growing corn. He wants to make a few repairs to his vehicle since it is the piece of equipment he uses for work. Santiago also wants to buy a few accessories that he needs to keep his motorcycle taxi in good condition so that he can continue providing good service. With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his earnings and make some repairs to his home. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anah

texts.en:
Anah is a resident of Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She is aged 51 and married with two children aged 15 and 9 years. She has been practicing dairy farming for eight years with her milk produce sold locally. She gets additional income from tea and poultry farming.

She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES though Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She believes she will earn enough income to repay the loan and meet other family needs. She wants to build a modern dairy unit and buy better quality cows in future.

Anah compliments Juhudi for the loan facility it provides.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo de 30 años de edad, labora como extencionista del INTA  desde hace 11 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad, segun referencias comerciales  y personales este joven es muy emprendedor que ha luchado para que a su familia no le falte nada ya que son una familia bien unida y humilde. 

Solicita su octavo crédito para comprar un solar que se lo venden faborable y no cuenta con suficiente fondo para comprarlo de sus propios ingresos por lo que solicita el apoyo de Kiva en este financiamento,  

su sueño es construir su propio hogar y gozar de estabilida laboral.
texts.en:
Aldo is 30 years old and has been working as an agricultural engineer for INTA for 11 years.  He carries out his job with great responsibility and honesty according to his work and personal references.  This young man is very enterprising and he has worked hard so that his family doesn't want for anything as they are a very united and humble family.

Aldo is requesting his eighth loan to buy a plot of land that he is being offered at a good price as he doesn't have enough money to buy it with his own income.  For this reason, he is requesting Kiva's support with this loan.  His dream is to build his own home and enjoy job stability.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Ermilinda

texts.en:
Ermilinda F. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Ermilinda is widowed and has 6 infant-aged children. To make a living, Ermilinda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap and banana in the local community. Ermilinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ermilinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ermilinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Ermilinda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like bananas. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Ermilinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like bananas for sale

loans.name: Mr. Pisith Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven members make up this village bank loan. The group members have selected Mr. Pisith as the village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mr. Pisith was born in 1977. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he grows rice to support his own family and to sell. He is also a teacher in the local school while his wife, Mrs. Pheoun, is a seamstress in a garment factory. Currently he has some problems because his house is not comfortable to live in. To improve this situation, Mr. Pisith is asking for a loan to buy zinc and timber to fix his house. He will use the rest of the loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. 

He is the father of three children: two are attending the local public school and the other is too yoU. to work or study.

loans.use: To buy zinc and timber to fix his house

loans.name: Adévi

texts.fr: Revendeuse ambulante de pate dentifrice et de brosse à dents  depuis 2008. Mme  adèvi  jeune dame de 31ans est mariée à un commerçant et mère de 03 enfants.  Elle s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé et est à son premier cycle de crédit, ce dernier  lui permettra  d’acheter les produits qu’elle vend et dans la mesure du possible louer une place pour asseoir son marché. Elle  aimerait aider dans  l’éducation des enfants et  dans les tâches ménagères.
texts.en: A door-to-door saleswoman of toothpaste and toothbrushes since 2008, Ms. Adèvi is a young woman aged 31, married to a merchant, and has three children. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé and is on her first loan cycle, which will allow her to buy the products she re-sells and, as far as possible, to rent a place where she can keep her goods. She would like to help with the education of her children and the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell toothpaste and toothbrushes.

loans.name: Flamingos I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Flamingos" y se ubica en la cacomunidad en el estado de Puebla en México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora Florina es una integrante del grupo se dedica a la venta de marranos que inicio hace 10 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar más marranos para criar y posteriormente vender. Ella estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria, esta casada y tiene en total 3 hijos. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada por la oportunidad que le brindan de crecer en su negocio y superarse. Quiere este prestamo para comprar más animales que ya tiene comprometidos y con esto tener mayor ganancias y así brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y la oportunidad de ofrecerles educación con lo cual puedan tener un mejor futuro y cumplir sus metas que se propongan. Observaciones la señora que no se alcanza a ver bien en la fotografia se llama Alejandra
texts.en:
This group is called “Flamingoes” and is located in the state of Puebla in Mexico.  The group is comprised of 11 members, and this is the first time they request a loan.  Florina is one of the members; she dedicates herself to selling hogs, a business she started 10 years ago.  

She requests this loan to buy more animals to raise and later sell.  She studied up to the third grade, is married and has 3 children.  At the time of making this request for a loan, she is enthusiastic about the opportunity it gives her to grow her business and succeed.  

She would like this loan to buy more animals since she already has commitments for them.  This brings her more income, which will allow her to provide a better standard of living for her children and to offer them an education so they can enjoy brighter futures and meet any goals they set for themselves.  Note that the woman who is difficult to see in the picture is named Alejandra.

loans.use: buy hogs to raise.

loans.name: Natig

texts.ru: Natig 39 let. Jenat imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Natig yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione ,posolok Khoradiz vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On 5 let kak zanimayetsya perevozkoy stroitelnix materialov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupir zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyego qruzovika , tak kak on ne mojet rabotat ne pochiniv yego.
texts.en: Natig is 39 years old.  He is married and has two children, both of whom attend school.  Natig is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Khoradiz village of the Fuzuli region together with his family.  He has been involved in transportation of construction materials for five years.  Currently, he need 2000 AZN in order to buy spare parts to repair his truck because he cannot work unless it is fixed.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his truck

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь замужем. Ее супруга зовут Александр. Любовь имеет свой бизнес - продает женскую одежду и обувь.  Она занимается этим делом уже 15 лет и имеет достаточный опыт.  Любовь имеет  две торговые точки: одна в городе Мелитополе, другая в Кирилловке на побережье Азовского моря. 

Любовь трудолюбивая, ответственная и открытая. Она не останавливается на достигнутом и хочет продолжать развивать бизнес.  Любовь просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15,000 гривен на приобретение нового сезонного товара. Увеличение ассортимента поможет ей  получить дополнительную прибыль, которую она сможет потратить на улучшение благосостояния семьи и развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Lyubov' is married.  Her husband's name is Alexander.  Lyubov' has her own trade business and sells women's clothing and shoes.  She has been in business for 15 years and is very experienced in the trade field.  Lyubov' has two business locations: one in city of Melitopol' and another in Kirilovka on Azov sea coast. 

Lyubov' is a hardworking, responsible and sincere person.  She's not content with what she's achieved and wants to continue developing and growing her business.  Lyubov' is seeking a loan of 15,000 hryvnas for purchase of new seasonal clothing inventory for her business.  Increasing the assortment of her inventory will help her generate additional profits, which she can then use to improve living conditions of her family and further grow her business.

loans.use: приобрести новый сезонный товар

loans.name: C4714 Intwari Group

texts.en:
Marianne is 36 years old and married. She has three children between 5 and 11 years old. She is the president of a group called “Intwari.”  She is the first person in her group. 

Marianne sells various goods such as rice, sugar, bread and biscuits. Marianne employs two persons for help her and has been working for two years.

Marianne and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more goods such as beans, cassava, maize, rice, sugar, bread, etc., to sell.

With the profits from the loan, Marianne and her team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses and start saving.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urquillos en la Provincia de Calca y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cirila; la socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es soltera; La socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica a la agricultura como actividad principal, y al comercio minorista en la modalidad de compra y venta de verduras; ella vende todo tipo de verduras como arvejas, zanahoria, cebollas, lechuga; zapallo, tomate, brócoli, coliflor, habas,  pero su principal actividad es la agricultura, la socia vende al por mayor maíz blanco, la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para la nueva siembra de maíz blanco para que la socia pueda cosechar en 4 meses.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sra. Cirila is a member of the Communal Bank “Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos” which is located in the District of Urquillos, Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old, single, and has two children. Cirila’s main business activity is farming, but she is also a small retailer who buys and sells all types of vegetables such as peas, carrots, onions, lettuce, squash, tomatoes, broccoli, cauliflower, and beans. Even though her main business activity is farming, she also sells white corn in bulk. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for a new crop of white corn that she can harvest in four months.

Cirila is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase white corn seeds for planting.

loans.name: Malaka Jaya 3 Group

texts.en: Sula is 50 years old, married and has five children. Two years ago, she opened a kiosk in the town of Pasar Malaka Baru where she makes a living selling vegetables. Her business has been a success because she is now earning enough money to help meet her family's daily needs. She is applying for a loan for 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiahs to pay for more herbs and vegetables, including spinach, kale and carrots, to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business to sell other types of groceries.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and herbs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix lives in the Philippines. He is is 30 years old and married with 1 child. 
Felix has a shop that sells snacks, beverages, ice, ice water & ice candies. He has had this business for 2 years.  He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Felix is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Felix hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks for his store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old. She lives in her own home with her life partner and three grown-up children. 

She has a wood lamination business that she attends to every day with dedication and kindness. Marilyn's business is located in a very rural area, where she is surrounded by many farms. In addition to this business, she has her own corn farm.

Marilyn is an exemplary woman who never tires of working despite her advanced age. She has decided to request a loan of PHP 7,000 so the business will become stronger. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of wood, glue and other needs for wood lamination. In this way, she hopes to improve her sales, her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials for her wood lamination business

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: Federico de 30 años de edad vive en la ciudad e Cartagena y se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, negocio que inició hace 2 años,  una vez terminara sus estudios de bachiller y ante la dificultad para conseguir empleo,  decidió generar ingresos mediante una actividad independiente. Su mercado lo inició con familiares, que poco a poco le recomendaron a otras personas y hoy ha logrado construir una clientela estable,  que quiere ampliar. Federico vende a crédito toallas, implementos de aseo, pijamas, colonias, cosméticos y todo lo que se le ocurre a su clientela pedirle y esta al alcance de sus posibilidades. Su mayor desafío es responderle oportunamente a su clientela, por que como cada día crece, su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para complacerlos y lograr generar más utilidades por concepto de ventas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa, accesorios femeninos, toallas, sobre los pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, a propósito de que se acerca el día del amor y de la amistad y quieren agasajar a sus familiares y amigos con obsequios que comprarán a Federico, que de su parte se   prepara para el repunte de sus ventas y por eso aprovechará al máximo la inyección de capital de trabajo a través de su financiamiento, con el que le auguramos éxitos, teniendo en cuenta su experiencia, y el aprovechamiento que hace de su mercado rentable.
texts.en:
Federico is 30 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena. He sells a variety of merchandise and started this business two years ago. After finishing his high school education, he found it difficult to secure a job so he decided to generate income by engaging in an independent activity. His initial market consisted of relatives but gradually he was recommended to other people and today has built a stable customer base that he wants to expand. Federico sells on credit towels, cleaning implements, pajamas, colognes, cosmetics, and anything else requested by his customers. This allows him to cover all of the possibilities. His greatest challenge is being able to respond to his customers in a timely manner. With each passing day, his operating capital becomes insufficient for satisfying his customers and generating more profits from his sales. This is why he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

He will use the money to buy clothes, women’s accessories, and towels so that he can fulfill the orders his customers have made. With regard to the Day of Love and Friendship (the Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day), his customers want to show their affection for relatives and friends with gifts purchased from Federico. Therefore, he wants to be prepared for the spike in sales and make the most of his loan by injecting operating capital into his business. Based on his experience, this will increase his chance of success as he takes advantage of this profitable market.

loans.use: to buy clothes, women’s accessories, and towels so that he can fulfill his customers' orders.

loans.name: Genel

texts.en:
Genel is 26 years old and lives in Sangay Diot, Ozamis City. She is married, with one child. 

Genel has a load business. She has had this work for almost two years. She requested a loan of 14,999 to purchase load for her loading  business.

Genel has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Genel hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase load for her loading business.

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 60 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Regina who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged 27 and 25 years old. He has been a farmer for the past year with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET. He was introduced to the organization by an existing KADET customer. Joseph will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will venture into poultry farming. His hopes and dreams are to concentrate more on poultry which will help improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is a housewife and the mother of four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Surriya stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is a very active and cooperative person by nature.
  
Her husband operates a grocery store in the community. Through his store, he sells everyday household items like spices, sugar, rice, lentils, etc. for reasonable rates to his customers.

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With this loan, her husband will buy groceries in bulk to be able to sell in his store. This will help him make better sales and earn better profits.
 
Surriya hopes that the investment will be a productive one for her husband and will improve the standard of living for her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Los Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Perseverantes” lo conforman 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran confección de ropa, venta de cosméticos, preparación de comida rápida, artesanía, preparación de ensaladas y atención de un minimarket, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Maritza delegada del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo de pie, de derecha a izquierda, su cabello es color negro y se encuentra tomado, además viste una chaqueta color blanco con azul.
Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 30 años.
Su taller de trabajo se encuentra al interior de su casa en un dormitorio que habilitó para realizar sus costuras. Su taller cuenta con dos maquinas de coser una de estas es una recta industrial y la otra es una overlock. También presta sus servicios a empresas confeccionando overoles. 
Durante esta temporada se encuentra confeccionando manteles y bombachos para mujeres, temporada de muy alta demanda.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes sectores para abaratar costos, entre estos se encuentran el barrio Meiggs e Independencia. Últimamente también está comprando los moldes en una feria libre.
Con el crédito comprará una maquina multipunto y dos motores para maquinas. 
Las metas para su negocio son comprar un maquina bordadora, ya que pretende aumentar su número de producción de bolsas de párvulos, para bordar diseños y nombres. De esta manera también captar un mayor número de clientes. 
Maritza vive junto a su marido y su hija de 28 años de edad, quien trabaja de manera dependiente. Sus sueños a nivel personal son postular al subsidio habitacional para obtener su casa propia, ya que actualmente arrienda. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y de esta manera podrá aumentar su producción, lo que le permitirá generar mayores ganancias.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Los Perseverantes”. It consists of 20 entrepreneurs who run different businesses such as garment manufacturing, cosmetic sales, fast food preparation, crafts, salad-making and managing a minimart among others. They are all from the city of Valparaiso. 

Maritza is a member of the communal bank and can be seen in the photo standing at the back, from right to left, with black hair and wearing a white and blue jacket. She has been making garments for 30 years. She has a workshop inside her house in a bedroom which she converted for sewing. Her workshop has two sewing machines, one of which is an industrial straight and the other an overlock. She also takes orders from companies making overalls. This season, she has been making shawls and baggy trousers which have been in very high demand. She buys her materials in different places to save on costs; these include the Meiggs and Independencia neighbourhoods. Lately she has also been buying the patterns at an open air market. With the loan she will buy a multipoint sewing machine and 2 motors for machines.

The goals for her business are to buy an embroidery machine as she wants to increase her stock production of nursery bags, to embroider designs and names. In this way she also captures a larger number of customers.

Maritza lives with her husband and her daughter who is 28 years old and who is self-employed. Her dreams at the personal level are to apply for a housing subsidy for home ownership as she is currently renting.

She is very happy and grateful for the loan obtained by Fondo Esperanza as it has allowed her to invest in her business and in this way to increase production which will allow her to generate more profits.

Valparaíso is located 120 kms to the northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also the seat of legislative power in the country. It is the nation's main port and offers a wide variety of beautiful and picturesque places such as the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, Nobel Prize winner.

loans.use: to buy a multi-point sewing machine and 2 motors for machines.

loans.name: Sofah

texts.en:
Sofah is 23 years old and single. He has been running a retail shop for the last three years to make a living. Previously, he managed a grocery business. Sofah has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 

Sofah is requesting for a loan for 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a weighing machine and a refrigerator. In the next five years, he wants to establish a wholesale business. Sofah has become more business oriented through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management.

loans.use: to purchase a weighing machine and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin is 47, married with five children.  He is an Internally Displaced Person.  His primarily business is sheep breeding and cattle.  He keeps sheep for meat and fur purposes and cattle for the sale of milk and other dairy products.  Meat and milk is his most popular product and Azerbaijani people use them in every day cuisine.  This is the only financial income in Aydin's family and his monthly profit is 230 AZN.  Now he has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase one milking cow and several sheep.  He is a good client of AqroInvest with a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow and several sheep.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: Luz  vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe con su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Allí  es muy conocida  y tiene un taller de confecciones en compañía de su madre, donde produce ropa femenina e infantil, oficio que han ejercido varias generaciones de su  familia ; Su sueño es ampliar su infraestructura técnica dotándola de máquinas industriales para mejorar los tiempos productivos y aumentar la calidad de las prendas que ofrece a su mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el  comprará una máquina industrial y telas por rollos, preparándose para una de las temporadas más rentables del año, como lo es la épocas de navidades y año nuevo, donde su clientela acude a Luz para que su familia sea bien vestida por excelentes  diseños que solo Luz, con su calidad en el producto y el servicio, sabe ofrecer.
texts.en:
Luz lives in the municipality of Puerto Colombia on the banks of the Caribbean Sea with her little two-year-old son. She is well-known there and has a textile workshop along with her mother where she produces women's and children's clothing. Her family has been in the trade for several generations. 

Her dream is to expand her technical infrastructure, outfitting it with industrial machinery to improve production times and increase the quality of the clothing she offers at her store.

This is the reason she turns to her CrediKiva. She will use her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a new industrial machine and bolts of yardage. She is preparing for one of the most profitable times of year - such as the Christmas and New Year seasons are. This is when her clientele turns to Luz so their families can be well dressed with excellent designs that only Luz, with her quality product and service, can provide.

loans.use: to buy industrial machinery and bolts of yardage.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos que estudian en la universidad, Mauro es empleado de la alcaldía municipal, como barrendero, lleva 10 años en este lugar, actualmente como sus hijos estudian, se le presenta un gasto educativo, en el pago de unas cuotas y compra de material didáctico.
Esta situación le lleva a solicitar un préstamo para cubrir dicho gasto, contribuyendo así a que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Mauro lives with his family, and has two children in university. Mauro is employed by municipality as street cleaner. He  he worked there for ten years. 

Now, as his children are in school, educational expenses are arising, such as payment of fees, and purchase of educational materials.This situation is leading him to apply for a loan to cover this expense. He is helping in this way, so that his children have what they need to continue their studies.

loans.use: To pay university fees and buy educational materials for his children.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Gemma has a bakeshop that sells breads, cakes & pastries. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop.

loans.name: Marcela Benita

texts.es:
La joven Marcela de 22 años de edad, es comerciante vende frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de León , tiene 1 hijo pequeño de un año de edad. Inicio con este negocio a los 17 años de edad cuando su madre se encargaba del negocio de ventas de frutas y verduras las frescas y dulces quien orgullosa y sonriente recibe a sus clientes.
Ella realizo el préstamo para compra de  verduras y frutas al por mayor  pues durante este época la afluencia de comerciante es constante por tal motivo quiere ofrecer lo mejor y a un buen precio a sus clientes. Además las ventas son muy buenas y le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Ella está ahorrando para construir su vivienda y brindarle un techo digno a su hijo.
texts.en:
The young Marcela is 22 years old and is a merchant.  She sells fruits and vegetables in the municipal market of the city of Leon.  She has one small child who is one year old.  She started this business at 17 years old when her mother was in charge of a business selling fresh and sweet fruits and vegetables.  Her mother was proud and smiling when she received her customers.
She undertook the loan to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale because during this time the influx of the merchant is constant for that reason she wants to offer the best and at a good price to her customers.  In addition, sales are very good and it helps her improve her business.  She is saving to build her home and provide decent shelter for her child.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is 28 years old. He is married to Sarafina and supports a family of 4 people. The couple has been blessed with one child. For the last five years, Osman has been selling clothes, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000.

He is borrowing his first loan of KES 30,000, which he intends to use to buy more stocks of clothes for the business. He plans to open another shop with the anticipated profit from the business.

His hope and dream is to prosper in business.

loans.use: To add more stock to his business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Angelita is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Angelita is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community. Angelita has been in her business for 6 years and earns 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Angelita is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Angelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en: Mary is a 32-year-old married woman. She has four children between 2 and 14 years old. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a retail store and a chemist where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located along a busy matatu route and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of clothes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to import clothes and supply them to retailers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth would like to buy mobile phones accessories for her shop.

loans.name: Tuan

texts.en: Mr. Tuan and Dieu got married 21 years ago. They have three children. The children's ages are 20, 19, and 14. The two old children stopped going to school to earn money as daily labourers; only the youngest daughter continues at high school. They have a field that is 4000 square meters. They grow rice and raise  fish and pigs, and Tuan buys and sells lottery tickets to make money. However, their income is only $11 per person/month. They need a loan of $75 from the Kiva program so that they can improve their field and trade lottery tickets. They hope that their life will be better. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To improve the field and trade lottery tickets

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Hola Mi nombre es Adelina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia (venta de productos para sonsumo Humano), tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, mi negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de transporte de mi ciudad. Gracias a este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente la demanda a crecido por lo que necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de producto a mis clientes.

Hi, my name is Adelina, I have a small shop selling groceries. I have many years dedicating myself to this type of business. My business is located in the transportation terminal of my city. Thanks to this business I can contribute income to meet my family’s expenses. Currently, the demand has increased and I need to stock my business to be able to offer a variety of products to my clients.

loans.use: Compra de pollo, arroz, azucar, manteca, jabon, papel higienico, huevos y frijoles// Purchase of chicken, rice, sugar, lard, soap, toilette paper, eggs, beans.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian is 36 years old and a single mother of a son, to whom she gives all the love and care she can. Lilian told us that she began sewing more than 20 years ago. She learned from her mother, who she helps and trades work with. Lilian is a humble person and a very hard worker, thanks to her efforts and the support from the Fundacion Paraguaya, she has been able to gain independence and establish her own sewing shop where her clients come to request different types of clothing. Lilian makes wedding dresses, blouses, uniforms, etc.

She would like there to be more opportunities for work in her country because the economic situation for most people is more stable. In this way, they can avoid more people emigrating to other countries in search of work. Already many of her clients have left for other countries.

In recent months, Lilian has received a large quantity of orders, and to be able to complete them she would like to buy thread, fabric, buttons, zippers wholesale, because buying in greater quantities enables her to get better discounts from her suppliers. To make this happen, she is requesting a loan of $200.

La señora Lilian tiene 36 años, es madre soltera de un hijo varón a quien ella brinda todo el amor y cuidados necesarios. Lilian nos cuenta que se inició en el rubro de la costura hace mas de 20 años y lo aprendió de su madre, con quien siempre intercambian trabajos y se ayudan. Ella es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora, gracias a su sacrificio y con el apoyo de los créditos otorgados por la Fundación Paraguaya ella pudo independizarse y establecer su propio taller de costura donde hoy día recibe a sus clientes que solicitan diferentes tipos de trabajos. Ella realiza vestidos de novias, quinceañeras, camisas, uniformes, etc. Ella desea que en el país existan más fuentes de trabajo para que la situación económica de todos sea más estable de esta forma evitar que la gente emigre a otros países en busca de trabajo, ya que muchos de sus clientes emigraron a otros países. En los últimos meses ha recibido una gran cantidad de trabajos, para poder cumplir con todos desea adquirir telas, hilos, botones y cierres al por mayor ya que comprando en grandes cantidades obtiene mejores descuentos de sus proveedores. Para realizar estas compras, Lilian, solicita un crédito de $ 200.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy thread, fabric, buttons and zippers in bulk

loans.name: Mardonio

texts.es:
Mardonio H. cooks and sells seafood meals in downtown Nuevo Laredo. He and his son have been in business for 14 years. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy supplies and some tables and chairs so his customers can enjoy their meals comfortably.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Mardonio H. tiene un negocio de venta de comida de mariscos en el centro de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Tengo con el negocio mas de 14 años en el trabajamos mi hijo y yo estamos solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para la compra de mercancía y comprar sillas y mesas para atender a los clientes y que el cliente este mas cómodo.

loans.use: To buy seafood and some tables and chairs.

loans.name: Komla Basile

texts.fr:
Born in Bénin in 1972, Mr. Komla Basile A. is married and has five people to look after. A mechanic by profession, he is much appreciated by his customers in Afagnan for the care he takes over his work. With five years’ experience already, Basile is well qualified to give a warm welcome to his customers and offer them good service. Overcome with the desire to own a motorcycle taxi, he is taking advantage of this opportunity to request a loan of $700 in order to achieve his dream. The money he makes from this work will allow him to repay the loan and look after his children’s health, nutrition and schooling, so that his family can flourish.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né au Bénin en 1972, Monsieur Komla Basile A. est marié et compte cinq personnes à sa charge. Mécanicien de profession il est très bien apprécié par sa clientèle d’Afagnan pour le soin qu’il accorde à son travail. Déjà cinq aux expérience, basile possède une expérience qui lui permet de bien accueillir et servir ses clients. Aujourd’hui dans un désir fou d’être propriétaire d’un taxi-moto, elle saisi de cette occasion pour solliciter $700 afin de réaliser sa rêve. Les recettes de ce travail lui permettra de rembourser le crédit, et bien s’occuper de ses enfants en matière de santé, d’alimentation, de scolarité afin de bien épanouir sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Mrs. Chuon S., 24, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works with her husband at a garment factory, earning collectively around US$ 5 to $6 each day. Mrs. Chuon S. would like to request a loan to purchase a sewing machine and cloth so she can open a tailoring business at home. Part of the loan money will also be used to buy a motorcycle for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth so she can open a tailoring business at home

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila belongs to the Las Paikanas community bank located in AH, at Micaela Bastidas, Jr. 1ro de Mayo 250, District of Calleria, Deparment of Ucayali. She is 34 years old and the mother of two young children who are still dependent on her. She is married and her husband works in a glass factory. With the first 300 sols loan granted by Manuela Ramos, she decided to begin selling soft drinks.

She currently still sells carbonated beverages, ice and homemade popsicles.

With the loan valued at 1,000 sols, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase bags for the ice and popsicles, 1 box of milk and 10 boxes of soft drinks.

Zoila has become an enterprising woman who independently manages her own business, supports her family and finances her children’s education. She has shown that the support from Manuela Ramos has helped her to grow, to believe in herself and to do things she never thought possible; she is very proud of these achievements.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Zoila pertenece al banco comunal Las Paikanas, ubicado en el AA.HH. Micaela Bastidas, Jr. 1ro de Mayo 250, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en una vidriería. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas.

En la actualidad continúa con la venta de bebidas gaseosas, hielos y elaboración de chupetes.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará bolsas para hielo y chupetes, 1 caja de leche y 10 cajas de gaseosas.

Zoila se volvió una mujer emprendedora ya que maneja independientemente su propio negocio, aporta en su hogar y en la educación de sus hijos. Manifiesta que el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos la ayudó bastante a crecer y a creer en ella misma, a realizar cosas que no pensaba y se siente muy feliz por ello.

loans.use:
To purchase products (bags, milk, refreshments)

Compra de productos (bolsas, leche, gaseosas)

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: U. Mahbuba has been running her business for several years already. She and her husband have two trading places. Both are located in the central local market. In one, Mahbuba is selling foodstuffs like candies and sweets, housewares like toothpastes and brushes, detergents and washing liquids. In the other, there is wide range of such goods as electrical house equipment like electrical kettles, ovens, heaters and housewares like plates and dishes, and tools and others. The business is the main source of income for the family. As Mahbuba as well as her husband are involved in the business, that takes lots of their time and effort. Today Mahbuba is planning to expand the business and purchase more goods, thus increasing the range of goods for selling. With this purpose she requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 5 months. Being loaned money by IMON several times already and having proved herself as a reliable client, Mahbuba promises to pay the current loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of the foodstuffs like confectioneries and sweets and home electrical equipment (appliances) in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina A. is a hairdresser and her husband is a carpenter. They have three children. Celestina's customers have increased but she lacks funding to expand her business.

She is asking for $275.00 to use as additional capital to buy more creams and other items that she needs to run her business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy more creams and other items she needs to run her business smoothly

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr:
Mr. D. is a professional tailor in the big open-air market called Ndoumbé DIOP. He has been in this business for 40 years.

As he gets older, he has specialized in sewing traditional African women's clothing since that is less stressful and quite profitable without calling for a lot of expense.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mr D. est tailleur de profession dans le grand marché « Ndoumbé DIOP », il exerce cette profession depuis 40 ans. Rattrapé par l’age, il s’est spécialisé dans la confection de pagnes pour dame car il produit moins d’efforts et la rentabilité là dessus est relativement intéressante, et ne nécessite pas beaucoup de dépenses.

loans.use:
to purchase cloth and other sewing necessities

Pour acheter des tissus et autres produits entrant dans la fabrication.

loans.name: Harriet Namboyera's Group

texts.en:
Harriet is leader of a group with four members. She is 27 years old and married with two children, ages five and two. One of them goes to school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban and surrounded by slums.

She has been selling local brew for two years in Kasubi, one of the busy suburbs of Kampala. She collects the brew from the village and sells it to residents of the nearby slums. She must face the problem of thieves who waylay people and rob them of money and property.

She has been able to build her business and contribute to the day-to-day running of her home. She would like to buy a plot of land in order to construct a house.

Harriet has successfully paid back more than five loans.

loans.use: She would like to increase her stock in order to earn more income.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Charcoal is one of the most popular sources of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes due to its affordability. This has created businesses for a lot of Ghanaian women. Diana is one of these women. She is 60 years old and divorced with 4 children. She has been selling charcoal for the past 15 years, at least, and is the oldest seller in her neighborhood. With the charcoal business, she has supported all of her children to finish school and start working. She still enjoys selling and takes a lot of pride in serving her customers. Diana wants to use the loan to purchase charcoal in bulk to enable her to reduce her costs to raise a good income. She hopes to use part of her profit to complete a shelter for her family. She is a member of the community group called Blessing Trust group. The group guarantees a loan through a repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es:
Dalia started her business out of necessity; because for her husband, the fishing at times goes well but at other times it does not, particularly when the fishery season is closed. Because of this she wanted to help him with the household expenses that are ever-increasing as their children grow up. She needed to have an additional income that would permit them to cover their necessities when her husband’s work was scarce, since all of their children are studying and at times their situation is very difficult. Although she works in the cleaning department of a construction company, the salary is not very high. She started her business when a friend at work encouraged her to sell household goods and cosmetics in her free time, which she thought was a good idea. In 2004 she started to sell them and in 2006 incorporated cosmetic sales. Both products she started selling to her co-workers, neighbors and friends, and today she has a good client base, and moreover is expanding her business and is now starting to sell fish and shellfish.

She needs a loan for US$1000 which she will pay in 6 months in order to buy cosmetics and products that will allow her to have a better selection of goods to offer her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalia inició el negocio por necesidad, ya que a su esposo a veces le va bien en la pesca pero otras veces no, sobre todo cuando es temporada de veda, por eso quizo ayudarlo para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar que cada día aumentan con el crecimiento de sus hijos. Ella necesitaba tener un ingreso adicional que les permitiera cubrir nuestras necesidades cuando el trabajo de su esposo fuera escaso, ya que todos sus hijos están estudiando y a veces su situación es muy difícil, y aunque ella trabajo en el área de limpieza de una constructora, sueldo no es muy alto. Comenzó? con su negocio cuando una amiga del trabajo la alentó a que vendiera productos para el hogar y cosméticos en sus ratos libres, lo cual le pareció una buena idea, y desde el año 2004 comenzó a venderlos y en el 2006 incorporo la venta de cosméticos. Ambos productos los comenzó vendiendo entre sus compañeros de trabajo, vecinas y amigas, y hoy tiene ya una buena clientela, además ha ampliado su actividad y ahora empieza a vender pescados y mariscos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar cosméticos y productos que le permitan tener una mejor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Celia Benita

texts.es:
Miss Celia Benita is 43 years old. She finished secondary education. She used to help her Dad sell bread, but she got married and now she has 4 children. She lives in the District of Razuri in the Province of Ascope, at the Department of La Libertad. Since her husband is a fisherman and he didn’t have work all the time, she started selling rice zambito (rice, pecans and caramel sauce), rice with milk, toffee, maize with honey, cake of yucca and pumpkin fritters. She got an invitation from a friend to join the Communal Bank “MALABRIGO II”. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 1 year, 7 months. With the first loan of $300 she bought cornstarch, impalpable sugar, grated coconut, and butter. With this loan of $500 that she will repay over a period of 4 months, she wants to invest in buying a showcase to display her products, a table, cornstarch, and flour. The partner wished to have her own oven, and to be able to go out to sell her products to different shops.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Celia Benita, tiene 43 años, estudió secundaria completa, ayudaba a vender pan a su Papá, pero luego se comprometió, tiene 04 hijos, vive en el Distrito de Razuri en la Provincia de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad. Como su esposo es pescador y no tenía un trabajo seguro, empezó a vender arroz zambito, arroz con leche, tofee, mazamorra, pastel de yuca, picarones. Recibió una invitación de una amiga para participar en el Banco Comunal “MALABRIGO II”, tiene 01 año 07 meses trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró maicena, azúcar impalpable, manjar blanco, coco rayado, manteca. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 que cancelará en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de 01 vitrina, 01 mesa, maicena, harina, manjar blanco. La socia sueña con tener un horno propio, salir a vender a las tiendas.

loans.use: Buy supplies,a showcase and a table.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., aged 37, joined TYM Fund in 2002. First she borrowed VND 1 million to invest in pig raising. For the following loans, as she could access bigger loans, she bravely invested her loans in cow raising. Besides, she sells lemon to generate more income for her family. With VND 3 million/month from her businesses and income of her husband, a builder, her family's economy develops ceaselessly. For the next loan cycle, she is applying for VND 15 million to upgrade her breeding facilities and raise more pigs.

loans.use: to upgrade breeding facilities and raise more pigs

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun S., age 62, is married and lives with three of her ten children in Prey Veng, Cambodia. She works with her husband as a farmer and makes less than one dollar each day. She said her farming just barely supports the family members. 

This couple also is supported by five of their children who work in a garment factory. Farming uses a lot of labor and they need to have enough water or the yield will decrease and they might suffer crop damage. This couple grows rice twice a year, first in the rainy season, which is about 6-7 months long and second, in the dry season, which is about 3-4 months long. 

To alleviate their daily expense and earn more profit, Sun S. is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike so that one of her sons can run a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Wiracocha Village Bank. Wiracocha means “Sun God” in Quechua. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband; they are currently expecting their first child. Julia has a small store in her parents’ house where she sells dry goods, fruits, vegetables and meat every day. She also has a bakery, where she bakes all different kinds of breads using a rustic, wood-fired oven. She sells the bread in her store and also sells it in bulk to other stores.

Julia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar, and oil. Julia’s dreams are to expand her business, offer a wider variety of merchandise, keep strengthening her values system, and have a beautiful family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua. Julia es conviviente, tiene 34 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Julia tiene una bodega en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, carnes, actividad que realiza diariamente. Además Julia tiene una panadería en donde elaboran toda variedad de panes, el horno es rustico a leña, sus ventas los realiza en su tienda y también reparte por mayor a las tiendas. Julia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite. Los sueños de Julia son surtir y ampliar su negocio, enriquecer sus valores y tener una linda familia.

loans.use: Julia would like to buy rice, sugar and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
Jomar A. is 37 years old and married to Marilyn who is a housewife. The couple did not have the chance to have a child after many years of being married, but they still pray hard to have a child who will give them inspiration.

Jomar maintains a 0.8 hectare rice field and two hectares of banana plantation. He also pawned a small portion of the land. This is one reason why he strives to have a higher income in the coming harvest, in order to repay the amount and therefore have an additional farm to utilize.

In order to pursue this plan, Jomar requests a loan amounting to PHP15,000 (USD$325) which he will use to sustain his rice field and banana plants. Some of the loan will be used to buy feed for his hog-raising business.

Jomar believes that a lazy person will never receive the blessings which God pours out. Thus, Jomar and his wife keep on working so they will have a stable and sustainable source of living (and hopefully for their child, if their prayers to have one would be granted).

loans.use: Additional capital for his rice and banana crops.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: La persona que sale en la foto es la esposa del señor Juan Antonio.Juan Antonio M. desea construir una barda en la parte de atrás de su casa el vive en una zona muy riesgosa como pueden observar en la imagen esta en alto y teme que alguien pueda caer de ahí. Para empezar con la construcción de la barda el solicita la cantidad de $5,000 pesos. El señor Juan Antonio es guardia de un empresa y su esposa es empleada  domestica y con estos ingresos pagara el préstamo dado.
texts.en:
The person in the photograph is the wife of Mr. Juan Antonio. Juan Antonio M. wants to build a wall in the back part of his house. He lives in a very dangerous area. As can be seen in the picture, it is high up and someone could fall. To begin construction of the wall, he is requesting $5,000 pesos. Mr. Juan Antonio is a security guard at a company and his wife is a domestic employee. This income will allow them to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for a wall.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria Elena T. R. Es originaria del Departamento de Totonicapn dicho departamento se encuentra en el occidente del Pais de Guatemala  el lugar mas frio de todo el territorio Nacional es conocido como la  Salud del pueblo por su clima y la cantidad de bosque que posee dicho departamento. Doña maria ella se dedica a la venta de calzados para damas dicha actividad lo viene realizando desde varios años, ella  compra su mercaderia en diferentes puestos de mercados para surtir su negocio ,  y las vende en el departamento de Huehuetenango y Mazatenango y en el municipio de la Mesilla, ella solicita un prestamo en las oficina de Asdir Totonicapan para comprar  mercaderia aprovechando estas epocas de inicio del ciclo escolar dos mil nueve, y con las ganancias que optienen le permite mejor el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena T. R. is a native of the Guatamalan "departamento" of Totonicapan, the chilliest part of the country. It's known as an especially salubrious place because of its climate and extensive woodlands. Maria operates a business selling women's footwear, work that she's been doing for some years. She buys merchandise from various suppliers and sells them in the departamento of Huenhuetenango y Mazatenango and the town of La Mesilla. She's applying for a loan from Asdir Totonicapan so that she can buy merchandise and make the most of the upcoming 2009 school year. The earnings that she'll get will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo pequeño de 5 años en casa de su suegro. Ella realiza bordados desde hace 2 años atrás, como una fuente generadora de recursos, pero desde su niñez siempre ha trabajado ayudando a su mamá en su trabajo, que en ese entonces también eran los bordados. Judith trabaja tranquilamente en su casa para poder  bordar bellos fustanes, que son de muy buena calidad gracias a los detalles que le pone, lo que logra que muchas personas vayan a buscarla y solicitarle sus trabajos. La meta de Judith es tener un taller grande donde pueda contratar a varias personas que la ayuden a realizar su trabajo y seguir ahorrando para comprar un carro con el que pueda empezar a brindar servicio de transporte público. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes más puntuales, y siempre actúa con responsabilidad ante las decisiones de su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará telas e hilos y de esa manera poder abastecer los pedidos de bordados que tiene, comprará todo al por mayor y con ello obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Judith is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 5-year-old son in her father-in-law´s house. She has been doing embroidery for the past 2 years as a souce of income, but since childhood always worked helping out her mother with her embroidery. Judith works quietly from home so that she can embroider beautiful petticoats, which are of very good quality thanks to the finishing touches she gives them.
