As a result, she has a lot of people asking for her work. Judith´s goal is to have a workshop where she can hire people to help her and to keep saving so she can buy a car with which she can provide public transportation service. This is the third time she has a loan with MFP. She is one of the most punctual borrowers and always has behaved responsibly toward the decisions of her communal bank. With the money she is requesting she will buy fabric and thread to meet the requests for embroidery that she has; she will buy at wholesale and this way be able to make a greater profit.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for embroidery

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina owns a small charcoal store and is a snack vendor in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She belongs to the Frelimo B group loan (Group code 2028).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works for 6 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal, wheat flour and cooking oil for snack preparation. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, get more food for her family, and pay school fees for her children.  

Amina is 38 years old, married, and has four children: ages 18, 16, 13, and 9.

loans.use: To buy more snack ingredients

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is fifty three years old and is married with three children. One child is currently in senior high school, one is in junior high and one is in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Elmina, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Agnes works to support her husband financially. She owns a lavatory for public patronage. Customers, mostly passers by and travelers, check in to wash down and attend to natures call. She charges a fee (a token) to the customers for using the place. Agnes says she needs a loan to expand and maintain the facility. She has been running this business for six years.

She is hopeful to help her husband build their own home so that they can improve upon their life and give their children the best education.

loans.use: To maintain and expand business

loans.name: Claribel

texts.en:
“In everything you do, put God first, and he will lead you to success.” This is the favorite saying of Claribel, a simple mother and a faithful wife to Armando Jr. They live in a rural place located in Barangay Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Claribel only finished high school because they got married at an early age with no job at the beginning. Since then, the couple diligently looks for business opportunities to support their family and their future children. 

Claribel found work as a dealer of AVON products. She sells them to her friends and cousins. In this way, she is able to help her husband earn a living for their family while he cultivates their farm that they inherited from his parents. They help each other to have a better way of living. When she learned about the KIVA loans, she was encouraged to borrow at least 5, 000 PHP as working capital to her direct selling of AVON items. She hopes to become successful in her chosen career and that someday, it will become progressive.

loans.use: To build capital for her AVON selling business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
N. N. is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, N. owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. N. has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. The previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. N. is now requesting a loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by her from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

No. 30399005

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Rusembe 2 East Nyamaizi Janate Group

texts.en:
Janate N. is a 38 year old business lady. She is married with three children and also looks after three orphans. All the children are going to school.

She has been selling used clothes and mats for over ten years. She will use this loan to purchase used clothes to sell and materials for making mats.

She is a hardworking lady whose dream is to complete her house.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes and materials for making mats.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is already 58 years old. She sells native cakes (glutinous snacks) in their village of Barangay Divisoria, Santiago City. She is a mother of strong determination because she was able to raised her children alone and sustain her family’s daily needs through her hard work and patience in vending her cooked snacks.

Hilda said that she needs additional vending capital for her to gain a bigger income to continue to support the schooling of her youngest daughter. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders as financial assistance in her vending business. This amount will really be a big help, Hilda further said.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos es originario de la comunidad de Cojxac del Municipio de Totonicapan actualmente cuenta con dos fuentes de ingreso uno que todos los dias todas las mañanas vende cosa especialmente para damas en su puesto de venta, por las tardes su actividad es ayudante de albañil, los dias domingo sale a vender en el municipio de San Cristobal Totonicapan, hasta la fecha todo le va muy vien en la actualidad esta buscando otro puesto de venda para su esposa y la cual lo esta logrando y por ello necesita de un credito para la compra de mercaderia.
texts.en:
Carlos is from the Cojxac community in the Totonicapán municipality. He currently has two sources of income. Every morning from his place of business he sells things especially for women. In the afternoons he works as an assistant bricklayer. On Sunday he sells in the San Cristobal Totonicapan municipality. Things are going very well for him. He is currently looking for another sales location for his wife. He is setting it up, and he needs a loan to buy the merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet M. has been a farmer for many years. With her 2 sons and her meager savings, she started a laundry business in Athi River. Her two sons are part of her staff. She is requesting for a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to buy equipment for her laundry. Harriet hopes that this loan will help to expand her business and enable her to generate enough profit to send her sons to college.

loans.use: Buy machine for her laundry

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily D. is a 27 year old married farmer in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur.  She is excited to have a baby. She dreamed to finally have a son so that she can teach him how to plant rice and have an abundant harvest in the farm.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase 1 unit of sprayer, 2 sacks of fertilizers, and other farm items. She thinks that by doing so, she will reap a better yield and earn a bigger income from her farm.

She is very pleased with CEVI's humble efforts for the poor. CEVI, according to her, is offering the lowest interest rates compared to the other MFI she has seen before.

loans.use: To purchase 1 unit of sprayer, 2 sacks of fertilizers and other farm items

loans.name: Chascañawi Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Chascañawi” se reúne cada dos semanas en el centro focal Senkata, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con trece miembros los cuales han demostrado ser un grupo, muy organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación, por ejemplo; venta de verduras, tejidos en macramé, Costura, Repostería, Herrería, venta de chuño y tunta (papas deshidratadas). La asociación Chascañawi precisa créditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
The “Chascañawi” association gets together every two weeks in the Senkata center in the city of El Alto. To this date, they have 13 members who have demonstrated to be a very organized group in their loan quotas and internal activities.

They have different businesses in the association such as: selling groceries, macramé, sewing, a pastry shop, a blacksmith’s shop, and selling dehydrated potatoes. The Chascañawi association needs loans to buy more products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Products

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.ru: Махмуджон Шокиров проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 22 года. Холост, детей не имеет. В семье кроме него работает его отец. Махмуджон более 3 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном торгует женским ассортиментом. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Mahmudjon S. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 22 years old, single and has no children. Besides Mahmudjon, his father is the only other working family member. Mahmudjon has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 3 years. He mainly sells women's goods. He is requesting a loan to purchase new goods selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new goods selection

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 43 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a su esposo, Teofilo de 50 años, y juntos planean salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. La actividad diaria de Victoria es la venta de carne, tiene su puesto en el mercado Las Mercedes (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido, ya que siempre vende carne de muy buena calidad, ella es una vendedora muy alegre y recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir. Para el futuro espera tener una carnicería más grande donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.
Este es el tercer préstamo de Victoria con MFP y espera no fallar en los pagos de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más carne para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Régina

texts.fr: Née vers 1950 à Ouidah ville historique du Bénin, T. Régina habite le quartier Vodjè à Cotonou. Mariée et mère de sept enfants tous scolarisés, Régina s’est lancée dans le commerce depuis plus de vingt ans. Au départ, Régina vendait de la nourriture (igname frite, riz et haricot). Mais depuis près de trois ans, Régina vend divers articles (conserves de diverses sortes, pâtes alimentaires, savons, huile végétale, biscuits, lait, etc.) à son domicile à Vodjè. Régina achète ses divers articles à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin. Régina a bien remboursé les quatre crédits précédents. Pour renforcer son étalage et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle devenue nombreuse, Régina sollicite un cinquième prêt à ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de conserves, de pâtes alimentaires, de savons, d'huile végétale, de papier hygiénique, et de biscuits

loans.name: Asem

texts.en:
Asem is a young single man; he lives with his family in Nablus City. His father is a plumber.

Two years ago, Asem opened his shop selling mobile phones, accessories, and phone cards.  Asem has requested 3000 USD from FATEN to buy some stock for his shop. 

Asem appears in the picture at his shop.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Like most enterprising housewives in the Philippines, Adelaida C., 47 years old, makes a living from the buying and selling of cosmetic items, apparel, shoes and bags from prominent direct-selling companies like Avon, Boardwalk, Natasha, Marikina Shoe Exchange, etc. This is a tried and tested source of income. She also sells load credits for mobile phones and now earns net income of P10,000 a month from the combined proceeds of her businesses. Adelaida’s family lives in Pasay City, a bustling community in the middle of the metropolis. Her husband, Cecilio, 44, is a non-medical staff member at the Makati Medical Center in the adjacent city. They have two children, one of whom is in college while the other is in high school. A large portion of Adelaida’s profits go to her children’s educational expenses. Adelaida joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative and has applied for a new loan for the same amount. This will be her tenth loan. She will use the funds to purchase cosmetics to meet her commitments on her clients’ advance orders. Adelaida dreams of seeing all her children finish their college studies. She also wishes to own a new house and lot for her family. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To pay for advance orders of cosmetics for her clients

loans.name: Aysel

texts.en:
Aysel S. is 26 years old. Aysel owns a successful clothing sales business at the central market in Lankaran. She has been running this business for 5 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Aysel tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. 

Aysel has requested a loan of 1600 AZN to increase her inventory. This is a busy time for many market vendors, because the cold season is coming and everyone is preparing for the winter season. By purchasing additional inventory, Aysel will be better prepared to meet the increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverance and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for winter season

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima tiene 41 años de edad por lo que anteriormente ella tenía un financiamiento que le fue de mucha ayuda. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad por lo que siempre le ha gustado, además ella sale a ofrecer sus productos en un carretón ya que es el único medio de transporte que posee. Por lo que tiene 1 hijo por cual preocuparse. Ha sido muy difícil salir adelante pues no tenía el suficiente apoyo. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos ya que en esta temporada navideña tiene muchos pedidos. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
Fátima is 41 years old. She previously had finance that helped her a lot. She works raising pigs, and has done this humble activity for more than 7 years because she has always liked it. She goes out to offer her products in a cart, as it's the only mode of transport she possesses. She has one child whom she worries about. It has been very difficult to move forward as she hasn't had sufficient support. She is seeking this finance for working capital to purchase pigs as in this Christmas period she has many orders. Her desire is to maintain this economic activity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rannie

texts.en: Rannie maintains a rice field in Norala, South Cotabato. He is 35 years old with a child to support. His farm is his main resource for making a living. He works hard so that he can fulfill his family's financial needs. He joined Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and asked for financial support for his business.  He has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Nhav's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nhav I. is 38 years old. She is the representative of a group that consists of four people. Mrs. Nhav I. is married with three children who are all students I. the local school. This family lives I. Trapeang Srangae village I. Takeo province. Mrs. Nhav I. is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ouk Kong, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Nhav I. needs 800,000 Riel to buy a cow for breeding to improve and increase her income I. order to support her family.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: El Samaritano Group

texts.en:
Modesto is the coordinator of his group, El Samaritano (the Samaritan), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, a poor, agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their one child.

Modesto is excited to be taking his seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business, which is killing weeds in people's gardens. He will purchase five gallons of weed killer and a backpack pump. He will use the profits to invest in his home by fixing his roof as well as in his business. He would like to move his business to a street with more traffic so that he can attract more customers. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer

loans.name: María Beatriz

texts.es: María Beatriz Q. D. R. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en Jucuapa, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como conserje D. una escuela del lugar, y junto a su hija D. 17 años D. edad quien se dedica a estudiar y a ayudarle a su madre con los quehaceres del hogar y algunas veces con el negocio. María posee una tortillería la cual está ubicada en su propia casa. Cada día se levanta muy temprano, a lavar el maíz que posteriormente lleva al molino para formar la masa con la cual elabora las tortillas, tanto en los mediodías como en las tardes. Ella posee muchos clientes los cuales le son fieles desD. hace muchos años atrás, ya que María es una persona muy respetuosa y amable quien brida un excelente trabajo a sus clientes, lo cual los incentiva a comprar en el negocio D. ella. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el deseo D. poder mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, comprando maíz por mayor, el cual le dé el  acceso para atender mayor cantidad D. clientes lo cual le permita percibir mayores ganancias, que se vean reflejadas en el bienestar D. su familia, ya que esta depenD. en gran manera D. dicho negocio.
texts.en:
María Beatriz Q. D. R., 39, lives in Jucuapa, Usulután with her husband, who works as a caretaker at a local school, and her 17-year-old daughter, who is a student and helps her mother with household chores and sometimes with her business. María makes tortillas at home. Every day she rises very early to wash the corn which she then takes to the mill to be ground into tortilla dough that she uses to make tortillas twice a day: noon and afternoon. She has many regular customers that have been loyal to her for many years because María is a very respectful and kind person who provides excellent service to her customers; this motivates them to buy from her. María is requesting funds from Integral in order to improve her business’ condition; she wants to buy corn at wholesale. This will permit her to serve more customers and thereby earn higher profits. These will be seen reflected in her family’s wellbeing since this depends, to a great extent, on this business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Charish

texts.en:
“I am thankful for my farm because it helps my family a lot,” Charish L. shares about her business.

Only 22 years old, Charish knows how to maintain her farm. She is married and has a 2-year-old child. Her husband also works at their farm, making sure it is free of pests and weeds.

Charish joined CEVI in 2008 because she was in need of financial support for her business. She hopes for its program to grow to be able to help more entrepreneurs like her.

Charish would like to ask for a loan of 14,000 PHP. She tells CEVI that she will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farming inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en: Enriquita is a married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She is 46 years old and has four children. Her oldest child is now 26 years old. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She hopes that her store will grow so she can earn more and help improve her family’s living conditions. She applied for a loan of 16,000 PHP. If granted, she will use the loan to buy more stocks for her store.

loans.use: To buy store supplies

loans.name: Erdenesuren

texts.en: Erdenesuren is 53 years old and lives with her husband and son in Tuv province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Tumendelger, receives disability payments from the government. He is a great husband who helps his wife's business and takes care of his family. They have been living together in their current home for 16 years. Erdenesuren operates a meat trading business. She has been operating her business since 1993, has steadily expanded her business, and gained much experience as a businesswoman. Erdenesuren started with working capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~ 140 USD), but after 17 years of hard work her working capital is now more than 5,000,000 tugrugs (~ 3545 USD). Erdenesuren is a very hard working person with a good personality. She says, “I would like to expand my business and to purchase my own apartment for my family in the future.” She is requesting a 2,200,000-tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of meat at the wholesale price to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es: Candelario G. B. reside en el municipio de Santo Tomás, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja haciendo los quehaceres del hogar. Candelario posee una ferretería la cual esta ubicada sobre la calle principal del centro de Santo Tomas, en donde cuenta con muy buena ubicación, ya que es un lugar que cuenta con gran afluencia de personas. El servicio que Candelario ofrece en muy básico, razón por la cual cuenta con muchos clientes quienes solicitan reproducción de llaves, dar filo a cuchillos para cocina, y así mismo comprar herramientas entre otras cosas más. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con la capacidad económica para comprar herramientas para comercializar, cables, metal y otros más, los cuales le permitan ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Candelario G. B. lives in the town of Santo Tomas in the "departamento" of San Salvador. He lives in a house that he owns with his wife who works in the family home. Candelario owns a hardware business that he operates on the main street of Santo Tomas, a very good location for a business in the town because of the constant traffic on the street. The services that Candelario sells are very basic: making copies of keys, sharpening kitchen knives and supplying tools. He is applying for a loan so that he will have enough money to buy supplies of tools, wiring, metal and other products, supplies that will allow him to provide a wider range of goods to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

location.town: Santo Tomás, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta D. is from the city of Divisoria Santiago. She is 55 years old and a widow. She has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Crisanta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmer, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucia De Jesús

texts.es: Lucia de Jesús G. M. de 34 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres, niños y hombres, así mismo comercializa zapatos y accesorios para el cabello. Ella reside en Berlín ubicado al oriente del país, lugar en el cual vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Lucia tiene ubicado su puesto de venta en el mercado regional de Berlín, lugar en el cual desde hace 5 años que se dedica a este trabajo. Lucia vende la ropa y zapatos de lunes a domingo, durante toda la mañana y la tarde, ya que para ella las ganancias generadas por sus ventas, son muy importantes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, ya que junto a su esposo, van logrando salir adelante con todos los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de ropa, en diferentes tallas y colores, lo cual haga más vistosa su venta y de esta forma llame la atención de más personas, así mismo desea poder comprar diferentes estilos de zapatos y accesorios para el cabello. Lucia es una señora muy responsable, la cual cuenta con un enorme deseo de superarse y crecer mucho más como comerciante, todo con el deseo de brindarle una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia de Jesús G. M., 34, sells clothing for women, children and men, and she also sells shoes and hair accessories. She lives in Berlín in the east of the country, with her partner and their two children ages 11 and 7, who study. Lucia's stall is in the regional market in Berlin, where she has worked for 5 years. Lucia sells clothing and shoes Monday to Sunday, all morning and afternoon, and the income generated from her sales is very important for the upkeep of their home, as she and her husband are getting ahead with all the household costs. She is requesting this loan with the desire to buy a larger quantity and variety of clothing, in different sizes and colours, which will make her products more eye-catching and will draw the attention of more people. She also wants to buy different styles of shoes and hair accessories. Lucia is a very responsible woman, who has an enormous desire to succeed and grow much more as a merchant; all to offer a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, shoes and hair accessories

loans.name: Oubaidatou

texts.en:
Madame Oubaidatou O. is 38 years old and sells beauty products along the streets of Lome. She was born in neighboring Ghana and is married to an electrician. They have two children. 

Madame O. has been selling cosmetics since 2007. She is requesting her second loan from WAGES of 300,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs in order to purchase more products to sell. She works hard to repay her loan and sell her products so that she can care for her two children.

loans.use: To purchase different beauty products

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita S. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 43 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelita owns a business making and selling home made sausage or chorizo in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the ingredients needed to make her sausages. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients needed to make sausages for sale

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina J. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 43 years old, married and has 8 school-aged children. Marcelina owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch in her community. 

Marcelina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and fishing materials. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Marcelina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and fishing materials

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica E. is married and has one child. She has been through senior high school. Veronica sells groceries at Takoradi. Her husband is a cook. Veronica uses her income in helping her husband take care of her family. Veronica will use the loan to purchase more groceries for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to reinvest her returns.

loans.use: purchase more groceries for sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice M. M. is thirty years old. She is single and does not have any children. Her business is located at a market called the Stage Market in Embakasi, Nairobi. The business name is Sonnie Enterprises. She owns a shop in which she sells beauty products to hawkers who resell them at a profit. She has been in this business for three years and has managed to employ one person. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge is that she has financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more cosmetics to meet the demand of her clients. In future, she hopes to grow the business to meet the demand of more customers. She describes herself as ambitious.

loans.use: To buy supplies of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco M. is from the village of Brgy. Calaocan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 29 years old. Francisco is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Francisco owns & operates a motorcycle transport service. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisco joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Francisco from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen Maria M. G. de 41 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Santiago. Tiene casa propia de material noble. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y otros enseres menores. Su esposo es obrero de campo y trabaja en un fundo de la zona hace varios años. La Sra. Carmen requiere el crédito para capital de trabajo. Su sueño segun nos comenta es mejorar su negocio para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. La Sra. Carmen está muy agradecida por la ayuda que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Carmen Maria M. G. is 41 years old and lives with her husband in the Santiago district.  She has her own home made of solid materials.  She sells clothing and other small items.  Her husband is a field hand and has worked on a farm in the area for several years.  Carmen needs a loan for working capital.  She tells us that her dream is to improve her business so that she can have a better quality of life.  Carmen is very grateful for the help that we are able to provide her through this loan.

loans.use: working capital.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty A. is from the village of Canitoan, Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old, married and has 1 adult-aged child. Letty owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Letty is just starting this business.

In 2008, Letty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Letty is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Letty from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sets of breakable bowls (dishes).

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en: Maurine C. A.  lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of them in school. Maurine has a business selling yellow bananas and fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and works 7 days a week. She sells her products in a market, and has requested a loan of 400,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more produce. Her main business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to expand her business. Maurine lives in a home that she rents with no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy yellow bananas and boxes of cabbages

loans.name: Levitico

texts.en:
Levitico B., age 54, provides transportation services to local community members. Levitico is just starting this business. He and his wife have five grown children and live in the city of Loboc, Oroq. City. 

Earlier this year, Levitico joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. His goal was to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Levitico is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Levitico from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his family's house. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Marlita

texts.es: Marlita, de 43 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su hija y su nieta; juntas se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 16 años, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulatoria. Esta muy satisfecha con su negocio, pues obtiene regulares ganancias de las ventas de su mercadería. Deja las prendas de vestir por pedidos a sus clientes, y cobra en ese momento porque no le gusta trabajar a crédito, ya que muchas veces se han demorado en pagarle. Ya se acostumbró a traer regular cantidad de ropa de la ciudad y la escoge de acuerdo a la temporada y la moda, además  trabaja  durante todos los días, pues dice que debe buscar nuevos clientes para obtener mejores ganancias. Y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de ropa en el mercado de su zona. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Marlita tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en ropa, pues tiene algunos pedidos y por campaña navideña quiere abastecerse de diversidad de prendas de vestir, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en: Marlita, 43 years old, lives in her own home with her daughter and granddaughter; they work together every day to move forward. For the past 16 years, this hardworking woman has had a business selling clothes in the open air (not out of a store-front). She is very satisfied with her business; she has regular income from the sales of her merchandise. She drops off the clothing orders with her customers and collects on them immediately because she does not like to work on credit since many times payments do not get made. She is accustomed to bringing a certain amount of clothing from the city, which she selects based on the weather and style. She works every day, and she says that she should look for new customers so she can have better revenues. As she is an enterprising woman, she plans to open a clothing store in the future in the local market. This is the fifth loan she has had with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be punctual about making payments because she doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who have made this support possible and who have allowed her to continue working and making progress. Marlita plans to use this loan to purchase clothes because she has some orders to fill and because the Christmas bells are ringing she wants to stock up on an array of clothing items. In this way she hopes to move forward.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to fill some orders that she has.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. K. is thirty three years old and married with two children aged four and one and half. He hopes to give them a good education to the university level. His business is located at Kitengela town, next to a slaughterhouse. He owns a furniture workshop and makes such items as beds, sofas, tables, coffee tables, armchairs, wardrobes and wall units. He sells to the local people. He has been in this business for nine years. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is locked-up capital as a result of people ordering items they never pick up. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well and is using his loan of Kes 70,000 to buy a wood machine to grow his business. 

David hopes to own a big furniture shop one day with ready-made and ready-to-sell furniture. He describes himself as strict and committed to his work.

loans.use: to buy a wood machine

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who live in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province. The members selected Mrs. Phan C., 45 years old, as village bank president. Each member of this group will use her portion of the loan to support a different purpose. 

Mrs. Phan C. earns her living selling bananas and fruit at the local market. However, since she doesn't earn enough income to support her family, she wants to expand her business and thereby increase her income. She is requesting a loan to buy more bananas and fruit for selling. Mrs. Phan C. is a widow with four children; two are seamstresses in a garment factory and two attend the local school.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and fruit

loans.name: Mario Andres

texts.es:
Mario Valdez un joven de 29 años residenciado en el barrio La Maria de Cartagena y estudiante universitario, decidió emprender su negocio de repostería, cuando se le dificultó pagar sus estudios y su entre los mismos  estudiantes  y tanta acogida tuvo su negocio,  que alcanzó a captar la atención de profesores y personal administrativo  como sus clientes principales, así es que cuando necesitan celebrar cumpleaños, días especiales como el del amor y de la amistad, o en temporadas festivas, siempre lo están buscando para comprarle sus mas deliciosos postres, como el  de las tres leches y es que  se ha posicionado  es este espacio educativo  y sus pedidos han crecido gradualmente.
Últimamente se le ha dificultado comprar en mayor cantidad porque no tiene un capital de trabajo muy grande y por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para apalancarse.  Así que  este es su credikiva es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará materiales e insumos  como cremas, lácteos harinas, azúcar, uvas, frutas cristalizadas, fresas entre otros. Ahora su sueño es ampliar su negocio para tener puntos de ventas bien ubicados y con productos de la mejor calidad e higiene con la que él trabaja. Mario Vende a crédito y de contado y su mayor desafío es el manejo de los plazos que pide el cliente y los que él puede ofrecerles, con tal de recuperar su inversión lo más pronto posible para volver a surtirse y producir y de tener satisfecha a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mario Valdez is a young man, 29 years old, who lives in the community of La Maria de Cartagena. He is a university student who decided to start a bakery when he had trouble paying for his studies. It was among the students that he acquired such great attention to his business and later he attracted professors and administrative personnel as is primary clients. Whenever there is a birthday celebration, special occasions such as friendship day and Valentine's Day, or when it is the holiday season, he is always sought out for the delicious pastries he makes, especially one made with three different types of milk. He has found his place in this establishment and orders placed have been increasing gradually.

As of late he has had a difficult time buying in larger quantities because he doesn't have a substantial working capital. He has approached Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) for support.  This is his first Kiva loan and his first loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan he will purchase ingredients such as creams, milk products, flour, sugar, grapes, candied fruit, strawberries, etc. His dream is to expand his business and to have other points of sale strategically located, selling products of greater quality made in a cleaner working environment. Mario completes his sales on credit and in cash. His greatest challenge is managing the payments from the clients. The faster he is able to recover his investment he sooner he is able to supply his business and produce more pastries and keep his clientele satisfied.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una madre soltera, ella tiene 42 años de edad y reside junto a sus tres hijos en el caserío Santa Rosa de Curvan, que se encuentra en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Paula se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara su comida. Adicionalmente ella cría en su domicilio aves de corral a las cuales alimenta y cuando alcanza un nivel adecuado las vende a sus vecinos. Paula se vale de los ingresos que recibe de esta actividad para solventar la economía de su familia.

Paula desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de carrito sanguchero para poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de platos de modo que pueda ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Paula is a single mother. She is 42 years old and lives with her three children in the community of Santa Rosa de Curvan, located in a rural area of Tambogrande, an agricultural area in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Paula works in the preparation and sale of food. She makes the food in her house to later sell to the general public. The business is popular with customers because of the good seasoning she uses to make the food. She also raises poultry in her house. She feeds them, and when they are big enough, she sells them to her neighbors. Paula depends on the income she makes from this activity to pay for her family's budget.   

Paula wants to grow her business by buying a sandwich cart to be able to offer her customers a variety of dishes and thus increase her sales. That is why she has decided that it is in her interest to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 700 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy a sandwich cart

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Monsieur  Yaovi  est né à  Lomé et habite  quartier  Tokoin  Doumasséssé.  Il  a  37 ans.  Il est marié avec un enfant  en charge.  Il  vend  les produits génériques  pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins de sa  famille. Il a débuté   en  2009 et s’approvisionne  à Togo pharma.   Il revend  les  produits  dans  une boutique à  la devanture de sa maison.  Il demande un prêt  pour  acheter de nouveaux lots de produits  pour se réapprovisionner et satisfaire  plus de  clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaovi was born  in Lomé and lives in the Tokoin Doumasséssé neighborhood in Lomé. He's 37 years old, married, and has one child to support. To provide for his family, he sells generic drugs. He started in 2009, and gets his supplies from Togo Pharma.

He resells the drugs in a small shop in front of his house. He's seeking a loan to buy new batches of drugs to resupply his shop and meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy and resell generic drugs

loans.name: Loefel

texts.en:
Loefel N. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Loefel is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Loefel sells green bananas and coconuts for copras (dried coconut meat used to make coconut oil) in the local community. Loefel has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Loefel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Loefel is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts. This loan will be Loefel's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and coconuts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari store, food vending and an Avon dealership. She lives in the province of Negros Oriental, Philippines. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,600. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 11,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica C. is from the village of Dicoloc,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Veronica owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from providing internet and photo copy services in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be Veronica's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials like paper, ink to provide photocopy services

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang was born in 1955. She is married to Mr. Nou. They have five children: one is employed in a restaurant, one is employed for a private company, another is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are studying in a local public school. 

Mrs. Heang and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice for their own family. She is also a chicken breeder and a silk weaving laborer. At present, she has an obstacle because her house is too old to live in. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. Heang would like a loan to buy timber for fixing her house. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Segundo Leoncio

texts.es:
Segundo tiene  44 años de edad,  él es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Segundo  cuenta con casa propia ubicado en el pueblo joven  Jesús Nazareno Cautivo  en el distrito de Monsefú, a 30 minutos de la cuidad de Chiclayo, él vive con su esposa,  en la parte rural de este distrito.

Segundo trabaja el alquiler de video juegos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona en la  vive. Además Segundo se dedica a la crianza de cerdos los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local y con vecinos de su localidad.

Segundo esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de S/. 700,00 nuevos soles, que los empleará para la compra de un equipo de video juegos para ponerlo en alquiler, de esta manera podrá aumentar su capacidad instalada y obtener mayores ingresos de alquiler.

Segundo es un cliente nuevo para la institución sin embargo ya se encuentra bancarizado y cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de la personas que lo conocen. El anhelo de segundo es de poder brindarles un mejor estilo de vida a su  familia día a día.
texts.en:
Segundo is 44 years old, married and has 3 children.  Segundo has his own home located in the young town of Jesús Nazareno Cautivo, Monsefú District.  He is about 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  He lives with his wife in the rural part of the district.

Segundo works in renting video games, an activity he has carried out for the last 5 years.  He has an established clinetele in the area where he lives.  In addition, Segundo earns a living raising pigs.  Once they reach an ideal size and weight, he sells them in the local market and to neighbors in his locality.

Segundo is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700,00 PEN ($250 USD) which he will use to purchase video game equipment to rent. In this way he will be able to increase his installed capacity and obtain higher income.


Segundo is a new client at the institution; nevertheless, he has already banked and has very good references from the people who know him.  Segundo's wish is to be able to offer his family a better life style, day by day.

loans.use: to purchase televison sets for his video games and feed for his animals.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un camión que lleva agua a diferentes lugares como construcciones, elaboración de adobes y lozas, el trabaja en forma independiente, el socio por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de llevar agua a distintos lugares.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para su camión.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Esmeralda community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

The borrower is 27 years old, lives with his partner, and has three children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his transport business.  He has a truck with which he transports water to different places such as construction sites and places where they make adobe and concrete.  He is self employed and, through his work, he gets his children ahead in life.  The borrower would like to expand and improve his water supply service.  He is requesting this loan to buy tires for his truck.

The borrower is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires for his truck

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has six dependents. She prepares banku (fermented maize dumplings) for sale at Abura, which she has done for nine years. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of utility bills. Esi will use the loan to purchase bags of maize, firewood and other things to help make more banku for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, firewood and other things to help make more banku for sale.

loans.name: Sinar Rejeki Group

texts.en:
Sinar Rejeki group, composed of 10 members, got a third loan from MUK. The total loan amounts to Rp. 10.000.000, so each member gets Rp. 1.000.000. (Two people could not attend the meeting where the photo was taken because of illness.)

Dewa  Ayu Ketut, 45, (raising her hand, right corner) has three children. Her first child is already in school, while the others are still toddlers. Her husband works as a motorcycle salesman. In addition to having business stalls, she also pursues efforts to raise pigs to increase the family income. This loan will be used to buy four piglets for fattening.

Dewa Ayu Ketut  has a dream: to develop this business so that she could have a lot of pigs. From the profits of this business, she plans to finance her children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy four piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena, tiene la edad de 25 años, está en unión libre y vive con su hijo y su esposo. Ella con el dinero realizara la compra de una vaca para la producción de leche. Ella cuenta con el terreno apto para el mantenimiento del animal y quiere poder producir leche para su hogar y aumentar la cantidad de animales a su poder. Ella lo que pretende es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y así poder tener un egreso menos con la leche que produce, y tener más ingresos con la venta de la leche sobrante. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María Elena, 25, is in a common law relationship and lives with her son and husband.  She will use the loan to buy a cow for milk production.  She has a piece of land that’s apt for keeping an animal and she wants to produce milk for her home and to increase the number of animals in her possession.  What she intends to do is improve the quality of life of her family and reduce her expenses with the milk she produces and increase income by selling the milk that’s left over.

This is the first loan she’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 36 years old and married with two children. Her children are 10 and 14 years old. She is the owner of a bread store where she sells all different types of breads. Some of her specialties are French bread, pastries with dulce de leche, and sweet bread. Virginia works every day of the week making and selling bread. With a 1,200 USD loan, Virginia plans to purchase more flour, sugar, and butter to make bread for her store. She hopes eventually that she will be able to make a greater quantity of bread so that she can buy her own ovens, as she currently rents them. Virginia is very hardworking and committed to making all of the loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, and butter to make bread

loans.name: Slyvie

texts.en:
Sylivie is a 32-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who, for the past ten years, has run a business selling vegetables and fruit such as onions and berries. Her husband works in house construction and the couple has three children between the ages of three and nine years old. The profits from Sylivie’s business have enabled her to pay the school fees for her children.

Sylivie is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables that she will sell for a profit. She plans to use the future profits from her business to begin construction on her family’s house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace  lives in the Philippines.  She is 23 years old married with 1 child.   Her husband provides motorela or motorcycle services.
Grace has a retail shop that sells snacks like rice & pancakes.   She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.
Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 49 years old and married with two grown-up children. Remedios operates a vegetable and fruit stall next to her house. From there, she can take care of her child and generate income as the same time. She plans to use this loan to invest in her stand by buying vegetables and fruits. She also wants to rebuild the stand to make it nicer and bigger.

Remedios is a asking a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy different vegetables that she can sell in her community. With part of the loan she plans to buy some wood; now that she has more demand, she will need to invest more in her business. She will use the profits to expand the business and get her own house that she can live in comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, eggplant, and squash for her store.

loans.name: Yeigni

texts.es: yegni de 31 años, es la propietaria de una miscelánea ubicada en su vivienda en el barrio Santa María donde vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 2 a 12 años. Ella nació en Ocaña, en el departamento de Santander y llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla desde sus 15 años,   donde  terminó sus estudios de bachiller, se graduó como técnica de mercadeo  y también contrajo matrimonio. Trabajando en empresas privadas durante un largo tiempo, en el cual  construyó su experiencia de formalidad  en  negocios y en la vida,  y cuando tuvo su primer hijo de 12 años y posteriormente los otros dos, decidió crear su propio negocio,  con el fin de continuar generando sus ingreso al hogar, pero sin estar lejos del cuidado de su familia y de las funciones y responsabilidades que genera la estructura del hogar. Yegni en su miscelánea, vende artículos para el hogar, cosméticos, papelería y todo lo que requiere cada momento comercial. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,, con el cual comprara detalles para el hogar, accesorios femeninos y también adornos navideños , pues desde ya se prepara para recibir las navidades y el año nuevo. Su inversión será exitosa, porque conoce mu bien su negocio y el mercado en el que interactúa y especialmente lo que debe invertir en cada época. Su sueño es proporcionarle a sus hijos una educación que les posibilite su éxito, también aspira a generar mayores ingresos,  a través del crecimiento de su negocio y para ello desea ampliarlo y lograr una presentación elegante,  en un ambiente confortable. Yegni maneja una rotación de cunetas por cobrar de 2 días, una rotación de inventarios de 35 días y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 30,20%, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Yegni, age 31, is the owner of a store, which is located in her house in the Santa María neighborhood.  She lives with her husband and their three children, ranging in age from 2 to 12.  She was born in Ocaña in the Santander department.  Fifteen years ago she came to the city of Barranquilla where she completed high school, and she also got married.

She worked for private companies for a long time.  During that time she built up her formal business experience and her life experience.  When her first child was born 12 years ago, and later when the other two were born, she decided to create her own business.  She did this in order to continue generating household income.  Also, she did it so that she would not be away from her family and the work and responsibilities that go with the household.

In her business Yegni sells household items, cosmetics, stationery, and everything needed for business.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy household items, women’s accessories, and Christmas decorations.  She is now preparing for Christmas and the New Year.

Her investment will be successful because she knows her business and the market she interacts with very well.  She especially knows what she needs to invest in each season.

Her dream is to give her children an education that makes their success possible.  She also aspires to generate greater income through the growth of her business.  To do so she wishes to expand her business and achieve an elegant appearance and a comfortable atmosphere.

Yegni manages an accounts payable turnover of two days, an inventory turnover of 35 days, and a profitability of sales that is no less than 30.20%.  These financial indicators predict her potential growth and the success of her investment.

loans.use: to buy household items, women’s accessories, and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo, a 42-year-old married father of two grown children, lives in the province of Isabela with his family. Arnulfo, who has been involved in agriculture and hog-raising  for seven years, is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs he plans to sell in the future. Arnulfo learned this business from his father, who is also involved in livestock-raising.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Mariyahan's Group

texts.en:
Mariyahan is the leader of this group. She is 46 and married to a farmer. Together they raised four sons and a daughter.  Their older son works in Russia, and the other children study at school. 

Eight years ago with an initial investment of 6000 Soms, Mariyahan started to bake bread for sale.  At the moment her business runs well.  She earns about 23000 soms per month. Her profit made it possible for her to purchase a piece of land, where she built a house. 

With money received from this loan, she wants to purchase flour and coal.  In the future she wishes to see her children get wed.



--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal.

loans.name: Jackelyn

texts.en:
Jackelyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jackelyn has a junk shop that buys and sells recycled materials like bottles, plastic wares, and metals. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy recycled materials like bottles, plastics, and metals to sell in her shop.

Jackelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like bottles, plastics, and metals to sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 55 años, es una mujer alegre y soñadora, le gusta mucho trabajar y estar activa. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 24 y 22 años, ella ya es abuela y tiene tres nietos de 8, 3 años y de su ultima hija su nieta tiene 4 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo de Sara consiste en la venta de muchos productos, entre ellos es la venta de pan y frutas, actividad que lo hace por las mañanas, mientras que por las tardes empieza a preparar sus deliciosos y exquisitos platos de comida que se encarga de vender por las noches en la vereda de su casa. Agradece mucho a su pareja, ya que fue quien le ayuda en el negocio, desde que empieza el dia hasta que anochese. Por ahora le esta yendo bien, pero desea mas adelante montar un nuevo negocio que es la venta de ropa, de esa manera aumentará sus ganancias. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, y está muy agradecida pro su anterior ayuda y ahora espera de su colaboración para cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado comprará ropa de la ciudad de Lima, pues considera como un negocio más rentable.
texts.en:
Sara is 55 years old, a happy and pensive woman, who likes to work and is very active. She lives with her partner with whom she has two children of 24 and 22 years of age. She is already a grandmother and has three grandchildren—8 and 3 years old, and from her youngest daughter, she has a 4 year old grandchild.

Sara sells many products, among which is bread and fruit, work that she does in the mornings, while in the afternoons she begins to prepare her delicious and tasty meals that she sells at night in the lane by her house, with thanks to her partner, who always helps in this work, from sunup until sundown.

Right now she is doing well, but she wants to set up a new business selling clothing in order to increase her income. This will be her third loan with MFP, and she is very thankful for the help she has received and now she hopes for your participation with her goal. With the money from the loan she will buy clothes in the city of Lima, and she considers this to be a more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy clothing for later resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LOS COMERCIANTES”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Victoria;  La socia tiene 74 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 3 hijos; de los cuales solo está con ella 1 de 35 años de edad, la socia se dedica a la ganadería como principal actividad y también ella compra y vende forraje como alfa alfa, y cebada; La socia compra 1 topo de alfa alfa y cebada, la socia lo que compra lo vende en tercios, ella reparte a diferentes clientes y también vende leche que sus vacas producen, la socia esta siempre viendo la manera de ingeniarse para tener ingresos por lo que nunca esta sin hacer nada, ella también en otras épocas compra verduras y las reparte a los mercados, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de alfa alfa y cebadas por topos.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the ”LOS COMERCIANTES” communal bank.  The communal bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, in the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

This member is Señora Victoria.  She is 74 years old and is single.  She has three children; the only one who lives with her is 35 years old.  The member works with livestock as her primary economic activity, and she also buys and sells animal fodder such as alfalfa and barley.  She buys alfalfa and barley in bulk, and divides it in thirds to sell to different customers.  She also sells milk produced by her cows.

The member is always looking to devise ways to earn income, and so is never without something to do.  In other seasons, she also purchases vegetables and sells them in the markets.

On this occasion, the member wants to invest her loan in purchasing alfalfa and barley in bulk.

The member is grateful for the loan, and agrees to comply with her repayments according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase alfalfa and barley in bulk.

loans.name: Nrika

texts.en:
Nrika is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the loan for 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, rice and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, rice and beans.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her drug shop in which she sells medicine.

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy medicine for resale, and it will help Hellen to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her children. Hellen hopes that in the future she will be able to become a big businesswoman.

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hellen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy medicine for resale.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata, de 31 años, es una mujer casada con Nilo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Noralei, de 16 y Jair de 10 años. Esta familia vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el Barrio Santa Rosa de la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Desde aproximadamente 10 años, Fortunata se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos son café y cítricos.  De esa manera, esta mujer y su familia vieron construir su vivienda propia, adquirir muebles y artefactos eléctricos para equipar su casa. Todos estos logros gracias a sus cultivos de café y a su buena comercialización. Ahora también cuenta con un negocio de gaseosas, cervezas, productos de primera necesidad y es en su casa donde se ubica el único teléfono de la zona, “estoy contenta con mis logros por que todo lo obtuve con sudor y esfuerzo”, explica. 
Además Fortunata no se queda ahí, las frutas que produce en sus parcelas de terrenos agrícolas las vende en la ciudad de Lima, y para surtir sus productos compra más frutas de sus vecinos y del mismo mercado mayorista.
Con esas ansias de progreso, Fortunata y Nilo quieren ver a sus hijos como profesionales y buenos estudios, para ello seguirán trabajando e invirtiendo en sus negocios. Éste sería su préstamo número 10 que obtendrían de MFP, por eso se responsabilizan de pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. Le agrada el trabajo con su banco comunal, por encontrarse en un ambiente familiar y amical. De recibir el dinero, invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, así como más gaseosas y cervezas, los que venderá en su tienda instalada en su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Fortunata is 31 years old and married to Nilo.  Together they have two children, 16-year-old Noralei and 10-year-old Jair.  This family lives in their own home, located in the Santa Rosa neighborhood in the town of Puente Paucartambo in the central Peruvian jungle.  For about 10 years, Fortunata has worked in agriculture for a living, with her primary crops being coffee and citrus fruits.
