It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene C. is from the town of Veruela. She is 39 years old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business venture raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Arlene has been engaged in farming for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities. She also grows pigs for fattening and sale. 

Arlene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer and feed for the pigs. This will be her second loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and feed for pigs

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica A. is from the village of Purok de Oro, Iligan City. She is 51 years old, widowed and has 4 adult children. Jessica owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok de Oro, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Assia

texts.en:
Assia is 37 years old and is married with five children who are between 6 and 16 years old.

Assia owns a public secretariat business and she has been in this business for about three years. Her services are open from 7 a.m. until late in the evening.

Assia needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more computers. With these additional computers, the number of her clients will increase as well as her profits. These profits will allow her to keep reinvesting in order to increase her business either in size or in equipment.

loans.use: To purchase more computers for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. is married. Her husband is employed as a company driver and they have four children aged four to thirteen years old. She has a general store in a residential area in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last year and she hopes to grow her retail shop to a big wholesale shop. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is lack of finances. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to restock her store. She describes herself as ambitious.

loans.use: Flour, sugar, detergent and other general items for her store.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma V. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 60 years old. Elma is married and has seven children. To make a living, Elma owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Elma still works at the farm to help provide for her family. She also wants to help send her grandchildren to school. 

Elma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Najem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old. He is married and has five children. He graduated from the Faculty of Nursing and in 1995 he opened a place providing nursing services. He has an excellent reputation and he is well known in his community.

After benefiting from prior loans, now he is applying for a US$ 2600 loan to renovate the place and buy a small generator. He is aiming to grow bigger so he will be able to increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Renovating the place and buying a small generator

loans.name: Buyan-Orshih

texts.en: Buyan-Orshih is 54 and lives with her husband in their own house in Selenge province, Mongolia. She has two grown children who live on their own. Her daughter works in Ulaanbaatar as a company legal advisor and her son is an assistant engine driver in the train station. Buyan-Orshih operates a retail clothing business. She started it in 1996 and has since gained much experience. She has found success in her trade and has used her earnings to support her family. Her earnings have enabled her to not only pay her children's tuition fees but also purchase an apartment in Ulaanbaatar for her daughter. In order to increase turnover, she sells her products at under-market prices. In the future she hopes to continue her success and grow her business and support their children. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to add to her savings of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: María Lucrecia

texts.es:
La Señora. María Rodríguez es socia del banco comunal El Progreso de Azogues, vive por la parroquia de Guapan en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de sus calles, sus iglesias son el símbolo de la religión en la ciudad, su gente es amable y cordial, cuentan también con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija  estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimas hijas en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es chofer profesional y labora en una camioneta que es de su propiedad realizando fletes, con el trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a la cría de animales como: pollos y cerdos. También se dedica a la agricultura actividad que desempeña hace 10 años, sus animales y hortalizas las vende en su propia comunidad.

Es socia en la banca comunal hace 2 años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas con quienes comparte muy buenos momentos en cada reunión, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de pollos y  en su alimento. Su meta es  entregarles a sus hijos la mejor educación para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria Rodríguez is a member of the communal bank El Progreso de Azogues; she lives in the Guapan parish belonging to the city of Azogues which is known for the architectural beauty of its streets, for its churches that are symbols of religion practiced here, and for its kind and friendly people.

Maria is 33 years old; she is married and has three children who are aged twelve, ten, and six. Her eldest daughter is in middle school while her younger two daughters in are in primary school. Maria's husband is a professional driver who does deliveries using his own pick up truck. Working together they have been able to build their own house.

Maria works in farming -- she raises animals, such as chickens and pigs, and also does agricultural work; she sells her animals and vegetables in her own community.

Maria has been a member of the bank for two years, and she likes it because she has really good friends with whom she shares good moments at each meeting. She plans to use the new loan for the purchase of chickens and chicken feed. Maria's dream is to give a better education to her children so that they would become good professionals.

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de salón de belleza y también se dedica a estudiar el idioma ingles, la socia atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de salón de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para el salón de belleza como tintes, líquidos permanentes, tijeras y ruleros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vilma, 32, is a member of the “COMUZONE I” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is in a common law relationship and has a son.  She alternates her daily chores with a beauty salon and also is studying English.  She is open for business from 9am to 5pm.  She wants to expand and improve the beauty salon and is asking for a loan to buy products for the salon like: dyes, permanent wave liquids, scissors and rollers.

She is happy because of the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the beauty salon like: dyes, permanent wave liquids, scissors and rollers.

loans.name: Mirembe Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: 34-year-old Hawa N. has 6 children and is happily married.  She has been running her used-clothing sales business in Bugembe trading center in Jinja for 5 years. Before she embarked on this business, she was employed at a local women's non-governmental community organization. Ever since she began the business, she has been inclined toward diligence. This diligence has delivered results as manifested by the organized way she goes about her business.  This business generates her 200,000 shillings per month.  With this loan, she wants to buy more used clothing to resell. Hawa belongs to Mirembe Development group-Jinja.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to resell

loans.name: Josefa Azucena

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Jorge de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Jorge.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Josefa, ella tiene  47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa, ella además se hace cargo del hijo de la mayor de sus hijos ya que ella está haciendo el internado de medicina en Portoviejo. Su esposo es policía retirado.

Tiene un pequeño bazar en su casa donde vende ropa, zapatos, todo tipo de maquillajes, bisutería y artículos de regalos, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 21h00, nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio  varios años y que le encanta tener su negocio ya  que además de ganarse la vida en él se entretiene y se divierte atendiendo a sus clientes. Sus productos los va a comprar una vez por mes a Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas, y otros productos para surtir su bazar. Esta desde el inicio en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un bazar mucho más grande.
texts.en:
In the suburb of San Jorge in the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of green mountains and enchanting landscapes, the members of the San Jorge communal bank hold their meetings every 15 days. 

One of those members is Josefa, 47, who is married and has three grown children, two of whom still live at home. She also cares for the son of her oldest daughter, who is doing her medical internship in Portoviejo. Josefa’s husband is a retired policeman.

Josefa has a small variety store in her house where she sells clothing, shoes, makeup, costume jewelry, and gift items. She works here every day from 8:30 AM to 11:00 PM. Josefa says that she has had her business for several years and loves earning her living this way. She enjoys attending to her customers. Once a month, she goes to Guayaquil to purchase products for her inventory.

With this loan, Josefa will buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, and other products to stock the store. She has been with her communal bank since the beginning, and she likes the ease of making payments. Her dream is to have a much larger store.

loans.use: Buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, and gift items for store.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory S. is from the city of Embargo Ozamiz City. He is 40 years old. Nory is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nory owns & operates a business operating motor transport services. Nory has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Nory joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nory is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nory from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo, de 28 años es un hombre responsable y trabajador. En armonía familiar convive con Eraida y su hijo Johan, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de San Juan de la libertad. El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 6 años es la siembra de diferentes productos oriundos del lugar como: papa y arveja. Los que gracias al apoyo de su madre, quien le apoya en los cuidados que brinda, los puede comercializar en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el tiempo que le dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos. Ahora él tiene sembrado papa de las variedades “única y perricholi”, que sembrará dentro de estos meses. Él pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde espera logar sus objetivos con el apoyo de su asociación. Hugo, comenzará a sembrar arveja, por ello con el crédito esta pensando comprar 6 bolsas de semillas y varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Hugo is 28 years old and is a hard-working responsible man.  He has a harmonious family life together with Eraida and his son Johan in the house he owns in the San Juan de la Libertad rural area.  For six years he has been growing different native crops such as potatoes and peas.  With his mother's help he cares for his crop which he later sells at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

What he likes most about his work is the time spent caring for the crops.  Now he plans to grow the potato varieties "unica" and "perricholi", and will sew the seeds soon.  He belongs to the "capital semillera" (seed capital) communal bank and this is his first loan through MFP.  With the support of this association he hopes to be able to meet his goals.

Hugo will begin sewing peas soon and plans to use the loan to buy six bags of seed and several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy six bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita G.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, instant noodles, junk food and toothpaste in her community. She is 62 years old, widowed and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental. Conchita has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk foods. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk food

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support three children. Marilou is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for the store.

Marilou has been in this business for two years. Marilou earns more income from food vending (barbeque).

In the future, Marilou would like to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more basic goods for her general store

loans.name: Evelyn Patricia

texts.es: Evelyn Patricia R. D. V.  D. treinta y seis años D. edad vive con su esposo en el Barrio las Delicias en el departamento D. la Unión. Ella posee un negocio en su residencia donD. venD. artículos D. decoración, enseres, vajillas, cristales. Evelyn es una mujer con mucho talento la gente la visita porque sus adornos son D. mucha calidad y muy ingeniosos; últimamente sus clientes le solicitan más D. sus creaciones y esto la motivo a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más material para sus adornos, recuerdos D. celebraciones, cristales entre otros. Evelyn es un vivo ejemplo D. perseverancia y tiene fe que en cuanto crezca su negocio podrá llevar mas estabilidad a su hogar y una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia.
texts.en: Evelyn Patricia R. D. V. is 36 years old and lives with her husband in Las Delicias neighborhood, in La Unión department.  She has a business in her home where she sells decorative items, home furnishings, crockery and glassware.  Evelyn is a very talented lady.  People visit her business because her ornaments are very good quality and original.  Lately her customers have been requesting more of her creations and this motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL which would allow her to buy more material for making her ornaments, celebration gifts, glassware, etc.  Evelyn is a living example of perseverance and she has faith that when her business grows she will be able to proviD. her household with more stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials for making ornaments, gifts for social occasions and glassware

loans.name: Mrs. Sarin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are ten people who maK. up this village bank loan.  They will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family’s standard of living.  

Mrs. Sarin is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.  She was born in 1954.  She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice and potatoes to support her own family and to sell.  She is also a chicken breeder while her husband, Mr. Vel, is a construction worker.  Although they try to work hard, they can earn little income.  So to improve this condition, Mrs. Sarin is applying for a loan to buy three piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business.  She has three children.  They are all studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea B. is a Zumba instructor and the owner of Intone Dance Studio in Corpus Christi, Texas.  When Andrea first started taking Zumba classes, she realized “this is how I wanted to keep exercising.”  Andrea, who is Colombian-American, likes how Zumba combines exercise with Latin dance rhythms.  A year and a half ago, Andrea became a certified Zumba instructor, prompting her to leave her career as a flight attendant and begin teaching classes herself.

She opened Intone Dance Studio on April 1, 2011.  In addition to Andrea, the studio has three instructors who all individually teach classes, allowing Andrea to offer classes throughout the morning and afternoon.  Many of her current students are people who followed her from the studio where she previously worked.  The students help Andrea grow the studio by recruiting friends and bringing them to class.  Though anyone can join, the majority of Andrea’s students are young and middle-aged women.  

Andrea is using this loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana to help cover initial operating costs and meet any unforeseen expenses.  She hopes to save enough of the money from this loan to upgrade the studio’s sound system once the business gets through the first few startup months.  For supplemental income, Andrea rents out the studio for special events such as baby showers.

Andrea loves seeing the physical and mental transformation her students undergo as they take her classes.  She hopes to eventually expand her studio and carry workout apparel.  Andrea likes owning her own business, despite finding it stressful.  “Being your own boss is good because you can organize your time the way you want it.  But at the same time, it brings a lot of responsibility…it is a challenge.”  Andrea is married with a 16-year-old son.

loans.use: to meet operating expenses and upgrade a sound system

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: La señora Rosa tiene la edad de 56 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijos todos ya casados e independientes, los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Rosa desde hace ocho años se dedica al comercio ,la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el espacio del lugar donde ella tiene su negocio ya que es muy pequeño y no le permite dar una atencion adecuada .Con este  financiamiento quiere comprar, abarrotes, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros producto para su negocio. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva .
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old and lives in the town of Ticuantepe, together with her husband who buys and sells.  She has three children who are already grown up and live independently.  Her plans for the future are to improve her living conditions.  Rosa has been buying and selling for eight years.  Her biggest difficulty is that the space in which she runs her business is very small.

With this loan, Rosa would like to buy groceries, soda, candies and other products for her business.  She is grateful for the support that Afodenic give her through their Kiva fund.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soda and candies.

loans.name: Benjamín Antonio

texts.es:
Benjamín Antonio es de ciudad Managua  Municipio de Managua trabaja como mecánico, es una persona  responsable, honesta con buenos principios para su familia. 
Benjamín se presento a nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito ya que necesita construir un cuarto de habitación.
El señor dice que se siente bien agradecido con ceprodel por que gracias a los financiamiento  se a comprado electrodomésticos y a mejoras parte de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Benjamin Antonio is from the city of Managua (the municipality of Managua). He works as a mechanic and he is a responsible and honest person with good family principles.

Benjamin came to our office to request a loan to build a bedroom. 

He says that he is very thankful to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) because thanks to his loan he has been able to purchase household appliances and to make home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Moldaly's Group

texts.en:
Moldaly is a member of this group. He is 45 and married. In order to cover his daily needs, he began to sell fruits and vegetables at the market three years ago, with an initial investment of 22,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS). At the moment, his monthly profit is 8,000 soms. With money gained from his trade, Moldaly was able to purchase a cow for breeding. He applied for the loan because he needs additional funds for purchasing watermelons in order to increase the commodity turnover of his business. In the future, Moldaly plans to save money to purchase a vehicle and decrease some transportation expenses related to his business. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons

loans.name: El Futuro Del Peru Group

texts.es: La Señora Asteria es socia de la Alcancía comunal “El Futuro de Perú”, tiene  46 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos menores. La socia se dedica a la Artesanía manual en Bordado de Fustanes (Tejidos Artesanales). Se levanta a tempranas horas de la mañana para que pueda bordar  fustanes para ello tiene que tener mucha dedicación, concentración, creatividad y arte. Ella las confecciona para los meses de Fiestas Patronales como Santiago (fiesta costumbrista  en la zona). Los Fustanes las venden en los meses de junio, julio y agosto ya que hay mucha demanda. La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar los materias primas como lanas, hilos y telas. Sus objetivos en el futuro es comprar maquinas industriales.La socia esta ubicada al centro del grupo con chompa color blanco y lila, detras de joven milber.
texts.en:
Señora Asteria is a member of the community bank '“El Futuro de Perú” ("The Future of Peru").  She is 46 years old and married with 3 young children. The member works in handicrafts, doing Fustanes Embroidery (traditional hand-woven fabrics).  She rises in the early hours of the morning so you can embroider the fabrics, as it takes a lot of dedication, concentration, creativity and art.  She makes apparel for the months of the Patron Festivals, such as Santiago (a festival held in the area).  The embroidered fabrics are sold in the months of June, July and August as demand is high.  

The member is requesting the loan to buy raw materials like wool, yarns and fabric.  Her future objective is to buy an industrial sewing machine.  The partner is located in the center of the group wearing a white sweater and lilac, behind the young man Milber.

loans.use: to make apparel and embroider fabric.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang, 50 year old, is married. Her husband is a chief of construction workers. Their income is $8 per day. They have four children. Three are studying and one is working as a teacher in state school with $3 per day for his income. 

Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $50 on school fees, $30 on transportation and $35 on other expenses.

Neang feeds and sells animals. Her career can make good profits, so she wants to buy more pigs to feed whenever she can save enough money to buy them. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pigs and chickens to feed and sell. 

For her children, she wants to send them to study at the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy pigs and chickens to feed and sell.

loans.name: Alida

texts.ru:
Alida 30 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Alida yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayev v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. 
Alida seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuric i qusey dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Ona 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit gusey i kuric. Ona ochen userdno rabotayet i lubit svoyu rabotu.
texts.en:
Alida is 30 years old. She is maried and has two children. Alida is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her loving family.   
Alida now needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens and geese to expand her business. She has been working as a poultry farmer for three years and breeds geese and chickens.  She works very diligently and loves her job.

loans.use: to buy chickens and geese

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident and farmer in Litein in South Rift, Kenya. His farm produces tea and milk which he sells on the local market. He has been in farming for the last four years and currently employs one farmhand. He is married with three children aged between 5 and 1 year old.

Peter has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy cow will help him in paying for the education of his children as well as allowing him to invest the rest of the income in a new farming venture to spread his farming risks.

Peter notes animal diseases and feed are the greatest challenges in farming due to their high cost.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 55 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is farmer and her partner in managing her business. To make a living, Eufemia sells canned goods, cooking oil, snack foods, and spices in her sari-sari (general) store in their village. She has been in this business for almost five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month. Her income depends on the availability of the products she sells.

Eufemia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of sugar, coffee, milk, cooking oil, and  spices to satisfy the needs of her costumers. She desires to develop her business and grow as entrepreneur, mother, and borrower.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of sugar, coffee, milk, cooking oil, and  spices .

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza, who lives with his mother, father, three brothers, and two sisters. Hassan has decided that he would like to use a portable stand (basta) in which he could sell shoes for both men and women.

He hopes that through this loan he will be able to buy shoes in order in bring in customers, which will hopefully increase his income too.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a business woman who is 25 years old. She is married and blessed with one child. For the last four years, she has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more business oriented and has grown her business.  In the next 5 years, she wants to manage a supermarket. She is requesting for a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice and sugar.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Âgée de 37 ans Madame Salimata est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui réside avec son époux et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle dans la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Salimata, après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité de stockage et commercialisation des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho, etc.) depuis plus de sept ans. Elle dispose son propre magasin à Kaboïla I. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ six ans. Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Kotognogontala de Banconi),  elle est actuellement à son 8 ème prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce 8ème prêt,  25 sacs de maïs, 15 sacs de sorgho et 15 sacs de mil. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les revendre soit en gros ou en détail, à une clientèle composée généralement de chefs de famille.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 275 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salimata is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in a large traditional family in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

Having attempted several activities without success, Salimata became involved in the storage and sale of grain (maize, millet, sorghum, etc.) over seven years ago. She has her own shop in Kaboïla I.

Eager to better serve her growing customer base, she joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about six years ago. After five group loans in collaboration with a local women’s group (the Kotognogontala Association of Banconi), she is now seeking her eighth individual loan. All previous loans were repaid without problems. 

With this new loan, she plans to purchase 25 sacks of maize, 15 sacks of millet and 15 sacks of sorghum. She buys her stock in various communities surrounding Sikasso, and then sells the merchandise wholesale or at retail to a clientele consisting mostly of household heads.

She hopes that this loan will help her earn a monthly profit of 275,000 FCFA, which she will use primarily to increase her working capital, help with the household expenses, and pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to stock up on grain for resale

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 42-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and one sibling. She suffers from a paralysis in her legs. Even so, she has been selling women's accessories and dressmaking supplies since 2007. She also works as a tailor, sewing clothes and repairing the damaged ones. Today, she is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added merchandise for her shop in order to strengthen her business and gain more income. This will be her fourth Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del distrito, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene  29  años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos.  La señora estudio educación primaria.

Su primer préstamo fue por S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, la señora también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados vacunos.  Desde hace cuatro años  trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará una vaca para su engorde por cuatro meses.  Su esposo trabaja en una tostadora de maná (cereal), pero también la apoya en ciertas actividades.

La señora desea continuar con su negocio, le gusta las reuniones, el ahorro y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank "Santa Barbara" of the Province of Yunguyo, the department of Puno.  She is 29 years old, has two daughters, and studied elementary education.

Her first loan was for 300.000 Soles; money that she invested in her business of fruits and vegetables.  Andrea also works in the buying and selling of cows.  She has been working with the Movimiento Mauela Ramos for over four years.  

With this new loan of 1,500.00 Soles, she plans to purchase a cow that she can raise for the next four months.  Her husband works in a cereal toasting factory but he also helps her in certain aspects of her business.  Andrea hopes to continue with her business and her communal bank.  She enjoys the meetings, the savings, and the loans.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria, sigue invirtiendo en su negocio, anteriormente, solo se dedicaba al destace de cerdo, lo que ha diversificado al  hacer comida como: baho, sopa y venta de fritanga, con el objetivo de poder obtener mejores ventas.
Y seguir con el apoyo  a la familia, con el credito anterior, logro aumentar la venta de carne de cerdo al invertir su capital en la copra de tres cerdo.
 Hoy con este nuevo prestamo es para cerrar bien su casa, en la parte del caballete de la pared, el cual cerrara con zinc liso, que es para ese tipo de trabajo, lo que no entrara mas polvo, como le ha venido afectando,  asi como hacer loceta de sumidero que esta en mal estado, y es peligro. Comprara materiales para comezar la obra.
texts.en:
Maria is continuing to invest in her business. Beforehand she only concentrated on her pig business, but now she has diversified into making food such as baho (local dish of beef, fried plantains etc.)  soup, and fritanga (grilled meat and fried intestines) so she can earn more money and continue supporting her family.

With her last loan she managed to increase sales of pork and bought three more pigs.

Now Maria is seeking a new loan to seal the top part of the walls of her house with flat zinc which is used for this kind of work. Then dust wouldn’t be able to get into the house and bother her. Also the drains are in poor condition and dangerous. She would like to buy material to begin this work also.

loans.use: to seal the gap between the walls and roof of her house and to buy material to improve the drains

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, Mercy has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. Mercy's major dream is to establish a large market to meet her customers' needs. 

Mercy plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to pay for hospital bills. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To pay for hospital bills.

loans.name: Oluwatchehoun Group

texts.fr: OLUWATCHEHOUN est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Winsi Rosaline. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin et fréquentent la même Eglise. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Winsi Rosaline est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à Victorin, un ferrailleur. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur  charge. En plus des deux enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge.Winsi Rosaline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Winsi Rosaline a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Winsi Rosaline vend depuis une trentaine d'année, des vêtements et divers autres articles de façon secondaire. Winsi Rosaline s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce cinquième prêt permettra certainement à Winsi Rosaline et à aux autres membres du groupe OLUWATCHEHOUN, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
OLUWATCHEHOUN is a group comprised of three persons whose representative (with her hand raised in the photo) is named Winsi Rosaline. The group members live in the same district in Benin and attend the same church. With the goal of increasing their working capital, they are requesting a loan from ALIDé for the fifth time. 

Winsi Rosaline is 51 years old and married to Victorin, a scrap metal merchant. They have two children, both in school and in their care. In addition to these two children, the couple has another child to support. Winsi Rosaline lives together with her children and husband, and the couple jointly cover the diverse family expenses. 

Winsi Rosaline dropped out of primary school. To meet her needs and those of her children, she has been selling clothing and a variety of other goods for about thirty years. Her supplies come from a city in Benin. 

This fifth loan will surely enable Winsi Rosaline and the other members of the group OLUWATCHEHOUN to boost their business and to increase their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy clothing (for infants, etc.)

loans.name: Linda

texts.es:
Linda de 41 años es una mujer soltera de 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 11 años. Ella y sus hijos viven en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de La Merced. Linda es una mujer trabajadora. Se levanta muy temprano para preparar distintos alimentos y comidas, los que ofrece en su restaurante.
“Lo que mas se vende son desayunos y almuerzos”, afirma. Su local se ubica en las cercanías de entidades estatales, de cuyos trabajadores y servidores, salen a comer. Por clientela no se preocupa, ya que gracias a su sazón y variedad de platos ha logrado captar público fiel.
Desde hace 2 años, Linda cuenta con ese rentable negocio. Gracias a su desempeño ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Los 2 mayores están estudiando en la universidad y sin embargo la apoyan en el restaurante.
Como toda una mujer visionaria, para unos años después, planifica ampliar su local y aumentar más mesas. Así como preparar  platos a la carta, para horarios nocturnos. Para ello, Linda necesitará de mucha ayuda. Esta sería la primera vez que Linda accedería a un préstamo de MFP, por esa razón da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Se siente muy a gusto con su recientemente formado banco comunal del que espera alcanzar progreso. De recibir el dinero, logrará invertir en la compra de vidrios para las mesas, manteles nuevos, arreglará su lavadora con los servicios de un gasfitero, pintará sus paredes y si sobra el dinero comprará bebidas. Así mejorará la apariencia de su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Linda, 41, is a single woman with 3 children: 20, 18 and 11.  She and her children live in a rented house in La Merced.  Linda is a hard-working woman who gets up very early to prepare different food and meals that she sells in her restaurant.
She tells us that she sells “breakfasts and lunches the most”.  She has her stall near government buildings where the workers and employees go out to eat.  She is very concientious with her customers and thanks to the flavor and variety of the dishes, she has been able to attract a loyal public.
Linda has had this profitable business for the past 2 years.  Thanks to her effort she has been able to get her children ahead.  The 2 oldest are studying at the university but they still help her in the restaurant.
As a woman thinking ahead, she would like to enlarge her space a few years from now, and add more tables.  Not only making the food on the menu, but also because of  the late hours, Linda needs a lot of help.  This will be the first time that Linda has applied for a loan with MFP, and that is why she promises to make all the monthly payments on time.  She feels very good with the newly formed communal bank that she hopes will show progress.  She will use the money to buy glass for the tables, new tablecloths, have a plumber fix her dishwasher, paint the walls, and if there is any money left, she will buy drinks.  This work will improve the appearance of the business.

loans.use: to buy glass to protect the tables, paint, and drinks

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en: Tsovinar lives with her son. She is a teacher at the local school. To cover the family's daily costs, Tsovinar has been engaged in farming for more than eleven years. Now Tsovinar needs financial means to develop her farm. Tsovinar plans to purchase flower seeds and grow flowers in her greenhouse. Tsovinar hopes she will grow flowers successfully and get more income from the sales. This will allow her to make savings for further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to pay for flower seeds

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Odile est mariée à un certain Cyriaque. Le couple a trois enfants  dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Odile vit seule avec ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Odile vend depuis quinze ans de divers produits (blé, pâtes alimentaires, conserves, riz, etc.), des tissus et des chaussures par le système de distribution et à son domicile. Odile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Odile contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Odile sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Odile is forty-two years old and lives in Benin. Odile is married to Cyriaque. The couple has three children, some of whom are in school, and all are in their care. Odile lives alone with her children. The couple ensures together the various expenses of the house. To contribute to the various needs of the family, Odile has sold various products (wheat, pasta, conserves, rice, etc.), fabrics and shoes through a distribution system and at her home for fifteen years. Odile stocks up in a market in Benin. Thanks to the revenue that this business generates for her, Odile contributes to the different expenditures of her family. To satisfy the needs of her growing clientele, Odile is asking for a fourth loan from Alidé. Her three previous loans have been paid off.

loans.use: to buy various products (bags of wheat, pasta) and fabrics.

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Ennice from Machipisa, Harare. She is married with two children; one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Ennice runs a retail business selling clothes bought from South Africa and Botswana. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges she faces are the shortage of capital and competition. 

Ennice has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy additional stock for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her child to a better school and pay school fees on time. In the future Ennice plans to own a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for resale.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en: Marlina is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Marlina has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy bananas and coconuts to sell. Marlina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Achol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fee.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Hector David

texts.en:
My name is Hector David M., and I sell clothes, shoes and other items accessories for children and adults. I have had my business for three years and has grown and with what I earn, I can help my children in their studies and my desire is to increase my earnings so that they can go to University and to become hard working, professional people who will help our country in the future.

Loan Use: Purchase clothes and shoes for children and adults.

Me llamo Hector David M., me dedico a la venta de ropa, zapatos y otros accesorios para niño y adulto. Tengo tres años de tener mi negocio que ha crecido y con lo que me genera en ganacias he podido ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios y mi deseo es obtener mejores ingresos para que puedan ir a la universidad y llegar a ser buenas personas trabajadores y profesionales que ayuden a nuestro pais a salir adelante.

loans.use: Compra de ropa y calzado para niño y adulto

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly started his business in 1988. He operates an open-air shop. His beginning business capital was USD 108. He began with a stock of 50 pairs of shoes, but stopped the business in 2000 due to the political and economical instability in Kinshasa. 

Felly decided to resume his shoe business in 2004 and was informed by his friend about Hope’s loan program. He agreed to sign a loan contract with Hope. With his first Hope loan he stabilized his business by adding more pairs of shoes and diverse items such as boxes of batteries, small radios, shoe polish, padlocks, and other goods. Today, Felly has a stock of about 70 pairs of shoes. 

Felly has noticed that there is demand in his neighbourhood for women’s shoes also. With a loan of $600, Felly plans to diversify his business by adding women’s shoes and clothing. His long term plan is to move from an open-air shop to a shop indoors.

loans.use: Add women’s shoes and clothing items to stock

loans.name: Faaga

texts.en: Faaga manages two sources of income to support her family of twelve. Her husband and some local village boys work on the taro plantation, and Faaga sells the taro crop at the local market. Taro is in ample supply at her local market, however, and sometimes the over-supply means that Faaga can’t sell the entire crop. So Faaga also began making and selling ice-pops (locally referred to as “ice cakes”), which are a favorite of the local children. This additional income helps keep up with the children’s expenses, but Faaga is anxious to find ways to invest further in her businesses and grow her income. She will use loan funds to buy weed-killers to improve her taro crop as well as to buy ingredients for ice-pops in bulk (to get better prices and increase her profit-margin).

loans.use: Buy weed-killers for her plantation and ingredients for ice-pops

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes is a very good working woman; she is married and has two little children. Her husband is working but his salary is not enough to cover all the family expenses, besides he had big debts and couldn’t cover them by himself. Because of all this, Lulú with other two neighbours got together a group six years ago to start a business selling natural products and shoes, with their enthusiasm and effort they have succeeded and keep the business all this time.

Now they want to increase their business and in order to buy more merchandise Lulú is requesting a loan for $295 which she promises to pay in 6 months. With your help these 3 families can improve their life, help them grow their business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Lourdes es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Su esposo es empleado pero su salario era insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de su familia, además de que tenía unas deudas muy grandes y no podía solventarlas él solo. Ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, Lulú junto con dos vecinas de ella juntaron un grupo hace seis años para emprender un negocio con la venta de productos naturales y zapatos, el entusiasmo y esfuerzo que las tres han depositado en el negocio les ha permitido salir adelante y mantenerse por tanto tiempo.

Ahora desean poder hacer crecer su negocio y para poder adquirir más mercancía Lulú solicita un préstamo por $925 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda mejorarás la vida de tres familia, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, ellas necesitan agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Mi name is Manuel de Jesus. Let me tell you that my main activity is in commerce. I have a micro enterprise. I make and distribute candy peddling the different small general and grocery stores of the city.

I have been dedicated to this business for several years. Thank God with the income I make from the business I can cover family expenses as well as commitments to my suppliers. I am very happy because this is a family micro enterprise since my wife and her children help out in their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Mi nombre es Manuel de Jesus, dejeme contarle que mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una micro Empresa de Dulces, los que distribuyo de manera ambulantes en las diferentes pulperia de mi ciudad. Tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio, gracias a Dios con los ingresos que percibo de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos familiares y asi mismo cumplir con los compromisos con los proveedores, me siento muy contento porque esta es una micro Empresa familiar ya que mi esposa y mis hijos me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: Purchasing bananas, plastic bags, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: I Komang Muriada

texts.id:
With only a Middle school diploma, and a so so looks, it was not enough for I Komang Muriada to get a job at a formal institution or a private company. Especially since married to Putu Putri Ariani, his responsibility has increased to provide a living for a wife and two children. Therefore Komang Muriada has to work hard to obtain enough income to support continued family living. Several work as laborer has been tried, however the income was not enough to support ever increasing family needs. Finally Komang Muriada follows his parents footsteps to work as a farmer. He works on the 40 are (about 4000 square meters) land owned by his parents with Dinari's loan. Komang Muriada started this new work since last year. As with othe farmers in his village, Komang Muriada also plants long bean vegetables on the land. From working the land, planting seeds, fertilized it, to spraying was done by Komang Muriada himself. During harvest time Komang Muriada is getting help from his wife and 2 daily laborers at a rate of Rp20,000 (about US$2.20)/day. In one plucking day harvest, Komang Muriada could make about 100 bunches (about 1 kg/bunch), which he sold for Rp2500-Rp3000 (about 30-35 cents). This was done once every two days. Long beans could be pluck about 25-30X per period (3 months). Within a period Komang Muriada could produce about Rp 6,000,000 (about US$660) in income. After subtracting Expenses for fertilizers, pesticides, labor cost, etc his net profit is Rp2,050,000 (about US$220)/ 3 months. This makes Komang Muriada more enthusiastic in doing his work.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan hanya memiliki Ijazah SMP dan ketrampilan yang pas-pasan, tak cukup bagi I Komang Muriada untuk mendapatkan pekerjaan di lembaga formal maupun perusahaan swasta. Apalagi semenjak menikah dengan Putu Putri Ariani, tanggung jawabnya semakin bertambah karena harus menghidupi istri dan dua orang anak.Untuk itu Komang Muriada harus berusaha keras untuk mendapatkan penghasilan yang menunjang kelangsungan hidup keluarga. Berbagai pekerjaan sebagai buruh sudah di cobanya, namun hasilnya tak cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya yang semakin meningkat. Sehingga akhirnya Komang Muriada harus mengikuti jejak orang tuanya terjun sebagai petani . Menggarap tanah seluas 40 Are milik orang tua dan dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari, Komang Muriada memulai menekuni pekerjaan barunya sejak tahun lalu . Seperti halnya petani lain di desanya Komang muriada juga menanami tanah garapannya dengan tanaman sayuran yaitu kacang panjang. Dari mengolah tanah, menanam bibit , memupuk dan menyemprot di kerjakan Komang Muriada sendiri . Sedangkan pada waktu musim panen Komang Muriada di bantu oleh istri dan juga ada dua orang tenaga buruh yang di bayar harian sebesar Rp 20.000,- . Dalam sekali petik hasil panen, Komang Muriada bisa mencapai 100 ikat ( beratnya kurang lebih 1 kg) , yang per ikat nya di jual Rp. 2.500,- s/d Rp. 3.000.,- Itu dilakukan tiap dua hari sekali . Tanaman kacang panjang bisa dipanen sebanyak 20 s/d 25 kali dalam satu periode ( 3 Bulan ) Dalam satu periode Komang Muriada mendapat hasil produksi sebesar Rp. 6.000.000,- dan keuntungan yang di peroleh setelah di potong biaya bibit, pupuk , obat-obatan , ongkos buruh dan lain-lain adalah sebesar Rp. 2.050.000,- / tiga bulan . Hasil ini membuat Komang Muriada semakin semangat untuk menekuni pekerjaannya itu.

loans.use:
To buy long bean seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and maintenance upkeep

Membeli bibit kacang panjang, pupuk, obat - obatan dan biaya perawatan

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a small entrepreneur owning a pharmacy shop. She is married to Fredrick Kaleme, who is a businessman, and she has two children ages 2 and 7. She is a very hard worker and has the ambition to become one of the best medicine sellers in the district. This is Maria's first loan request. She is asking for a loan of USD 525 to buy a used refrigerator. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a used refrigerator

loans.name: Aurora Maria's Group

texts.es:
Fermina, Aurora and Cristina have belonged to the Wood Communal Bank for 1, 3, and 1 years respectively. In their Communal Bank they learned about how to prevent illnesses, attend clients, invest and save.

Fermina is 40 years old, has 2 children and has sold slippers for 8 years. At first her merchandise was minimal. Recently her business has grown. She sells her slippers in the markets of Seccelambras and Quinua and in the Chorro Market. Aurora, on the other hand, is 37 years old and has 5 children. Aurora has been selling vegetables and fruits in the markets of Pampamarca and Seccelambras for 9 years. She brings wheat, barley, quinua (a Peruvian grain used to make pasta), and corn to the markets and sells them to the mills. Cristina is 56 years old and has 8 children. She sells typical foods such as spicy puca and tripe in the market of Nazarenas.

The loans of Fermina, Aurora and Cristina are of 600 soles, 400 soles and 400 soles respectively. The loans will be used to purchase slippers, carrots, onions, sugar, rice, noodles, soap, chickpeas, pallar beans, potatoes, and corn. Their savings will be used in the construction of their house, to buy bricks and for emergencies. The dreams of Fermina, Aurora and Cristina are as different as having a shoe store, building a house, starting a new business, buying a stall in the market and helping their children to be professionals.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva volunteer

Fermina, Aurora y Cristina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Torcaza hace 1, 3, 1 años respectivamente, en su Banco Comunal las capacitaron acerca D. cómo prevenir las enfermedades, cómo atender a los clientes, cómo invertir y aprendieron a ahorrar.

Fermina tiene 40 años y 2 hijos y desD. hace 8 años venD. zapatillas. Al inicio su mercadería era mínima, en la actualidad su negocio ha crecido, sus ventas las realiza en las ferias D. Seccelambras, Quinua y en el Mercado Chorro. Por otro lado Aurora tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Aurora es feriante hace 9 años, venD. verduras y frutas en las ferias D. Pampamarca y Seccelambras, y D. las ferias trae trigo, cebada, quinua, maíz y los venD. en los molinos. Mientras que Cristina tiene 56 años y 8 hijos y venD. comida típica como puca picante y mondongo en la feria D. Nazarenas.

Los préstamos D. Fermina, Aurora y Cristina son D. 600 soles, 400 soles y 400 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra D. zapatillas, zanahorias, cebolla, azúcar, arroz, fideo, jabón, garbanzo, pallar, papa, maíz. Sus ahorros los utilizarán en la construcción D. su casa, para comprar ladrillo y para alguna emergencia. Los sueños D. Fermina, Aurora y Cristina son diferentes como tener una tienda D. zapatos, construir su casa, implementar un nuevo negocio, comprar un puesto en el mercado y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase slippers, carrots, onions, sugar, rice, noodles, soap, chickpeas, pallar beans, potatoes, and corn.

loans.name: Katogo C(Iii) Group

texts.en:
Betty is 32 years old and married with three children. The husband is a business man. Betty has a restaurant business. With the extra profits, she wants to open up a poultry business for her father. Mary and Mastula are poultry farmers and want to use the loan to expand the business. Jane sells second hand clothes while Mary has a retail shop business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To  buy food warmers

loans.name: Essinu

texts.fr:
Mrs Essinu K. (the woman in the straw hat) is 48 years old, married and mother of five (05) children. She makes local juice which she sells every day at the bus stop in Adéta. The revenue drawn from this business, which she has been working at for 10 years, helps to contribute to the needs of her family. She has her third loan, which she always pays. This current loan will allow her to build a shop to protect her from the sun and reserve a welcome for her clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Essinu K.(femme portant le chapeau en raffia) est âgée de 48 ans , mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle fabrique Du jus local qu’elle vend tous les jours à la gare routière d’Adéta. Le revenu tiré de cette activité qu’elle exerce depuis 10 ans sert à contribuer aux charges de sa famille. Elle à son troisième crédit qu’elle toujours paye. Le présent prêt lui permettra de construire un local Pour se protéger contre le soleil et réservé un accueil à sa clientel.

loans.use: Construction of a shop to improve the scale of her juice bar

loans.name: Las Margaritas Ii Group

texts.en:
The 32 women of Las Margaritas are neighbors in their small village of Yepocapa. It is through the daily life of raising their families near one another that they decided to form a solidarity group and take out loans from Friendship Bridge. This will be their first loan, and all are eager to take on the new challenge and learn how to improve their businesses with the support of start-up capital.

Of the 32 women, 12 of them are asking for a loan of 17,600 quetzales (about $2,325 USD). These twelve women are farmers; growing potatoes, corn, and milpa (the leaf that is used to wrap tamales) on small plots of land behind their homes. They also raise cattle, chickens, and pigs, producing the majority of the town’s eggs, milk, cheese, and meat. They will use their loans to purchase seed and fertilizer for their crops and feed for their animals. One woman will invest her loan in a new calf. She raises only chickens now, and is excited about the possibility of diversifying her product base, and being able to sell milk, as well as to proviD. this delicacy for her family.

While each woman is somewhat nervous about this new venture, they are confident in their strength and have overcome countless obstacles in their lives that have prepared them for taking on this new aspect of business. They are ready to support each other with their loans, just as they have supported each other each day with raising their families.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and feed for animals

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
Maria is 52 years old and prepares and sells lunches and dinners in her guesthouse. She has both sons and daughters, but it is the daughters who help her in the guesthouse that forms part of her home, which she owns. Maria has many years of experience in this type of work. There is little competition since she owns the only guesthouse in the area. Her speciality is a la carte and set menu meals. She sells full lunches for 8 bolivianos and dinners for 6 bolivianos. Currently she owes money to another financial institution, but she doesn’t pose a big risk as Maria has demonstrated that she fulfils her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de 52 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de almuerzos y cenas en su pensión. Tiene hijos e hijas, las hijas son las que ayudan en la pensión que se encuentra instalada en el domicilio que es propio. Maria tiene muchos años de experiencia en este rubro y el nivel de competencia es bajo ya que es la única pensión por la zona. Su especialidad son platos a la carta y los menus del día, los almuerzos completos los vende a 8 bolivianos y la cena a seis bolivianos. Actualmente tiene una deuda con otra institución financiera, pero no representa un riesgo mayor, Maria demostró ser una persona responsable con sus obligaciones.

loans.use: Restaurant expansion

loans.name: Maboiyanday Ll Group

texts.en:
Mohamed K. is 52 years old and married with 5 children. He has been running his business of buying and selling cows for a long time. As a good SMYT client, he was recommended for Kiva loans and obtained his first Kiva loan 8 months ago. With the loan, he increased the number of animals in his flocks and earned a good profit.

Isata sells agricultural products such as rice, palm oil, and beans, and she would like to expand her business. They are therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,200,000.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows and agricultural products in order to increase income

loans.name: Gasparina's Group

texts.es:
There are 15 hardworking women from the town of Caacupé in the group Yaka Roysa. The majority run commercial enterprises from their own homes where they sell groceries or clothing or chupas (a chewy bread snack). They are all neighbours and are now in the third cycle of the women’s program. Each person receives an average of G.600.000 of credit.

The formation of the group was largely due to the efforts of Sra. Gasparina P. who invited her neighbours to participate. They soon became interested in the women’s program and so began the first meetings. The group’s objective currently is the activities associated with the San Juan festival where they plan to sell local dishes and use the money they earn to add to their own savings.

One of the characteristics of the members of this group is the high level of observance of the rules that govern the program. This is demonstrated by the regular repayment of the loan and by punctual attendance at the weekly meetings. They are also very strict about members who miss meetings without good reason, and the guilty are given warnings.

Gasparina notes that the success of an undertaking is due in large part to good organisation and discipline. For these reasons she is very grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya which, as well as helping the group raise capital, also provides an advisor to assist with training and the administrative tools necessary to run a group business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Yaka Roysa de la ciudad de Caacupé, gran parte de las señoras se dedican a actividades comerciales que lo explotan en su mismo domicilio, como despensas, chiperas, vendedoras de ropas, entre otras, todas son vecinas, actualmente y están en el 3 ciclo del programa comité de mujeres y reciben un promedio de G. 600.000 por persona en crédito.

La conformación del grupo se debió a la gran colaboración que brindo la señora Gasparina P., quien fue la que comenzó inicialmente con las invitaciones a sus vecinas quienes rápidamente mostraron interés por el programa de comité de mujeres. Fue así como se realizaron las primeras reuniones, actualmente el comité tiene como objetivo en este mes de las festividades de San Juan, realizar ferias de comidas típicas con el objetivo de recaudar fondos a para capitalizar sus ahorros interno.

Una de las características de los integrantes de este comité es el alto grado de cumplimientos de las normas que rige este programa y esta demostrado por la buena conducta de pago, y la asistencia puntual a las reuniones semanales, como también son muy exigentes con lo relacionado con las ausencias a las reuniones la misma deben ser justificadas caso contario reciben amonestaciones.

Gasparina, afirma que el éxito de un emprendimiento se debe gran parte al orden y la disciplina y en ese aspecto están muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya porque a parte de facilitarle el capital de trabajo también reciben capacitación a través de su asesor quien les brinda las herramientas necesarias para administrar grupos de personas.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand and new clothes. Several women will also buy silver jewelry and other items such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil, herbs, sugar, biscuits, noodles, drinks etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes has been selling wooden furniture out of her home for the past year. She encouraged herself to take on this business because a relative makes the furniture, like wardrobes, beds, dressers, etc. She also has made a living the past four years selling shoes and sheets via order. Her clients are friends and neighbors. The loans she has received have helped her pay for the furniture she offers and purchase the merchandise that she sells via orders. Mercedes would like to have a large store where she could sell her furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Mercedes vende muebles de madera en su casa desde hace 1 año. Ella se animó a incursionar en este negocio debido a que un familiar fabrica esto muebles, como roperos, camas, cómodas, etc. Ella también se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sábanas por pedidos desde hace 4 años. Sus clientes son sus conocidos y vecinos. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para pagar los muebles que ofrece y para comprar la mercadería que vende por pedidos. A Mercedes le gustaría tener un local grande donde vender los muebles que ofrece.

loans.use: Pay for the furniture she offers and purchase the merchandise that she sells via orders / Para pagar los muebles que ofrece en su casa y para comprar la mercadería que vende por pedidos.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is a hardworking tailor who is 31 years old.  He has lived together with María Lourdes for the past three years, and they have a beautiful child.

He began this work 17 years ago, when he was in class at secondary school and needed money in order to pay for his studies.  Eventually, he finished high school, he couldn't continue studying for a career because of economic problems, and he began to work as a professional tailor.  Since then, 14 years has passed.

In the beginning, he began working for an important tailor in the area, and later became independent and for the past 5 years he has had his own tailoring ship in his home.  In this location he completes his work in the company of his partner.  Edgar sews suits of all types, while María Lourdes makes curtains and dresses to order.  Currently, he needs a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine.

 Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Edgar es un sacrificado sastre que tiene 31 años de edad, vive en pareja hace 3 años con María Lourdes con quien tiene un hermoso hijo.
Se inició en la actividad a los 17 años, cuando aún estaba cursando la secundaria debido a que necesita el dinero para costear sus estudios. Una vez que culminó el colegio ya no pudo seguir estudiando ninguna carrera debido a problemas económicos y se metió de lleno en la profesión de sastre. Desde entonces ya han transcurrido 14 años.
En un principio comenzó trabajando para una sastrería importante de la zona, luego consiguió independizarse y hace 5 años que montó su propio taller en su domicilio.
En dicho lugar realiza sus trabajos en compañía de su pareja. Edgar cose trajes de todo tipo, mientras que María Lourdes confecciona cortinas y vestidos sobre pedido.
En esta ocasión necesita de un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser nueva.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en: Antoine. 49, is married and has four children. He lives in the region of Saida in southern Lebanon where he works as a maintenance employee at the International Lebanese University. He doesn't earn much but it is a stable job. Antoine loves to keep active, and in his free time he works in in the agriculture industry. This extra income is very important for his family as well as Antoine's own peace of mind. Antoine has asked Al Majmoua for a $1,000 loan to purchase a cutting machine and a motor for pulverization to be used in his farming activities. This is the first time that Antoine has worked with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new farming machines

loans.name: Sarah A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Sarah A. M. from Tukuyu, married with four children between the ages of 9 and 18. Sarah has been operating a store selling soft drinks and beer since 2006. Assisted by her husband, she works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, earning about $80 each month.

She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to buy more crates of soft drinks and beer for the business. In the future, she plans to have her own bar. Sarah thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks and beers.

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es: El Sr. D. S. habita en la Cmca. El Sinchal-Tecolostote junto a su familia compuesta por 3 hijos mayores y su esposa; por esfuerzo propio tiene establecido 4 Mzs de arroz, el que tiene que vender en granza a menor precio, lo que reduce sus ingresos familiares, un hijo labora junto a el en la agricultura; es socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza, y a traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar en la instalacion de un trillo arrocero en la cumunidad, lo que le permitira maximizar sus ingresos familiares, su mayor deseo es participar de este proyecto como socio y asi garantizar ingresos adiciones que le permitan un mejor futuro a su familia y la comunidad.
texts.en:
D. S. lives in Cmca. El Sinchal-Tecolostote together with his family, made up of 3 grown children and his wife. On his own he has established a plantation of 7 hectares of rice. He has to sell at a better price thereby reducing his family income. His son works together with him in the fields. He is a member of the cooperative La Esperanza (meaning The Hope), and thruogh this cooperative he has the opportunity to contribute towards the installation of a rice thresher in the community, permitting him to maximize his family income. His greatest wish is to participate in this project as a member and guarantee an income, which will permit a better future for his family and the community.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute 30% of the construction of a rice thresher in La Pena.

loans.name: Nhữthị

texts.vi:
Chị Nhữ Thị G. năm nay 49 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành tại thị trấn Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn mở cửa hàng kinh doanh phân bón.Với mức thu nhập bình quân đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị G. đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư cho công việc kinh daonh phân bón tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. NhữThị G. is 49 years old. She has been participating in the TYM Fund since 2002. She is currently living in the town of Gia Lộc Hải Dương District with her husband. Her two children are grown. In addition to raising livestock, her family has a fertilizer retail business. With an average income of 3,000,000 VND per month, the family's financial situation becomes more stable and continues to improve daily.
