Catharine produces and sells wooden combs at retail and wholesale prices. Wooden combs in Nigeria are used to weave lovely hairstyles. She is making really progress in her business and hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. Catharine is requesting a loan of 160,000 NGN to purchase more materials to produce more wooden combs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to produce more wooden combs to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy D. G. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Daisy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Daisy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	Las mencionadas mujeres  Del comité Kuña Aty (Unión de Mujeres) son del Barrio San Francisco de la Ciudad de Caacupe. 
Son Sras. que en su totalidad trabajan en la elaboración y venta de chipas a gran escala, todas ellas trabajan en sus propios hogares para la elaboración de su producto que luego lo salen a comercializar en varios puntos de la ciudad de Asunción.
En temporadas anteriores al programa comité de mujeres ya trabajaban comercialmente pero en menor escala. Por esto es que en estos días, al formar parte del programa de Comité de mujeres emprendedoras,  existe una actitud de sentido de pertenencia de las mismas para mantenerse al tanto de los requerimientos que les exige el comité.
Una de la señoras es la Miguela quien con la ayuda de toda la familia elabora sus ricas chipas todos los días a muy tempranas horas, ya que debe entregar los pedidos a los revendedores. 
Ella con su familia trabaja con mucho esfuerzo, con muchos deseos de superación especialmente para sus hijos quienes están estudiando para una profesión y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de sus productos como almidón, queso, grasa, calabazo y otros.
El crédito facilitará el trabajo ya aumentará el capital que cada una posee y así podrán satisfacer sus necesidades, invirtiendo en sus pequeños negocios que les generara más ingresos a la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Description: the women of the Kuña Aty (Unión de Mujeres) committee are from the San Francisco neighborhood of the city of Caacupe. All of the women work at making and selling chipas [a traditional cheese bread] on a large scale. All of them work in their own homes making the products and later they go out to various points of the city of Asuncion to sell them. Previously, the women's committee program worked commercially but in a smaller scale. That is why these days, with the formation of the business women's committee, there is an attitude of belonging from keeping up with the requirements that the committee makes of them. One of the women is Miguela, who, with the help of her whole family, makes her delicious chipas every day starting very early, since she has to deliver the orders to the resalers. With her her family, she works very hard. She wants very much to get ahead, especially since her children are studying for their professions. In this way she is improving her income and her quality of life. She is asking for this loan to purchase ingredients to make her product, such as starch, cheese, oil, squash and others. The loan will facilitate the work and increase the capital that each woman has. In this way, they will be able to satisfy their needs, investing in their small businesses that will generate more income for the family unit.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for chipas, such as: starch, yucca starch, cheese, squash, and corn meal.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthy S. is 36 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Sreychim Hem, is 34 years old. They have been married since 1999 and have one daughter, who attends school. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthy has been a fisherman for ten years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for two years. He wants to start a pig-raising business in order to earn extra income.  He is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise and to build a kitchen for his family's use.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and to build a kitchen for his family.

loans.name: Emma Chelle

texts.en: Emma Chelle B. is from the village of San Jose. She is 22 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Emma Chelle owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP whenever she sells her harvested rice. In 2006, Emma Chelle joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Emma Chelle is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Yumjirdulam

texts.en:
Yumjirdulam A., 39, lives with her husband and two sons in a traditional housing tent called a ger in Uvurhangai Province in Mongolia. Since 2001 she has been operating a meat-trading business, purchasing meat at wholesale prices. She has a rented stall in the biggest market of the province, while her husband provides transportation services with his own car.

An open-hearted and generous woman, Yumjirdulam says, “ I am trying my best to keep my business stable.” She is now requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and livestock at wholesale prices

loans.use: To purchase meat and livestock to sell

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa M. est une couturière  qui exerce en même  temps l’activiste  de commerce. Elle est âgée  de 41 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse de Camberene depuis 2008. Elle a déjà  rembourse un prêt antérieur. Elle a une expérience  de plus de 10 ans dans la couture. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs qui sera destine a l’achat de tissus prévus  pour la confection de certaines commandes. Ce financement lui permettra d’élargir  ses activités et de maximiser ses gains.
texts.en:
Awa M. is a dressmaker who also runs a retail business. She is 41 years old and has been a member of the Camberene group fund since 2008. She has already repaid one previous loan. She has more than 10 years' worth of experience in the field of dressmaking. She is seeking a loan of 250,000 frs, which will be used to buy fabric intended to make several dresses that have been ordered. This loan will allow her to enlarge her business and maximize her earnings.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes T. currently sells green vegetables such as okra, cabbage, sukumawiki (kale), etc., at the marketplace and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish and fresh Irish potatoes to sell.

Agnes is 24 years old, is married to a driver, and has two children who still stay at home without studying.

With the extra profits from her loan, Agnes will double her effort to provide comfort for her family by providing them with basic needs and by sending her children to school.

loans.use: To stock dried fish and fresh Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Uranbileg

texts.en: Uranbileg B. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in a ger — a traditional housing tent. Her two daughters are students and her husband operates a private business. Uranbileg opened a foreign languages training center called Happy Friends in 2007. Uranbileg is a polite and well-educated woman who wants to expand her business by publishing more efficient and useful textbooks and manuals for her students. She is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to print out language training DVDs and textbooks to sell, thus increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: To print out language training DVDs and textbooks

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna O. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 40 years old. Erna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Erna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Erna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

Erna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Erna is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Erna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita T. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 39 years old. Mercedita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mercedita works hard to keep her farm free of weeds and pests. She makes it a goal to keep the farm productive.

Mercedita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Meerinsa's Group

texts.en:
Meerinsa A. is the leader of this group. She is 36 years old and divorced. She has an eight-year-old daughter who goes to school.  A year ago, with the initial investment of 5,000 KGS, Meerinsa started her own business. She is engaged in the wholesale trade of home products. In this way she earns around $170 per month.  With money received from the loan, Meerinsa wants to purchase a variety of goods to resell, such as pillows, napkins, toiletries, etc. In the future she wants to expand her business and then save money to purchase a vehicle.

Gulnara A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 47 years old and married. She has three sons and two daughters. Her two older sons are engaged in cattle breeding and the other children are at school.  Gulnara and her husband started to breed cattle fifteen years ago. Selling some cattle after fattening they average about $43 per month. Gulnara also cultivates and sells raspberries for income.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a bull in order to resell it at a higher price after fattening.
 
Ysakbai A., 63, is married. He has a daughter and two sons, all of whom are at school.  Ysakbai works in a barber shop and his wife is a librarian. Ysakbai hopes to obtain the loan because he needs money to start repairing his house. In the future, he dreams of opening his own barber shop. 

Damirbek T., 23, is married. He is an electrician and his wife works as a nurse in the hospital. Four years ago, with the initial investment of 5,000 KGS, he started to breed cattle. Selling some farm animals after fattening he makes around $85 per month. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase a bull for breeding, and some part of the loan he will use to celebrate his wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase home products to resell

loans.name: Arcoiris De Lerma Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “Arcoíris de Lerma”, en él se encuentra la señora Elvia T. de 50 años de edad, ella nos comenta que tiene 5 hijos y 9 nietos. Su esposo se llama Andrés Martínez Alvarado el cual lleva 30 años trabajando de albañil. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, venta de dulces y frituras. Al principio la señora  se dedicaba a la siembra y cosecha de maíz, frijol, y aba, hacía también tortillas, cuidaba vacas y caballos, también lavaba y planchaba ropa. Ahora los créditos le seguirán ayudando para tener mayor ganancia en su negocio y su ilusión es que sus nietos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. En este grupo también se encuentra la señora Mónica Martínez T., quien es hija de la señora Elvia T.,  Mónica tiene 22 años de edad, un hijo de 5 años y se dedica a la aplicación de uñas, planchado de cejas y rizado de pestañas, actualmente estudia estilismo profesional, su crédito lo invertirá en material y con sus próximos créditos piensa construir una accesoria para poner una estética.
texts.en:
This group is called “Arcoíris de Lerma” (Rainbow of Lerma) and one of its members is Sra. Elvia T.. She is 50 years old and says she has five children and nine grandchildren. Her husband is named Andrés Martínez Alvarado and has worked as a mason for 30 years. Elvia has a business selling clothes, candy, and fritters. At first she made her living by growing and harvesting corn, kidney beans, and lima beans. She also made tortillas, raised cows and horses, and took in clothes to launder and iron. With the loans she is now able to generate more profits from her business. Elvia dreams of seeing her grandchildren have a better quality of life.

Another member of this group is Sra. Mónica Martínez T., who is Sra. Elvia’s daughter. Mónica is 22 years old and has a five year old son. She works as a nail technician, but she also performs eyebrow shaping and eyelash curling. Mónica is currently studying to become a professional stylist. Her loan will be invested in materials. With the subsequent loans she plans to receive, she hopes to build a salon where she can set up her aesthetics practice.

loans.use: Operating capital to reinvest into the business

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 41 years old. Rochelle is married and has two children. She is involved in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for quite some time now. She also raises pigs, but focuses on farming. Rochelle wants to save for her children's education, which is why she works extra hard. She also wants to improve her family's living conditions.

Rochelle joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rochelle has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rochelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita B. is a 42-year-old married woman with a daughter and a son. They live in Bhatkepati, Lalitpur. Her husband, Mr. Shyam Krishna B., is a driver. Both her son and daughter are studying in higher secondary school.

Mrs. B. started selling milk five years ago. She already owns one cow. She's requesting a loan of 30,000 NPR to buy another young cow so she can sell more milk in the local area. Since they live in a growing neighborhood, she believes that there will be an increase in the demand for milk. Nepalese people love to drink cow's milk, so demand for milk is increasing constantly. 

She wishes to spend her income on her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish and pig's feet

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La sra. Gloria E. tiene 33 años , es separada y tiene 2 hijos , un varon de 9 años que esta realizando sus estudios primarios y una nena de 4 años.
La misma se dedica a la compra-venta de chatarras , hierros, cobre , bronce y acumuladores en deshuso desde el año 2007.
Para dicho trabajo cuenta con un camion Daihatsu año 1980 que es manejado por un chofer al que paga en forma semanal.
El préstamo solicitado lo invirtio en la compra de dichas mercaderias para la venta a las recicladoras de la zona.
texts.en:
Gloria E. is 33 years old.  She is separated and has 2 children; a 9 year-old boy who is in elementary school and a 4 year-old girl.

Gloria buys and sells scrap metal, iron, copper, bronze and disused storage batteries.  She has been doing this since 2007.

To carry out her work, she has a 1980 Daihatsu truck which has a driver who she pays weekly.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying more of the aforementioned merchandise which she can sell to recycling companies in the area.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal, iron, bronze, copper and disused storage batteries

loans.name: Maryuri Verónica

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Calle #2.
 
En este lugar encontramos y conocimos a la señora Maryuri, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 2 años,  la mayor estudia en escuela. Su marido es comerciante.
 
Es socia fundadora del Banco Comuna, está muy contenta en el Banco y le encantan las reuniones ya que en ellas se divierte y aprende mucho.

Trabaja en el bar del colegio Manabí Tecnológico de lunes a viernes, además los fines de semana se desplaza al cantón  Jama  a vender ropa, como ella tiene familiares por allá se queda desde el día viernes hasta el día domingo en las tardes que regresa después de haber realizado todas sus ventas, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil y Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar ropa. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia ya que vive en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank "Calle #2" meet every two weeks in the Nueva California neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds. 

In this place we met Maryuri who is 31 years old, is married and has two children ages nine and two years old. Her oldest daughter is in school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Maryuri is a founding member of the community bank and she is very happy with the bank. She enjoys the meetings because she has fun and learns a lot. 

She works at the snack bar of the Manabi technology school Mondays through Fridays and on the weekends she goes back to Jama subdivision to sell clothing since she has family members in that area. She stays there Fridays through Sundays and returns after making her sales. She gives credit and collects every weekend. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and Protoviejo. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing. Her dream is to have her own home since she is now living with her parents.

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: Las Nazarenas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Nazarenas inicia su segundo ciclo con 16 socios-as, los cuales tienen variados  negocios. Rufina E. es socia D. Banco Comunal, es casada, tiene 6 hijos y 4 nietos. El mayor D. sus hijos es casado, otros dos D. sus hijos se han graduado D. L. Universidad, y 2 aun se encuentran estudiando.
Rufina compra verduras para vender en su puesto en uno D. los mercados principales D. Ayacucho, el préstamo que solicita lo utilizara en L. compra D. verduras en cantidad al por mayor. A Rufina le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal, aunque admite que con su trabajo ocupado y L. vida familiar, a veces le es difícil llegar a las reuniones programadas cada dos semanas. 
El sueño D. Rufina es que todos sus hijos se gradúen D. L. universidad y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Las Nazarenas Communal Bank, which is starting its second loan cycle, has 16 members who run a variety of businesses.

Rufina E. is a member of the communal bank who is married and has six children and four grandchildren.  Her oldest child is married, two others have graduated from university, and two are still in school.  Rufina buys vegetables to sell at her stand in one of the main markets of Ayacucho.  She will use the loan she is requesting to buy vegetables in wholesale quantities.  Rufina enjoys her communal bank's meetings, though she admits that with her busy work and family life, it is sometimes difficult to attend the meetings that are scheduled every two weeks.

Rufina's dream is for all of her children to graduate from university and to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Monic

texts.en: 38 year old N. Monic has been in the beauty salon business for the past 5 years. The business is located in Wanyange-Jinja. The happily married and amiable mother of 2 was previously worked in a close friend's salon. She says that is where she learned the hands-on skills in hair dressing. With her focused approach, she has been able to achieve a lot, given that her business requires good relationship skills. In that regard she has not shortchanged herself. Notwithstanding the successes Monic has achieved, she has also had to grapple with a lot of financial challenges that have in many ways dampened the smooth running of her business. Monic also has raises and sells goats on the side. With her optimism, the future looks bright. She says she wants to construct a family house and develop another income generating business. Weekly this business generates 30,000 shillings. With this loan, she says she wants to purchase more hair cosmetic products for use at her beauty salon.

loans.use: The purchase more hair cosmetic products for use at her beauty salon

loans.name: Juan Feliberto

texts.es: Juan Feliberto tiene una pulpería, hace más de diez años siempre esta pensando en mejorar cada día su actividad. El es una persona muy dinámica y disfruta de obtener este medio de vida, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan diferentes productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes entre otros. Sueña con    mejorar cada día más su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Feliberto has a store that he has managed for more than ten years. Every day he thinks about improving his business. Juan is a dynamic person who enjoys this way of life. Most of his customers always request different products.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, grain, detergents, and other items. His dream is to improve his business each day.

loans.use: Purchase candy, soft drinks, grain, detergents, and other items

loans.name: Shuru's Group

texts.en:
Shuru S., 57, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tokmok, a small town near Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). Together with her husband she has raised six children. All are married and live with their families. 

Shuru and her husband are pensioners and in order to earn money to meet their personal needs, they breed cattle. The couple also sells milk for making additional money. With the money received from the loan, Shuru wants to purchase cattle for breeding.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Escarlet Lourdes

texts.es:
Escarlet soltera, trabaja en una empresa privada como conserje desde hace un tiempo. Sus planes son mejorar la infraestructura de sus vivienda  ya que requiere construir un anexo para cuarto y asi tiene mayor comodidad. 
Solicitad el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, laminas, bloques, arena, piedrín, perlines, reglones, alambre de amarre y otros materiales.Obteniendo seguridad, protección.
texts.en: Scarlet is single and has worked in a private company as a janitor for a while.  Her plans are to make improvements to her home including building a new annex, which would make it more comfortable.  She is requesting the loan to buy construction materials such as: cement, iron, sheets, blocks, sand, gravel, casters, screeds, wire and other materials. The improvements will provide protection and security.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma F. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Thelma is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as canned goods, snack foods, biscuits and candies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $192 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Thelma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Thelma is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 8th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: 59 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Sáp N. Thị (124) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Sáp is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 59-Quảng Hưng (18-1-59 Quảng Hưng).
Sáp is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, mainly selling confectionery products, in the local community. Sáp has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,600,000 VND per month from these activities.
In 2010, Sáp joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her second from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Sáp plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. H. Thị M. Thu (123) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. 2. N. Thị Hiên (125) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Sáp N. Thị (124) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Sáp là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 59-Quảng Hưng (18-1-59 Quảng Hưng). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Sáp thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Sáp kiếm được khoảng 1,600,000 VND. Vào 2010, Sáp đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Sáp đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. H. Thị M. Thu (123) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 2. N. Thị Hiên (125) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly A. is from the village of San Francisco, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Sherly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Sherly has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Sherly joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Sherly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products such as canned goods and beverages. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods and beverages

loans.name: 6 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
"Phượng N. Thị (5) is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Phượng is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 6 Đông Hải (16-02-6 Đông Hải).


Phượng is married and has two adult-aged children.  To making a living, Phượng owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Phượng has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Phượng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be the 9th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Phượng  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Vẹn (44) is a 54 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  B. Thị Thấu (17) is a 60 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Phượng  N. Thị (5) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Phượng  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 6 Đông Hải (16-02-6 Đông Hải).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Phượng  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Phượng  kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2004, Phượng  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Phượng  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,248,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Vẹn (44) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  B. Thị Thấu (17) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy estela B., vive en el barrio Villa del Carmen en el municipio de Soledad  con su esposo(quien aparece en la fotografia) y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 10 años;  desde allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada como cosméticos , ropa etc. Ella también tiene otro negocio de vender  carne de cerdo y gallina por libras que le genera ingresos importantes; estas ideas emprendedores nacieron de la imaginación de Lucy, para apoyar la gestión de su esposo en el hogar,  pues hasta antes de ella ser trabajadora independiente la asumía él solo;  así fue como empezó con poco capital ofreciendo crédito y tiene que esperar recoger sus cartera para poder responderle a su clientela, este es la razón por la cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para solicitar un credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que recibe de esta organización, con la cual desea crecer de su mano; Con este dinero comprará, talcos, desodorantes, productos de tocador, carne de cerdo, gallina, para venderla en esta época de Mayo, mes  en el cual repuntan sus ventas por qué ocurre la celebración del día des madres, que convoca a la unidad y donde las familias compran a Lucy sus mercancías para obsequiarlas a las madres de sus familias y también compran carne  de cerdo y gallina para preparar y compartir comidas especiales  para celebrar este maravillosos día.
texts.en: Lucy Estela B. lives in the Villa del Carmen neighborhood, in the town of Soledad, with her husband (who appears in the photo) and their three children, who are between the ages of 6 and 10. She earns a living by selling a variety of merchandise, including cosmetics and clothing. She also has another business selling pork and chicken by the pound, which brings in a good amount of money. Lucy is creative and entrepreneurial and started these businesses to help her husband support the family, which he used to do by himself before she became an independent worker. She started out with just a little money and offers her goods on credit, so she's turning to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to ask for a Kiva loan. This is the first financing she's received from this organization, and is hoping to use it to expand her business. She will purchase talcum powder, deodorant, beauty products, pork, and chicken, and sell them this month. Her sales are always up in May because of Mother's Day, as families come together and buy Lucy's products as gifts for their mothers and buy meat in order to celebrate special meals on this wonderful day.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken, as well as merchandise such as talcum powder, deodorant, and beauty products.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Elena pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo” del Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene  43  años  y es madre de 02  hijos,  una mujer y un varón ambos estudian en el nivel secundario.

Decide  iniciar su negocio de venta de refrigerios hace 20 años, su capital inicial fue de S/ 100.00  nuevos soles, sus principales consumidores son clientes que acuden al taller de su esposo y transeúntes.

Con este crédito de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará productos preparados como: humitas,  tamales, juanes (alimentos fríos a base de maíz, arroz, carne) , queques, galletas, paquetes de gaseosa de diferentes sabores y tamaños, agua mineral con gas y sin gas.  Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de  frutas de la región para la preparación de jugos y refrescos para acompañar el refrigerio. 

Rosa Elena siempre está contenta y su sueño es contar, mas adelante, con una tienda de repuestos para vehículos  muy grande. Está agradecida con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que le brinda al  contribuir  con el cumplimiento de su sueño.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena belongs to the “El Abiseo” communal bank in Juanjui District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, San Martín Department.  She’s married and is 43 years old.  She is the mother of two children, a girl and a boy; both go to secondary school.

She decided to start her refreshments business twenty years ago.  Her initial capital was 100 new soles and her main consumers are customers that come to her husband’s shop and passersby.

She will use this 3000 new sol loan to buy prepared products like: humitas, tamales, juanes (cold food based on corn, rice and meat), cakes, cookies, various flavors and sizes of soft drinks, sparkling and flat mineral water.  Part of the money will be used to buy regional fruit to prepare juice and beverages to accompany the food.

Rosa Elena is always happy and her dream is to have, later on, a very large vehicle spare parts store.  She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the help it provides towards her dream becoming a reality.

loans.use: to buy prepared food like: humitas, tamales, juanes (cold food based on corn, rice and meat), cakes, cookies, soft drinks and water.

loans.name: Seap

texts.en:
Seap, 32, is a garment worker. Her husband, 35, sells sugar cane juice. The couple has been married since 1999 and has two children--one son and one daughter. They live along National Road two, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Seap is asking for a loan of $500 to build a restroom for her family's use.

Photo: Seap and her husband.

loans.use: To build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: 3 Tân Nam . Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tỵ has a retail business selling electronics.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Tỵ is 60 years old and she is married with 2 children.  Tỵ is the group leader of the 9.1.3 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 
Tỵ lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Tỵ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  Tỵ has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Tỵ has been involved in this business for 4 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit,  Tỵ hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: To purchase electronic devices to resell

loans.name: Maximiliano Pablo

texts.es: Maximiliano Pablo tiene 63 años.  Su actividad económica que es L. venta productos lácteos. Hace más D. 25 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio porque desD. muy joven trabaja en empresas privadas y tenía el conocimiento D. esta actividad fue así que deciD. establece su negocio. Su desafío ha sido problemas D. salud pues algunas veces el no se siente muy bien para orD.ñar y atender su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para L. compra D. cuajada, crema, leche, queso, leche agria entre otros.
texts.en: Maximiliano Pablo is 63 and for the past 25 years his business has been the sale of  dairy products.    He started this business because when he was very young, he worked in private companies and learned how, and that was why he decided to go out on his own.  His challenges have been health problems because sometimes he doesn’t feel well enough to milk the cows and take care of the business.  The loan he is requesting will help him buy curds, cream, milk, cheese, sour milk, etc.

loans.use: To buy curds, cream, milk, cheese,  sour milk, etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 35, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Millirocen, an overseas Filipino worker and a painter.  She has three children, one of whom is not yet of school age and two who are in school. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Jocelyn believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children. 

Jocelyn operates a silkscreen printing business. Silkscreen printing is the process of creating a stencil in a mesh screen, then using a squeegee to push the inks through the mesh onto the shirt or garment. Clients go to Jocelyn to request printing; they provide their desired pattern or design. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Jocelyn earns a minimum of PHP 9500 per month from her work.    

To help her continue the operation of her business, Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials, like paint, screen, and shirts. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jocelyn dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and items needed in her business.

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Madame Ndella est à sa deuxième demande de crédit dans son IMF. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Commerçante de métier, Madame souhaite acheter des marchandises avec ce prêt. Elle a été initié dans ce métier par ses copines qui vendent des tissus à crédit à travers la ville.
texts.en: Ms. Ndella is on her second request for a loan at her micro-finance institution. She is married and the mother of four children. A merchant by trade, she would like to purchase some merchandise with her loan. She was introduced to this trade by her friends who sell cloth on credit throughout the city.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and finery and to resell them

loans.name: Pagmadulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Pagmadulam is 33, unmarried and lives with her brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 1999, she has been working as a hairdresser. In 2005, she could start own business in this field and opened her barbershop called “Usukh”. She hired two hairdressers in her salon and renders a manicure service to the clients. Pagmadulam is one of the hard-working women and her daily job continues between 9:00 am-10:00 pm everyday. Recently, she has been planning to expand her business by improving her equipment or making a repair to her workplace. But she needs financial support to do it. It’s very important for her business and life.

Therefore, she is taking a loan to purchase some new equipment and to renew her barbershop.

loans.use: to purchase some new equipment to renew her barbershop.

loans.name: Narlina

texts.en:
Narlina is 39 years old and married. She is living happily with her husband and two children. Narlina's husband is a farmer and her children are going to school at the elementary and high school level. Narlina and her husband have no other wish for their children than to finish their studies and become professionals someday.

Narlina is engaged in a sari-sari store business where she sells canned goods, powdered juice, candies and biscuits. Narlina is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock like spices, vinegar, soy sauce and drinks to sell in their village. She hopes that through the loan, Narlina could get a higher income from the business and be able to sustain the allowances of her children through college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like spices, vinegar, soy sauce and drinks to sell in their village.

loans.name: Gesler

texts.es: Gerler, de 52 años, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, es padre de dos hijos de 18 y 20 años con quienes vive junto a su esposa en una casa propia. Gerler esta a punto de empezar con un proyecto que tenía mente hace mucho tiempo, él siempre quiso tener un restaurante cerca de su casa, pero por el momento trabaja en una polleria. En todo este tiempo que ha trabajado siempre ha ahorrado para cumplir su objetivo, sin emabrgo aún le falta, en tanto él y su esposa empezaran a trabajar juntos vendiendo pollo broaster en un pequeño puesto que queda en la esquina de su casa. Espera poder hacer grandes cosas, en este nuevo negocio, por ello esté será su primer crédito con MFP y no duda en poder pagar sin ningún problema sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará una cocina y algunos utensilios para empezar con su tan ansiado negocio propio.
texts.en:
52-year-old Gerler is a hard-working and entrepreneurial man.  He is the father of two children aged 18 and 20 and he lives together with them and his wife in his own home.  Gerler is about to start a project that he has had in mind for a long time.  He has always wanted to have a restaurant near his home but he currently works in a poultry store.  During all the years that he has worked, he has always saved up so that he can eventually achieve his goal.  However, he is still lacking some money.  He and his wife will start working together selling fried chicken from a small stall on the corner outside their home.  He hopes to be able to achieve big things in this new business. 

This will be Gerler's first loan from MFP and he is certain that he will be able to make his repayments without problems.  He will use the sum he has requested to buy a stove and some utensils so that he can start work in his own business that he has wished for for so long.

loans.use: to buy a stove and utensils

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 64 years old and lives in P-1 Embargo, Ozamiz City. She is married with 3 children. 
Rosario has a copra (dried coconut meat) buyer business and earns approximately PHP 10,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase copra for her retail business. 
Rosario has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Rosario hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase copra for her retail business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is from the village of Mabantad. She is 35-years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living she has operated her general store for over three years.  She earns about PHP 12,000 a month.

She wants to expand her family business. That is why she is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, biscuits, shampoo, detergent soap, and ingredients to sell.

Rosalinda hopes to grow and expand her general store to secure her family's future and to educate her children so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life they are striving hard to earn and save for education purposes.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, biscuits, shampoo, detergent soap, and ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Michelle has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years.

Michelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Michelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Laura tiene 23 años de edad y tiene una hija de dos meses de nacida, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la comunidad de Compone y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de leche y criana de animales menores. Laura es una persona trabajadora y estudiosa. Actualmente, Laura estudia la carrera profesional de derecho en una las universidades particulares más prestigiosas de la ciudad del Cusco. Su sueño de Laura es ser notaria pública.   

En esta oportunidad Laura requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado. 

Laura agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Laura belongs to the communal bank San Isidro de Compone and meetings are held every thirty days in the city of Izcuchaca in the community of Compone. Laura is 23 years old and has a daughter two months old. She was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the community of Compone where she works. 

She sells milk and breeds small animals. Laura is a hard-working person and a scholar. She is studying law in one of the most prestigious private universities in the city of Cusco. Laura’s dream is to become a notary public. 

Laura is asking for a loan in order to buy cattle.

She is thankful and grateful for the loan and promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She has nine children, and, currently, only one attends school; most of the older ones are independent. Joyce operates a water kiosk. She began this venture in order to meet her children’s basic and educational needs.  Besides this, Joyce also operates a food stall and a charcoal shop.
Joyce joined Milango in order to access credit to finance her business operations. She has been supplying water to the residents around Changamwe and has applied for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to help her pay water bills and buy plastic jerican drums.
She dreams of running a chain of food stalls, as this will enable her educate the last child who depends on her.

loans.use: to pay water bills and purchase jerican plastic drums.

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is 34 years old and is married with three children aged between 1 and 8 years old. She owns a business selling various goods such as beans, cassava, sorghum, etc. The hours of her work are from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Thacienne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more and various goods such as beans, cassava, sorghum, etc., to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, she will reinvest in her business and she will be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as beans, cassava, sorghum, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria, de 35 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de sus 4 menores hijos, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Orcotuna. El trabajo en el campo es su principal actividad económica. Durante las mañanas ordeña a las 5 vacas que posee, las cuales le brindan de 25 a 30 litros de leche, las que vende a buen precio, pues ya tiene clientela fija. Además siembra alfalfa en terrenos heredados, cuenta que siembra en grandes cantidades, las cuales le permiten obtener dinero pues vende todos los días en una esquina de su localidad, que coincide con la carretera, por lo que es muy visitada, al término del día llega a vender un promedio de 80 nuevos soles, “todo depende de los fardos que llegue a vender”, afirma. Asimismo el restante de alfalfa les sirve para alimento a sus vacas. Ahora desea vender alimentos como papa y verduras, ya que le piden sus clientes constantemente. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Demetria de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de papa “harinosa, blanca y amarilla”, y alfalfa por lotes  para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Demetria, 35, is a responsible woman. She lives with her 4 minor children, whom she is raising in her own home located in the town of Orcotuna. Her principal economic activity is farm work. During the mornings she cares for her 5 cows, which produce 25 to 30 liters of milk that she sells at a good price to an established clientele. As well she cultivates alfalfa on family land. She plants large quantities which she sells every day on a well traveled corner near the highway in her city, earning on average of about 80 nuevos soles a day. “It all depends on the number of bales that I have to sell,” she notes. She uses the leftover alfalfa to feed her cows.

Currently, Demetria wants to sell food such as potatoes and vegetables, since her customers constantly ask for them. This is her fourth loan from MFP and she is grateful for the help she has received which has allowed her to progress in her business. She promises to make her payments on time for her communal bank is made up of responsible and supportive people. Upon receiving your support Demetria will invest 
the money in the purchase of  “floury, white and yellow varieties” of potatoes and batches of alfalfa to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and alfalfa

loans.name: Mercedes  Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra.  Mercedes tiene su negocio de venta de carne y productos lácteos desde hace treinta años en el mercado, ella vende de lunes a sábados desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde.
Ella es casada con cuatro hijos pero solo dos dependen de ella y estos se encuentran uno en la universidad y otro en el colegio.
Ella ha trabajado dos créditos con ceprodel y estos han sido para compra de mercadería para su negocio.
Ella esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en compra de carne y productos lácteos, esto para aprovechar la ventas del mes de Diciembre.
texts.en:
Mercedes has had a business selling meat and dairy products in the market for thirty years.  She sells from Monday to Saturday from 7:00am until 4:00pm.

She is married and has four children, but only two of them are still dependent on her.  One of them is at university and the other is in high school.

She has had two loans from Ceprodel in the past to purchase merchandise for her business.  She is asking for this new loan to purchase meat and dairy products to take advantage of sales in the month of December.

loans.use: to purchase meat and dairy products for her business.

loans.name: Phân

texts.en:
Mrs. Phân is 58 years old and a widow who works as a local cultivator in Kompong Cham province. She has had to be very hard-working in order to raise her 7 children, 3 of whom are married and live independently with their new families. She also raises piglets at home to generate extra income. In addition, 3 of her daughters are working as garment factory sewing staff in Phnom Penh city and contribute some of their income to help the family.

With a loan of 1,000,000 Cambodian riel (KHR), Mrs. Phân will buy breeding piglets to raise. She thanks the financial institution for its constant support, which enables her to achieve her projects in the hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy breeding piglets to raise.

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr:
Sokhna est une femme âgée 35 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois 27 octobre 2008. Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité "TAKKU LIGUEYE"

Elle est coiffeuse de profession. Dans son salon de coiffure elle compte développer un petit commerce de produits cosmétiques. En sus elle fabrique des perruques qu'elle exporter vers l'étranger. 

Avec son nouveau crédit de 275.000 francs cfa elle va renforcer son activité en achetant plus de produits cosmétiques et de mèches pour la fabrication de ses perruques.

Son objectif est d'agrandir son petit commerce afin de toucher le plus grand nombre de clients. Ses profits lui permettront de prendre en charge son fils et d'augmenter ses épargnes dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
Sokhna is a 35-year old woman. She is divorced and has one child, who is in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (village group fund) since 27 October 2008. She belongs to the "Takku Ligueye" solidarity group.

She is a hairstylist by profession. At her hair salon, she intends to develop a small business selling cosmetics. In addition, she makes wigs that she exports abroad.

With her new loan of 275,000 francs CFA, she is going to the strengthen her business by buying more cosmetics and hair extensions to make her wigs.

Her goal is to expand her small business in order to reach more clients. Her profits will allow her to take care of her son and increase her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Kesiah

texts.en: Kesiah is 42 years old, divorced with two children aged 11 and 20. She sells charcoal to earn a living and has been in the business for one year. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to start a retail shop and be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Nhóm 17 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dung operates a food stall, selling fish. She has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Dung is 27 years old, and she is married with three children.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to catch fish to sell.

She is the leader of a five-member group, the Nhóm 17 Bắc Thọ Ngư Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2014, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Dung hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She also hopes for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to catch fish to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 50 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child in school.

Perla is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Perla has been farming rice for 30 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Perla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify maize production

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Mrs. T. is married with three children, who are all attending primary school. When she was young she learned from her mother the weaving process and how to produce Samoan-style handicrafts such as bags, hats and earrings. She decided to make the sale of handicrafts her business because she believes she is very good at it. She is now on her fifth loan which is $2750ST.  The money was used to build two rooms for their house and buy more equipment for the business such as vanish, paints and glues etc. She is planning to get another loan to build a new house for the business to create a small marketplace for her handicrafts.  The loan will also finance accessories needed for her plantation, which helps her with the business and repayments.

loans.use: To purchase bulding materials for the expansion of the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to purchase a pig.

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
Señora Zunilda is 33 years old and she is married. They have 4 children, two are going to school and the other two are too young to go to school at this time. Zunilda and her husband have a nursery where they sell all sorts of flowers. Their specialty are roses which they have in various colors and sizes. They are very sought after by their clients. Besides roses, they also have carnations, daisies, jasmines and about a couple of months ago they began selling sod.

They have clients from other ciities. Some of these clients come all the way to Caacupe to buy their beautiful flowers. They also sell to the local flower shops. There is one particular flower shop located in Asuncion (capital city located 54 km from the city of Caacupe) which buys from them twice a week. In order to have all the orders ready, they start their day from 3:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon.

They are requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD to purchase seeds, water hoses & fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zunilda, tiene 33 años está casada y tiene 4 hijos, los dos más grande van a la escuela y los más pequeños aún no están en edad escolar. Zunilda y su marido tienen un vivero y se dedican a la venta de plantas. Su especialidad son las rosas, que tienen de diferentes colores y tamaños y son los de mayor demanda por sus clientes. Además de las rosas ellos tiene otras flores como claveles, margaritas, jazmines y hace cuestión de unos meses empezaron a vender pasto. Ellos tienen clientes de diferentes ciudades que vienen hasta Caacupé para comprar sus flores, poseen varios clientes fijos como florerías que se abastecen de rosas de su vivero. Dos veces por semana una florería de Asunción (ciudad capital que dista 54 km de la ciudad de Caacupé) hace sus pedidos y para prepararlos ellos empiezan su jornada a las 3 de la mañana y a las 4 vienen a retirarlos. El préstamo que solicita es de $ 200 y los desea invertir en la compra de semillas, mangueras para riegos y abonos.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, water hoses & fertilizer

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia I. lives in her own home with her husband and three children in the city of El Alto (above La Paz) in the zone of Bethlehem’s Star. Cresencia puts the finishing touches on artisan rugs and other products that she sells in the city’s fairs. Her husband is a lower official in the national police. Her plot of land is walled and needs a home constructed on it. Her neighborhood is demanding construction on the land in order to gain access to more works from the mayor’s neighborhood improvement plan. The loan will be used for the construction of two rooms. This is the first time that Cresencia has applied for a loan. A socioecomic analysis has shown her to have good qualifications and approved the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Cresencia I. vive en casa propia en la zona Estrella de Belén de la Ciudad de El Alto, con su esposo y sus tres hijas. La señora Cresencia elabora alfombras artesanalmente, productos que vende en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y su esposo es oficial de baja graduación en la policía nacional. Su lote de terreno se encuentra amurallado y se necesita construir una vivienda, pues el vecindario le esta exigiendo la construcción de la misma para acceder a obras de mejoramiento vecinal por parte de la alcaldía. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of two rooms

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina needed to start a business to be able to pay for the expenses of her home, due to the fact that her husband was the only one in family who worked outside of the home. The family’s expenses grew greater than his income was able to cover. The family was unable to pay their bills and experienced very hard economic times. However, Josefina was determined to save her family and she thought of a business that would allow her to earn enough to pay for the expenses of her family and that also didn’t take away so much time that she would leave her children unattended. That is how she began her business of selling used clothing. She started by asking her father, who worked in the United States, to send her used clothing so that she could sell it to her neighbors and friends.

Little by little, she began getting more and more customers and she needed to buy larger quantities of clothing. For that reason, she is asking for a loan of $500 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to go to Reynosa to buy large quantities of winter clothing which she will sell to her customers. With your help, Josefina and her family will be able to improve their economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Josefina tuvo que obtener un negocio para poder ayudar en los gastos del hogar, puesto que su esposo quien era el único que trabajaba, no supo administrar el dinero que ganaba y los gastos cada vez se iban haciendo más grandes de lo que ganaba y poco a poco con los recibos de luz agua, y los gastos que tenían sus hijos fueron entrando en una crisis. Sin embargo la lucha por salir adelante hizo que Josefina pudiera pensar con claridad en un negocio que les dejara lo suficiente para poder completar con los gastos del hogar, y no le quitara tanto tiempo como para descuidar el crecimiento de sus hijos. Fue así como comenzó a pedirle a su papá quien trabaja en Estados Unidos que le mandara ropa usada para ella poder ofrecérselas a sus vecinas y amigas.

Poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientas y está teniendo la necesidad de comprar por más cantidades la ropa. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá ir a Reynosa a comprar por mayoreo ropa usada de invierno para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecerles a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Josefina y su familia podrán salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy winter clothes

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Ms. Marlene lives in La Libertad and is the single mother of two children, who depend on her income. She learned sewing and dressmaking in order to make a living for her family. She has 10 years of experience in the business, and this has greatly contributed to her good reputation as a dressmaker in the area. She offers tailoring services, along with the production of garments that she distributes to markets and bazaars of nearby regions. She started her business with very little, but has made a great effort to grow, in spite of the difficulties imposed by being the sole provider for her family. She needs the loan in order to stock on the fabrics that she sells to her clients, as well as on accessories for the production of the garments sold to the bazaars.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Marlene vive en La Libertad y es madre soltera de dos hijos, que dependen de sus ingresos. Aprendió costura ya que se vió en la necesidad de obtener ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Hasta la fecha tiene diez años de experiencia en este negocio, lo cual ha contribuido en gran manera para que las personas de la zona la reconozcan como una buen costurera. Los servicios que ella presta son la costura a medida y elaboración de prendas de vestir para distribuir en los mercados y bazares de la zonas aledañas. Ella inició su negocio con poco, pero ha tratado en gran manera de poder ir incrementándolo, aunque no le ha sido fácil, ya que tiene que correr con todos los gastos de su grupo familiar. El financiamiento lo necesita para surtir las telas que vende a sus clientes y accesorios para la elaboración de prendas para los bazares.

loans.use: She is in the dressmaking business and needs to purchase fabrics and accessories for the garments she will sell in the present season.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mirsaid

texts.en:
Mirsaid C. is 30 years old. He is married and has two children.

Mirsaid sells rice in the largest local market of the city. He has been in this business for six years already, during which time he has become an expert in rice. It should be mentioned that rice is very popular in Tajikistan. One of the most widely spread meals, called “plov,” is made with rice. Plov is cooked very often; you can hardly find any family occasion that can be conducted without that delicious meal. There are various types of plov, and each depends upon the meat and the rice that are used for cooking. So Mirsaid is not only a seller but also a rather important person for his customers, as he is ready to give good advice in choosing the type of rice.

Today Mirsaid requests 3,450 somoni ($1,000 in US dollars) for the term of nine months. He shall use the loan to purchase rice to sell. This is his second loan with IMON. The previous one was managed accurately without delinquencies or violations. Mirsaid thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To increase his stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Gladis' Group

texts.en:
Gladis and Herlinda belong to the community bank “Virgen del Carmen”. Gladis has been a member for five years and Herlinda for one year. In that time they have learned responsibility, punctuality and improved their business skills. They say that in the community bank not only have they learned valuable skills but have found support and companionship.

Gladis is 34 years old. She is married and has four children, aged fifteen and younger. Gladis has a store where she sells tara. Tara is a type of tree that is typical of the region; the fruit from the tree is used to make industrial products. She has been selling tara for several years, but was only able to open her store since joining the community bank.

Herlinda has been a member of the community bank for one year. She speaks some Spanish, but mainly Quechua; luckily with the help of Gladis we were able to understand each other. Herlinda sells Tara and cochinilla, which is a small insect used to make red dye. She collects the products in the countryside and then sells them to a middleman who takes them to Lima.

Gladis and Herlinda need loans of 900 and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their businesses by buying more tara and cochinilla.

One of the most important featured of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Gladis and Herlinda plan to use their savings in the case of an emergency and to make more capital available to their business. Their dreams are to continue developing their businesses.

loans.use: Gladis and Herlinda need loans of 900 and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in their businesses by buying more tara and cochinilla.

loans.name: Sébastienne

texts.fr:
Born in COTONOU around 1975, Mrs O. Sébastienne is married and mother of 5 children. Operating for the last few years in the market DEGAKON in AKPAKPA, she quickly established herself in a competative environment. Right now, she is in a period where business is not good for her because of a lack of capital to restock her supplies with different products. She is also a distributor of water in bags, affectionately called PURE WATER because of the hygenic conditions underwhich it is bagged. She is asking for this loan in order to relaunch her business and meet the demands of her clientele and position herself well in a business environment that is more and more competitive.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à COTONOU dans les années 1975, dame O. Sébastienne est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Implantée depuis quelques années dans le marché DEGAKON à AKPAKPA, elle s’est vite imposée dans son environnement concurrentiel. Actuellement, elle est dans une période où les activites ne tournent pas bien pour elle faute de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner en divers produits. Elle est aussi distributrice de l’eau mise en sachet affectueusement appelée PURE WATER du fait des conditions hygiéniques qui entourent la mise en sachet. Elle sollicite pour ces raisons ce crédit afin de relancer son activité, de faire face aux demandes de sa clientèle et de bien se positionner dans l’environnement de plus en plus concurrentiel dans lequel elle exerce.

loans.use: purchase of 30 cases of spaghetti, 5 cases of tomatoes and milk and a ton of cooking oil

loans.name: Lamaranah

texts.en: Lamaranah has been a member of the Aldi Forty group for a while now and has been participating only in the savings group.  She is now ready to access a loan to both grow her business and satisfy her clients' demands.  She owns a small food items kiosk in the Dogolia market in Sierra Leone.  She needs business capital to purchase sufficient amounts of food items to sell.  She is therefore requesting a loan of Le 800,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies for her food stall
